gimp-image-convert-color-profile

NAME
gimp-image-convert-color-profile
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_convert_color_profile(image, num-bytes, color-profile, intent, bpc)
BLURB
Convert the image's layers to a color profile
HELP
This procedure converts from the image's color profile (or the default RGB or grayscale profile if none is set) to the given color profile. Only RGB and grayscale color profiles are accepted, according to the image's type.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
num-bytesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of bytes in the color_profile array (num-bytes >= 0)
color-profileGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYThe serialized color profile
intentGIMP_PDB_INT32Rendering intent {
COLOR-RENDERING-INTENT-PERCEPTUAL (0)
COLOR-RENDERING-INTENT-RELATIVE-COLORIMETRIC (1)
COLOR-RENDERING-INTENT-SATURATION (2)
COLOR-RENDERING-INTENT-ABSOLUTE-COLORIMETRIC (3)
}
bpcGIMP_PDB_INT32Black point compensation (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2015 Michael Natterer

gimp-drawable-merge-shadow

NAME
gimp-drawable-merge-shadow
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_merge_shadow(drawable, undo)
BLURB
Merge the shadow buffer with the specified drawable.
HELP
This procedure combines the contents of the drawable's shadow buffer (for temporary processing) with the specified drawable. The 'undo' parameter specifies whether to add an undo step for the operation. Requesting no undo is useful for such applications as 'auto-apply'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
undoGIMP_PDB_INT32Push merge to undo stack? (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-new

NAME
gimp-image-new
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.gimp_image_new(width, height, type)
BLURB
Creates a new image with the specified width, height, and type.
HELP
Creates a new image, undisplayed, with the specified extents and type. A layer should be created and added before this image is displayed, or subsequent calls to 'gimp-display-new' with this image as an argument will fail. Layers can be created using the 'gimp-layer-new' commands. They can be added to an image using the 'gimp-image-insert-layer' command. If your image's type if INDEXED, a colormap must also be added with 'gimp-image-set-colormap'. An indexed image without a colormap will output unexpected colors.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
widthGIMP_PDB_INT32The width of the image (1 <= width <= 524288)
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32The height of the image (1 <= height <= 524288)
typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of image {
RGB (0)
GRAY (1)
INDEXED (2)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe ID of the newly created image
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-get-channel-by-name

(c)2011 Michael Natterer

gimp-edit-paste-as-new-image

NAME
gimp-edit-paste-as-new-image
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.gimp_edit_paste_as_new_image()
BLURB
Paste buffer to a new image.
HELP
This procedure pastes a copy of the internal GIMP edit buffer to a new image. The GIMP edit buffer will be empty unless a call was previously made to either 'gimp-edit-cut' or 'gimp-edit-copy'. This procedure returns the new image or -1 if the edit buffer was empty.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe new image
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2005 Michael Natterer

file-xbm-save

NAME
file-xbm-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_xbm_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, comment, x10, x-hot, y-hot, prefix, write-mask, mask-extension)
BLURB
Export a file in X10 or X11 bitmap (XBM) file format
HELP
Export a file in X10 or X11 bitmap (XBM) file format. XBM is a lossless format for flat black-and-white (two color indexed) images.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to export
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to export
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name entered
commentGIMP_PDB_STRINGImage description (maximum 72 bytes)
x10GIMP_PDB_INT32Export in X10 format
x-hotGIMP_PDB_INT32X coordinate of hotspot
y-hotGIMP_PDB_INT32Y coordinate of hotspot
prefixGIMP_PDB_STRINGIdentifier prefix [determined from filename]
write-maskGIMP_PDB_INT32(0 = ignore, 1 = save as extra file)
mask-extensionGIMP_PDB_STRINGExtension of the mask file
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Gordon Matzigkeit
(c)1998 Gordon Matzigkeit

}

file-ps-load-setargs

NAME
file-ps-load-setargs
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_ps_load_setargs(resolution, width, height, check-bbox, pages, coloring, text-alpha-bits, graphic-alpha-bits)
BLURB
set additional parameters for procedure file-ps-load
HELP
set additional parameters for procedure file-ps-load
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
resolutionGIMP_PDB_INT32Resolution to interpret image (dpi)
widthGIMP_PDB_INT32Desired width
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32Desired height
check-bboxGIMP_PDB_INT320: Use width/height, 1: Use BoundingBox
pagesGIMP_PDB_STRINGPages to load (e.g.: 1,3,5-7)
coloringGIMP_PDB_INT324: b/w, 5: grey, 6: color image, 7: automatic
text-alpha-bitsGIMP_PDB_INT321, 2, or 4
graphic-alpha-bitsGIMP_PDB_INT321, 2, or 4
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Peter Kirchgessner
(c)v1.17 19-Sep-2004 Peter Kirchgessner

gimp-image-grid-get-offset

NAME
gimp-image-grid-get-offset
SYNOPSIS
xoffset, yoffset = pdb.gimp_image_grid_get_offset(image)
BLURB
Gets the offset of an image's grid.
HELP
This procedure retrieves the horizontal and vertical offset of an image's grid. It takes the image as parameter.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
xoffsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe image's grid horizontal offset
yoffsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe image's grid vertical offset
AUTHOR
Sylvain Foret
(c)2005 Sylvain Foret

file-dicom-load

NAME

SYNOPSIS

BLURB
loads files of the dicom file format
HELP

NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

}

drawable1GIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEFirst input drawable

drawable4GIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEFourth input drawable

gimp-image-undo-thaw

NAME
gimp-image-undo-thaw
SYNOPSIS
thawed = pdb.gimp_image_undo_thaw(image)
BLURB
Thaw the image's undo stack.
HELP
This procedure thaws the image's undo stack, allowing subsequent operations to store their undo steps. This is generally called in conjunction with 'gimp-image-undo-freeze' to temporarily freeze an image undo stack. 'gimp-image-undo-thaw' does NOT free the undo stack as 'gimp-image-undo-enable' does, so is suited for situations where one wishes to leave the undo stack in the same state in which one found it despite non-destructively playing with the image in the meantime. An example would be in-situ plug-in previews. Balancing freezes and thaws and ensuring image consistency is the responsibility of the caller.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
thawedGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if the image undo has been thawed (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Adam D. Moss
(c)1999 Adam D. Moss

gimp-edit-cut

NAME
gimp-edit-cut
SYNOPSIS
non-empty = pdb.gimp_edit_cut(drawable)
BLURB
Cut from the specified drawable.
HELP
If there is a selection in the image, then the area specified by the selection is cut from the specified drawable and placed in an internal GIMP edit buffer. It can subsequently be retrieved using the 'gimp-edit-paste' command. If there is no selection, then the specified drawable will be removed and its contents stored in the internal GIMP edit buffer. This procedure will fail if the selected area lies completely outside the bounds of the current drawable and there is nothing to copy from.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable to cut from
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
non-emptyGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if the cut was successful, FALSE if there was nothing to copy from (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-edit-fill

NAME
gimp-edit-fill
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_edit_fill(drawable, fill-type)
BLURB
Fill selected area of drawable.
HELP
This procedure fills the specified drawable with the fill mode. If the fill mode is foreground, the current foreground color is used. If the fill mode is background, the current background color is used. Other fill modes should not be used. This procedure only affects regions within a selection if there is a selection active. If you want to fill the whole drawable, regardless of the selection, use 'gimp-drawable-fill'. Deprecated: Use 'gimp-drawable-edit-fill' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable to fill to
fill-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of fill {
FILL-FOREGROUND (0)
FILL-BACKGROUND (1)
FILL-WHITE (2)
FILL-TRANSPARENT (3)
FILL-PATTERN (4)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis & Raphael Quinet
(c)1995-2000 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-fuzzy-select

NAME
gimp-fuzzy-select
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_fuzzy_select(drawable, x, y, threshold, operation, antialias, feather, feather-radius, sample-merged)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-image-select-contiguous-color' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-image-select-contiguous-color' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

xGIMP_PDB_FLOATx coordinate of initial seed fill point: (image coordinates)
yGIMP_PDB_FLOATy coordinate of initial seed fill point: (image coordinates)
thresholdGIMP_PDB_INT32Threshold in intensity levels (0 <= threshold <= 255)
operationGIMP_PDB_INT32The selection operation {
CHANNEL-OP-ADD (0)
CHANNEL-OP-SUBTRACT (1)
CHANNEL-OP-REPLACE (2)
CHANNEL-OP-INTERSECT (3)
}
antialiasGIMP_PDB_INT32Antialiasing (TRUE or FALSE)
featherGIMP_PDB_INT32Feather option for selections (TRUE or FALSE)
feather-radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius for feather operation (feather-radius >= 0)
sample-mergedGIMP_PDB_INT32Use the composite image, not the drawable (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR

(c)

gimp-help

NAME
gimp-help
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_help(help-domain, help-id)
BLURB
Load a help page.
HELP
This procedure loads the specified help page into the helpbrowser or what ever is configured as help viewer. The help page is identified by its domain and ID: if help_domain is NULL, we use the help_domain which was registered using the 'gimp-plugin-help-register' procedure. If help_domain is NULL and no help domain was registered, the help domain of the main GIMP installation is used.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
help-domainGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe help domain in which help_id is registered
help-idGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe help page's ID
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2000 Michael Natterer

plug-in-curve-bend

NAME
plug-in-curve-bend
SYNOPSIS
bent-layer = pdb.plug_in_curve_bend(run-mode, image, drawable, rotation, smoothing, antialias, work-on-copy, curve-type, argc-upper-point-x, upper-point-x, argc-upper-point-y, upper-point-y, argc-lower-point-x, lower-point-x, argc-lower-point-y, lower-point-y, argc-upper-val-y, upper-val-y, argc-lower-val-y, lower-val-y)
BLURB
Bend the image using two control curves
HELP
This plug-in does bend the active layer If there is a current selection it is copied to floating selection and the curve_bend distortion is done on the floating selection. If work_on_copy parameter is TRUE, the curve_bend distortion is done on a copy of the active layer (or floating selection). The upper and lower edges are bent in shape of 2 spline curves. both (upper and lower) curves are determined by upto 17 points or by 256 Y-Values if curve_type == 1 (freehand mode) If rotation is not 0, the layer is rotated before and rotated back after the bend operation. This enables bending in other directions than vertical. bending usually changes the size of the handled layer. this plug-in sets the offsets of the handled layer to keep its center at the same position
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable (must be a layer without layermask)
rotationGIMP_PDB_FLOATDirection {
angle 0 to 360 degree
} of the bend effect
smoothingGIMP_PDB_INT32Smoothing {
TRUE
FALSE
}
antialiasGIMP_PDB_INT32Antialias {
TRUE
FALSE
}
work-on-copyGIMP_PDB_INT32{
TRUE
FALSE
} TRUE: copy the drawable and bend the copy
curve-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32 {
0
1
} 0 == smooth (use 17 points)
1 == freehand (use 256 val_y)
argc-upper-point-xGIMP_PDB_INT32{
2 <= argc <= 17
}
upper-point-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYarray of 17 x point_koords {
0.0 <= x <= 1.0 or -1 for unused point
}
argc-upper-point-yGIMP_PDB_INT32{
2 <= argc <= 17
}
upper-point-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYarray of 17 y point_koords {
0.0 <= y <= 1.0 or -1 for unused point
}
argc-lower-point-xGIMP_PDB_INT32{
2 <= argc <= 17
}
lower-point-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYarray of 17 x point_koords {
0.0 <= x <= 1.0 or -1 for unused point
}
argc-lower-point-yGIMP_PDB_INT32{
2 <= argc <= 17
}
lower-point-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYarray of 17 y point_koords {
0.0 <= y <= 1.0 or -1 for unused point
}
argc-upper-val-yGIMP_PDB_INT32{
256
}
upper-val-yGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYarray of 256 y freehand koord {
0 <= y <= 255
}
argc-lower-val-yGIMP_PDB_INT32{
256
}
lower-val-yGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYarray of 256 y freehand koord {
0 <= y <= 255
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
bent-layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERthe handled layer
AUTHOR
Wolfgang Hofer (hof@@hotbot.com)
(c)v1.3.18 (2003/08/26) Wolfgang Hofer

gimp-item-transform-flip-simple

NAME
gimp-item-transform-flip-simple
SYNOPSIS
item = pdb.gimp_item_transform_flip_simple(item, flip-type, auto-center, axis)
BLURB
Flip the specified item either vertically or horizontally.
HELP
This procedure flips the specified item. If a selection exists and the item is a drawable, the portion of the drawable which lies under the selection is cut from the drawable and made into a floating selection which is then flipped. If auto_center is set to TRUE, the flip is around the selection's center. Otherwise, the coordinate of the axis needs to be specified. The return value is the ID of the flipped floating selection. If there is no selection or the item is not a drawable, the entire item will be flipped around its center if auto_center is set to TRUE, otherwise the coordinate of the axis needs to be specified. Additionally, if the item has its linked flag set to TRUE, all additional items contained in the image which have the linked flag set to TRUE will also be flipped around the same axis. The return value will be equal to the item ID supplied as input. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-transform-resize'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe affected item
flip-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of flip {
ORIENTATION-HORIZONTAL (0)
ORIENTATION-VERTICAL (1)
}
auto-centerGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to automatically position the axis in the selection center (TRUE or FALSE)
axisGIMP_PDB_FLOATcoord. of flip axis
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe flipped item
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2004 Michael Natterer

plug-in-gimpressionist

gimp-drawable-equalize

NAME
gimp-drawable-equalize
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_equalize(drawable, mask-only)
BLURB
Equalize the contents of the specified drawable.
HELP
This procedure equalizes the contents of the specified drawable. Each intensity channel is equalized independently. The equalized intensity is given as inten' = (255 - inten). The 'mask_only' option specifies whether to adjust only the area of the image within the selection bounds, or the entire image based on the histogram of the selected area. If there is no selection, the entire image is adjusted based on the histogram for the entire image.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
mask-onlyGIMP_PDB_INT32Equalization option (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

script-fu-add-bevel

NAME
script-fu-add-bevel
SYNOPSIS
pdb.script_fu_add_bevel(run-mode, image, drawable, value, toggle, toggle)
BLURB
Add a beveled border to an image
HELP
MENUPATH
Temporary Procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEImage
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATThickness
toggleGIMP_PDB_INT32Work on copy
toggleGIMP_PDB_INT32Keep bump layer
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Andrew Donkin
(c)1997/11/06 Andrew Donkin

gimp-context-set-transform-direction

NAME
gimp-context-set-transform-direction
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_transform_direction(transform-direction)
BLURB
Set the transform direction.
HELP
This procedure modifies the transform direction setting. This setting affects affects the following procedures: 'gimp-item-transform-flip', 'gimp-item-transform-perspective', 'gimp-item-transform-rotate', 'gimp-item-transform-scale', 'gimp-item-transform-shear', 'gimp-item-transform-2d', 'gimp-item-transform-matrix'.

Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

TRANSFORM-FORWARD (0)
TRANSFORM-BACKWARD (1)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

gimp-heal

NAME
gimp-heal
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_heal(drawable, src-drawable, src-x, src-y, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Heal from the source to the dest drawable using the current brush
HELP
This tool heals the source drawable starting at the specified source coordinates to the dest drawable. For image healing, if the sum of the src coordinates and subsequent stroke offsets exceeds the extents of the src drawable, then no paint is transferred. The healing tool is capable of transforming between any image types except RGB->Indexed.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
src-drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe source drawable
src-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe x coordinate in the source image
src-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe y coordinate in the source image
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Kevin Sookocheff
(c)2006 Kevin Sookocheff

gimp-context-get-sample-threshold

(c)2005 Simon Budig

plug-in-gauss

NAME
plug-in-gauss
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_gauss(run-mode, image, drawable, horizontal, vertical, method)
BLURB
Simplest, most commonly used way of blurring
HELP
Applies a gaussian blur to the drawable, with specified radius of affect. The standard deviation of the normal distribution used to modify pixel values is calculated based on the supplied radius. Horizontal and vertical blurring can be independently invoked by specifying only one to run. The 'method' parameter is ignored.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
horizontalGIMP_PDB_FLOATHorizontal radius of gaussian blur (in pixels (0 <= horizontal <= 500)
verticalGIMP_PDB_FLOATVertical radius of gaussian blur (in pixels (0 <= vertical <= 500)
methodGIMP_PDB_INT32Blur method {
IIR (0)
RLE (1)
} (0 <= method <= 1)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:gaussian-blur' for credits.
(c)2014 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:gaussian-blur' for credits.

gimp-image-is-dirty

NAME
gimp-image-is-dirty
SYNOPSIS
dirty = pdb.gimp_image_is_dirty(image)
BLURB
Checks if the image has unsaved changes.
HELP
This procedure checks the specified image's dirty count to see if it needs to be saved. Note that saving the image does not automatically set the dirty count to 0, you need to call 'gimp-image-clean-all' after calling a save procedure to make the image clean.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
dirtyGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if the image has unsaved changes. (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-selection-border

NAME
gimp-selection-border
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_selection_border(image, radius)
BLURB
Border the image's selection
HELP
This procedure borders the selection. Bordering creates a new selection which is defined along the boundary of the previous selection at every point within the specified radius.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
radiusGIMP_PDB_INT32Radius of border (in pixels) (radius >= 0)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-lens-distortion

NAME
plug-in-lens-distortion
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_lens_distortion(run-mode, image, drawable, offset-x, offset-y, main-adjust, edge-adjust, rescale, brighten)
BLURB
Corrects lens distortion
HELP
Corrects barrel or pincushion lens distortion.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
offset-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATEffect centre offset in X (-100 <= offset-x <= 100)
offset-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATEffect centre offset in Y (-100 <= offset-y <= 100)
main-adjustGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmount of second-order distortion (-100 <= main-adjust <= 100)
edge-adjustGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmount of fourth-order distortion (-100 <= edge-adjust <= 100)
rescaleGIMP_PDB_FLOATRescale overall image size (-100 <= rescale <= 100)
brightenGIMP_PDB_FLOATAdjust brightness in corners (-100 <= brighten <= 100)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:lens-distortion' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:lens-distortion' for credits.

plug-in-warp

NAME
plug-in-warp
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_warp(run-mode, image, drawable, amount, warp-map, iter, dither, angle, wrap-type, mag-map, mag-use, substeps, grad-map, grad-scale, vector-map, vector-scale, vector-angle)
BLURB
Twist or smear image in many different ways
HELP
Smears an image along vector paths calculated as the gradient of a separate control matrix. The effect can look like brushstrokes of acrylic or watercolor paint, in some cases.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
amountGIMP_PDB_FLOATPixel displacement multiplier
warp-mapGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDisplacement control map
iterGIMP_PDB_INT32Iteration count (last required argument)
ditherGIMP_PDB_FLOATRandom dither amount (first optional argument)
angleGIMP_PDB_FLOATAngle of gradient vector rotation
wrap-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Edge behavior: {
WRAP (0)
SMEAR (1)
BLACK (2)
COLOR (3)
}
mag-mapGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEMagnitude control map
mag-useGIMP_PDB_INT32Use magnitude map: {
FALSE (0)
TRUE (1)
}
substepsGIMP_PDB_INT32Substeps between image updates
grad-mapGIMP_PDB_INT32Gradient control map
grad-scaleGIMP_PDB_FLOATScaling factor for gradient map (0=don't use)
vector-mapGIMP_PDB_INT32Fixed vector control map
vector-scaleGIMP_PDB_FLOATScaling factor for fixed vector map (0=don't use)
vector-angleGIMP_PDB_FLOATAngle for fixed vector map
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
John P. Beale
(c)1997 John P. Beale

gimp-path-get-points

NAME
gimp-path-get-points
SYNOPSIS
path-type, path-closed, num-path-point-details, points-pairs = pdb.gimp_path_get_points(image, name)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-vectors-stroke-get-points' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-vectors-stroke-get-points' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image to list the paths from
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the path whose points should be listed.
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
path-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of the path. Currently only one type (1 = Bezier) is supported
path-closedGIMP_PDB_INT32Return if the path is closed. (0 = path open, 1 = path closed)
num-path-point-detailsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of points returned. Each point is made up of (x, y, pnt_type) of floats. (num-path-point-details >= 0)
points-pairsGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYThe points in the path represented as 3 floats. The first is the x pos, next is the y pos, last is the type of the pnt. The type field is dependent on the path type. For beziers (type 1 paths) the type can either be (1.0 = BEZIER_ANCHOR, 2.0 = BEZIER_CONTROL, 3.0 = BEZIER_MOVE). Note all points are returned in pixel resolution.
AUTHOR

(c)

gimp-image-undo-enable

NAME
gimp-image-undo-enable
SYNOPSIS
enabled = pdb.gimp_image_undo_enable(image)
BLURB
Enable the image's undo stack.
HELP
This procedure enables the image's undo stack, allowing subsequent operations to store their undo steps. This is generally called in conjunction with 'gimp-image-undo-disable' to temporarily disable an image undo stack.

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES

Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-item-delete

NAME
gimp-item-delete
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_item_delete(item)
BLURB
Delete a item.
HELP
This procedure deletes the specified item. This must not be done if the image containing this item was already deleted or if the item was already removed from the image. The only case in which this procedure is useful is if you want to get rid of a item which has not yet been added to an image.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe item to delete
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-merge-down

NAME
gimp-image-merge-down
SYNOPSIS
layer = pdb.gimp_image_merge_down(image, merge-layer, merge-type)
BLURB
Merge the layer passed and the first visible layer below.
HELP
This procedure combines the passed layer and the first visible layer below it using the specified merge type. A merge type of EXPAND_AS_NECESSARY expands the final layer to encompass the areas of the visible layers. A merge type of CLIP_TO_IMAGE clips the final layer to the extents of the image. A merge type of CLIP_TO_BOTTOM_LAYER clips the final layer to the size of the bottommost layer.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
merge-layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer to merge down from
merge-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of merge {
EXPAND-AS-NECESSARY (0)
CLIP-TO-IMAGE (1)
CLIP-TO-BOTTOM-LAYER (2)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe resulting layer
AUTHOR
Larry Ewing
(c)1998 Larry Ewing

gimp-procedural-db-get-data

NAME
gimp-procedural-db-get-data
SYNOPSIS
bytes, data = pdb.gimp_procedural_db_get_data(identifier)
BLURB
Returns data associated with the specified identifier.
HELP
This procedure returns any data which may have been associated with the specified identifier. The data is a variable length array of bytes. If no data has been associated with the identifier, an error is returned.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
identifierGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe identifier associated with data
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
bytesGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of bytes in the data (bytes >= 1)
dataGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYA byte array containing data
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-c-astretch

NAME
plug-in-c-astretch
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_c_astretch(run-mode, image, drawable)
BLURB
Stretch contrast to cover the maximum possible range
HELP
This simple plug-in does an automatic contrast stretch. For each channel in the image, it finds the minimum and maximum values... it uses those values to stretch the individual histograms to the full contrast range. For some images it may do just what you want; for others it may not work that well.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:stretch-contrast' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:stretch-contrast' for credits.

gimp-dynamics-get-list

NAME
gimp-dynamics-get-list
SYNOPSIS
num-dynamics, dynamics-list = pdb.gimp_dynamics_get_list(filter)
BLURB
Retrieve the list of loaded paint dynamics.
HELP
This procedure returns a list of the paint dynamics that are currently available.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
filterGIMP_PDB_STRINGAn optional regular expression used to filter the list
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
num-dynamicsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of available paint dynamics (num-dynamics >= 0)
dynamics-listGIMP_PDB_STRINGARRAYThe list of paint dynamics names
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2011 Michael Natterer

file-eps-save

NAME
file-eps-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_eps_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, width, height, x-offset, y-offset, unit, keep-ratio, rotation, eps-flag, preview, level)
BLURB
export image as Encapsulated PostScript image
HELP
PostScript exporting handles all image types except those with alpha channels.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to export
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to export the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to export the image in
widthGIMP_PDB_FLOATWidth of the image in PostScript file (0: use input image size)
heightGIMP_PDB_FLOATHeight of image in PostScript file (0: use input image size)
x-offsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATX-offset to image from lower left corner
y-offsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATY-offset to image from lower left corner
unitGIMP_PDB_INT32Unit for width/height/offset. 0: inches, 1: millimeters
keep-ratioGIMP_PDB_INT320: use width/height, 1: keep aspect ratio
rotationGIMP_PDB_INT320, 90, 180, 270
eps-flagGIMP_PDB_INT320: PostScript, 1: Encapsulated PostScript
previewGIMP_PDB_INT320: no preview, >0: max. size of preview
levelGIMP_PDB_INT321: PostScript Level 1, 2: PostScript Level 2
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Peter Kirchgessner
(c)v1.17 19-Sep-2004 Peter Kirchgessner

file-raw-set-defaults

file-raw-set-defaults
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_raw_set_defaults(image-type, palette-type)
BLURB
Set the current set of defaults used by the raw image dump plug-in
HELP
This procedure sets the current set of defaults stored as a parasite for the raw image data dump plug-in. These defaults are used to seed the UI, by the file_raw_save_defaults procedure, and by gimp_file_save when it detects to use RAW.

gimp-smudge-default

NAME
gimp-smudge-default
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_smudge_default(drawable, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Smudge image with varying pressure.
HELP
This tool simulates a smudge using the current brush. It behaves exactly the same as 'gimp-smudge' except that the pressure value is taken from the smudge tool options or the options default if the tools option dialog has not been activated.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES

gimp-image-set-active-layer

NAME
gimp-image-set-active-layer
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_set_active_layer(image, active-layer)
BLURB
Sets the specified image's active layer.
HELP
If the layer exists, it is set as the active layer in the image. Any previous active layer or channel is set to inactive. An exception is a previously existing floating selection, in which case this procedure will return an execution error.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
active-layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe new image active layer
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-gauss-rle2

NAME
plug-in-gauss-rle2
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_gauss_rle2(run-mode, image, drawable, horizontal, vertical)
BLURB
Apply a gaussian blur
HELP
Applies a gaussian blur to the drawable, with specified radius of affect. The standard deviation of the normal distribution used to modify pixel values is calculated based on the supplied radius. Horizontal and vertical blurring can be independently invoked by specifying only one to run.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
horizontalGIMP_PDB_FLOATHorizontal radius of gaussian blur (in pixels (0 <= horizontal <= 500)
verticalGIMP_PDB_FLOATVertical radius of gaussian blur (in pixels (0 <= vertical <= 500)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:gaussian-blur' for credits.
(c)2014 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:gaussian-blur' for credits.

plug-in-nova

NAME
plug-in-nova
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_nova(run-mode, image, drawable, xcenter, ycenter, color, radius, nspoke, randomhue)
BLURB
Add a starburst to the image
HELP
This plug-in produces an effect like a supernova burst. The amount of the light effect is approximately in proportion to 1/r, where r is the distance from the center of the star.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
xcenterGIMP_PDB_INT32X coordinates of the center of supernova
ycenterGIMP_PDB_INT32Y coordinates of the center of supernova
colorGIMP_PDB_COLORColor of supernova
radiusGIMP_PDB_INT32Radius of supernova (1 <= radius <= 3000)
nspokeGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of spokes (1 <= nspoke <= 1024)
randomhueGIMP_PDB_INT32Random hue (0 <= randomhue <= 360)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:supernova' for credits.
(c)2014 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:supernova' for credits.

(c)

gimp-layer-create-mask

NAME
gimp-layer-create-mask
SYNOPSIS
mask = pdb.gimp_layer_create_mask(layer, mask-type)
BLURB
Create a layer mask for the specified layer.
HELP
This procedure creates a layer mask for the specified layer. Layer masks serve as an additional alpha channel for a layer. Different types of masks are allowed for initialisation: - white mask (leaves the layer fully visible); - black mask (gives the layer complete transparency); - the layer's alpha channel (either a copy, or a transfer, which leaves the layer fully visible, but which may be more useful than a white mask); - the current selection; - a grayscale copy of the layer; - or a copy of the active channel. The layer mask still needs to be added to the layer. This can be done with a call to 'gimp-layer-add-mask'. 'gimp-layer-create-mask' will fail if there are no active channels on the image, when called with 'ADD-CHANNEL-MASK'. It will return a black mask when called with 'ADD-ALPHA-MASK' or 'ADD-ALPHA-TRANSFER-MASK' on a layer with no alpha channels, or with 'ADD-SELECTION-MASK' when there is no selection on the image.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer to which to add the mask
mask-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of mask {
ADD-MASK-WHITE (0)
ADD-MASK-BLACK (1)
ADD-MASK-ALPHA (2)
ADD-MASK-ALPHA-TRANSFER (3)
ADD-MASK-SELECTION (4)
ADD-MASK-COPY (5)
ADD-MASK-CHANNEL (6)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
maskGIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe newly created mask
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-drawable-transform-shear

NAME
gimp-drawable-transform-shear
SYNOPSIS
drawable = pdb.gimp_drawable_transform_shear(drawable, shear-type, magnitude, transform-direction, interpolation, supersample, recursion-level, clip-result)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-shear' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-shear' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
shear-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of shear {
ORIENTATION-HORIZONTAL (0)
ORIENTATION-VERTICAL (1)
}
magnitudeGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe magnitude of the shear
transform-directionGIMP_PDB_INT32Direction of transformation {
TRANSFORM-FORWARD (0)
TRANSFORM-BACKWARD (1)
}
interpolationGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of interpolation {
INTERPOLATION-NONE (0)
INTERPOLATION-LINEAR (1)
INTERPOLATION-CUBIC (2)
INTERPOLATION-NOHALO (3)
INTERPOLATION-LOHALO (4)
}
supersampleGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (TRUE or FALSE)
recursion-levelGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (recursion-level >= 1)
clip-resultGIMP_PDB_INT32How to clip results {
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-ADJUST (0)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CLIP (1)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP (2)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP-WITH-ASPECT (3)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe sheared drawable
AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno
(c)2004 João S. O. Bueno

gimp-layer-scale

NAME
gimp-layer-scale
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_layer_scale(layer, new-width, new-height, local-origin)
BLURB
Scale the layer using the default interpolation method.
HELP
This procedure scales the layer so that its new width and height are equal to the supplied parameters. The 'local-origin' parameter specifies whether to scale from the center of the layer, or from the image origin. This operation only works if the layer has been added to an image. The interpolation method used can be set with 'gimp-context-set-interpolation'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer
new-widthGIMP_PDB_INT32New layer width (1 <= new-width <= 524288)
new-heightGIMP_PDB_INT32New layer height (1 <= new-height <= 524288)
local-originGIMP_PDB_INT32Use a local origin (as opposed to the image origin) (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-gradient-segment-range-blend-opacity

NAME
gimp-gradient-segment-range-blend-opacity
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_gradient_segment_range_blend_opacity(name, start-segment, end-segment)
BLURB
Blend the opacity of the segment range.
HELP
This function blends the opacity (but not the colors) of the segments' range of the gradient. Using it, the opacity's transition will be uniform across the range.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe gradient name
start-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the first segment to operate on (start-segment >= 0)
end-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the last segment to operate on. If negative, the selection will extend to the end of the string.
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Shlomi Fish
(c)2003 Shlomi Fish

plug-in-unsharp-mask

NAME
plug-in-unsharp-mask
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_unsharp_mask(run-mode, image, drawable, radius, amount, threshold)
BLURB
The most widely useful method for sharpening an image
HELP
The unsharp mask is a sharpening filter that works by comparing using the difference of the image and a blurred version of the image. It is commonly used on photographic images, and is provides a much more pleasing result than the standard sharpen filter.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius of gaussian blur (0 <= radius <= 300)
amountGIMP_PDB_FLOATStrength of effect (0 <= amount <= 300)
thresholdGIMP_PDB_INT32Threshold (0 <= threshold <= 255)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:unsharp-mask' for credits.
(c)2018 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:unsharp-mask' for credits.

plug-in-animationoptimize

NAME
plug-in-animationoptimize
SYNOPSIS
result = pdb.plug_in_animationoptimize(run-mode, image, drawable)
BLURB
Modify image to reduce size when saved as GIF animation
HELP
This procedure applies various optimizations to a GIMP layer-based animation in an attempt to reduce the final file size. If a frame of the animation can use the 'combine' mode, this procedure attempts to maximize the number of ajdacent pixels having the same color, which improves the compression for some image formats such as GIF or MNG.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable (unused)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
resultGIMP_PDB_IMAGEResulting image
AUTHOR
Adam D. Moss
(c)1997-2003 Adam D. Moss

gimp-image-convert-precision

NAME
gimp-image-convert-precision
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_convert_precision(image, precision)
BLURB
Convert the image to the specified precision
HELP
This procedure converts the image to the specified precision. Note that indexed images cannot be converted and are always in GIMP_PRECISION_U8.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
precisionGIMP_PDB_INT32The new precision {
PRECISION-U8-LINEAR (100)
PRECISION-U8-GAMMA (150)
PRECISION-U16-LINEAR (200)
PRECISION-U16-GAMMA (250)
PRECISION-U32-LINEAR (300)
PRECISION-U32-GAMMA (350)
PRECISION-HALF-LINEAR (500)
PRECISION-HALF-GAMMA (550)
PRECISION-FLOAT-LINEAR (600)
PRECISION-FLOAT-GAMMA (650)
PRECISION-DOUBLE-LINEAR (700)
PRECISION-DOUBLE-GAMMA (750)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2012 Michael Natterer

gimp-drawable-edit-fill

NAME
gimp-drawable-edit-fill
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_edit_fill(drawable, fill-type)
BLURB
Fill selected area of drawable.
HELP
This procedure fills the specified drawable according to fill mode. This procedure only affects regions within a selection if there is a selection active. If you want to fill the whole drawable, regardless of the selection, use 'gimp-drawable-fill'. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-opacity', 'gimp-context-set-paint-mode', 'gimp-context-set-foreground', 'gimp-context-set-background', 'gimp-context-set-pattern'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable to fill to
fill-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of fill {
FILL-FOREGROUND (0)
FILL-BACKGROUND (1)
FILL-WHITE (2)
FILL-TRANSPARENT (3)
FILL-PATTERN (4)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis & Raphael Quinet
(c)1995-2000 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-video

NAME
plug-in-video
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_video(run-mode, image, drawable, pattern-number, additive, rotated)
BLURB
Simulate distortion produced by a fuzzy or low-res monitor
HELP
This function simulates the degradation of being on an old low-dotpitch RGB video monitor to the specified drawable.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
pattern-numberGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of RGB pattern to use (0 <= pattern-number <= 8)
additiveGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether the function adds the result to the original image (TRUE or FALSE)
rotatedGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to rotate the RGB pattern by ninety degrees (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:video-degradation' for credits.
(c)2014 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:video-degradation' for credits.

gimp-context-set-feather

NAME
gimp-context-set-feather
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_feather(feather)
BLURB
Set the feather setting.
HELP
This procedure modifies the feather setting. If the feather option is enabled, selections will be blurred before combining. The blur is a gaussian blur; its radii can be controlled using 'gimp-context-set-feather-radius'. This setting affects the following procedures: 'gimp-image-select-color', 'gimp-image-select-contiguous-color', 'gimp-image-select-rectangle', 'gimp-image-select-round-rectangle', 'gimp-image-select-ellipse', 'gimp-image-select-polygon', 'gimp-image-select-item'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
featherGIMP_PDB_INT32The feather setting (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

BLURB
Copy into a named buffer.
HELP
This procedure works like 'gimp-edit-copy', but additionally stores the copied buffer into a named buffer that will stay available for later pasting, regardless of any intermediate copy or cut operations.

gimp-image-insert-vectors

NAME
gimp-image-insert-vectors
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_insert_vectors(image, vectors, parent, position)
BLURB
Add the specified vectors to the image.
HELP
This procedure adds the specified vectors to the image at the given position. Since vectors groups are not currently supported, the parent argument must always be 0. The position argument specifies the location of the vectors inside the stack, starting from the top (0) and increasing. If the position is specified as -1, then the vectors is inserted above the active vectors.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
vectorsGIMP_PDB_VECTORSThe vectors
parentGIMP_PDB_VECTORSThe parent vectors
positionGIMP_PDB_INT32The vectors position
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-vectors-stroke-new-from-points

NAME
gimp-vectors-stroke-new-from-points
SYNOPSIS
stroke-id = pdb.gimp_vectors_stroke_new_from_points(vectors, type, num-points, controlpoints, closed)
BLURB
Adds a stroke of a given type to the vectors object.
HELP
Adds a stroke of a given type to the vectors object. The coordinates of the control points can be specified. For now only strokes of the type GIMP_VECTORS_STROKE_TYPE_BEZIER are supported. The control points are specified as a pair of float values for the x- and y-coordinate. The Bezier stroke type needs a multiple of three control points. Each Bezier segment endpoint (anchor, A) has two additional control points (C) associated. They are specified in the order CACCACCAC...
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
vectorsGIMP_PDB_VECTORSThe vectors object
typeGIMP_PDB_INT32type of the stroke (always GIMP_VECTORS_STROKE_TYPE_BEZIER for now). {
VECTORS-STROKE-TYPE-BEZIER (0)
}
num-pointsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of elements in the array, i.e. the number of controlpoints in the stroke * 2 (x- and y-coordinate). (num-points >= 0)
controlpointsGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYList of the x- and y-coordinates of the control points.
closedGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether the stroke is to be closed or not. (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
stroke-idGIMP_PDB_INT32The stroke ID of the newly created stroke.
AUTHOR
Simon Budig
(c)2006 Simon Budig

gimp-file-save

NAME
gimp-file-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_file_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename)
BLURB
Saves a file by extension.
HELP
This procedure invokes the correct file save handler according to the file's extension and/or prefix. The name of the file to save is typically a full pathname, and the name entered is what the user actually typed before prepending a directory path. The reason for this is that if the user types https://www.gimp.org/foo.png she wants to fetch a URL, and the full pathname will not look like a URL.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to save
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name as entered by the user
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Josh MacDonald
(c)1997 Josh MacDonald

gimp-drawable-offsets

NAME
gimp-drawable-offsets
SYNOPSIS
offset-x, offset-y = pdb.gimp_drawable_offsets(drawable)
BLURB
Returns the offsets for the drawable.
HELP
This procedure returns the specified drawable's offsets. This only makes sense if the drawable is a layer since channels are anchored. The offsets of a channel will be returned as 0.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

offset-yGIMP_PDB_INT32y offset of drawable
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

file-j2k-load

NAME
file-j2k-load
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.file_j2k_load(run-mode, filename, raw-filename, colorspace)
BLURB
Loads JPEG 2000 codestream.
HELP
Loads JPEG 2000 codestream. If the color space is set to UNKNOWN (0), we will try to guess, which is only possible for few spaces (such as grayscale). Most such calls will fail. You are rather expected to know the color space of your data.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to load.
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name entered
colorspaceGIMP_PDB_INT32Color space {
UNKNOWN (0)
GRAYSCALE (1)
RGB (2)
CMYK (3)
YCbCr (4)
xvYCC (5)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput image
AUTHOR
Jehan
(c)2009 Jehan

scale-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmount to scale in y direction

dest-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATX coordinate of where the center goes
dest-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATY coordinate of where the center goes

gimp-clone

NAME
gimp-clone
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_clone(drawable, src-drawable, clone-type, src-x, src-y, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Clone from the source to the dest drawable using the current brush
HELP
This tool clones (copies) from the source drawable starting at the specified source coordinates to the dest drawable. If the "clone_type" argument is set to PATTERN-CLONE, then the current pattern is used as the source and the "src_drawable" argument is ignored. Pattern cloning assumes a tileable pattern and mods the sum of the src coordinates and subsequent stroke offsets with the width and height of the pattern. For image cloning, if the sum of the src coordinates and subsequent stroke offsets exceeds the extents of the src drawable, then no paint is transferred. The clone tool is capable of transforming between any image types including RGB->Indexed--although converting from any type to indexed is significantly slower.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
src-drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe source drawable
clone-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of clone {
CLONE-IMAGE (0)
CLONE-PATTERN (1)
}
src-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe x coordinate in the source image
src-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe y coordinate in the source image
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-add-layer

(c)

HELP

greenfrequencyGIMP_PDB_FLOATGreen/saturation component frequency factor (0 <= greenfrequency <= 20)
greenangleGIMP_PDB_FLOATGreen/saturation component angle factor (0-360) (0 <= greenangle <= 360)
bluefrequencyGIMP_PDB_FLOATBlue/luminance component frequency factor (0 <= bluefrequency <= 20)
blueangleGIMP_PDB_FLOATBlue/luminance component angle factor (0-360) (0 <= blueangle <= 360)

RGB-MODEL (0)
HSL-MODEL (1)
}

TRUE
FALSE
}
greenmodeGIMP_PDB_INT8Green/saturation application mode {
TRUE
FALSE
}
bluemodeGIMP_PDB_INT8Blue/luminance application mode {
TRUE
FALSE
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:alien-map' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:alien-map' for credits.

file-raw-get-defaults

NAME
file-raw-get-defaults
SYNOPSIS
image-type, palette-type = pdb.file_raw_get_defaults()
BLURB
Get the current set of defaults used by the raw image data dump plug-in
HELP
This procedure returns the current set of defaults stored as a parasite for the raw image data dump plug-in. These defaults are used to seed the UI, by the file_raw_save_defaults procedure, and by gimp_file_save when it detects to use RAW.

}

gimp-drawable-transform-scale

NAME
gimp-drawable-transform-scale
SYNOPSIS
drawable = pdb.gimp_drawable_transform_scale(drawable, x0, y0, x1, y1, transform-direction, interpolation, supersample, recursion-level, clip-result)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-scale' instead.
HELP

MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
x0GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of the upper-left corner of the scaled region
y0GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the scaled region
x1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of the lower-right corner of the scaled region
y1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of the lower-right corner of the scaled region
transform-directionGIMP_PDB_INT32Direction of transformation {
TRANSFORM-FORWARD (0)
TRANSFORM-BACKWARD (1)
}
interpolationGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of interpolation {
INTERPOLATION-NONE (0)
INTERPOLATION-LINEAR (1)
INTERPOLATION-CUBIC (2)
INTERPOLATION-NOHALO (3)
INTERPOLATION-LOHALO (4)
}
supersampleGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (TRUE or FALSE)
recursion-levelGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (recursion-level >= 1)
clip-resultGIMP_PDB_INT32How to clip results {
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-ADJUST (0)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CLIP (1)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP (2)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP-WITH-ASPECT (3)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno
(c)2004 João S. O. Bueno

gimp-gradient-segment-range-split-uniform

NAME
gimp-gradient-segment-range-split-uniform

pdb.gimp_gradient_segment_range_split_uniform(name, start-segment, end-segment, split-parts)
BLURB
Splits each segment in the segment range uniformly
HELP
This function splits each segment in the segment range uniformly according to the number of times specified by the parameter.
MENUPATH

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe gradient name
start-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the first segment to operate on (start-segment >= 0)
end-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the last segment to operate on. If negative, the selection will extend to the end of the string.
split-partsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of uniform divisions to split each segment to (2 <= split-parts <= 1024)
RETURN VALUES

(c)2003 Shlomi Fish

gimp-drawable-curves-explicit

NAME
gimp-drawable-curves-explicit
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_curves_explicit(drawable, channel, num-values, values)
BLURB
Modifies the intensity curve(s) for specified drawable.
HELP
Modifies the intensity mapping for one channel in the specified drawable. The channel can be either an intensity component, or the value. The 'values' parameter is an array of doubles which explicitly defines how each pixel value in the drawable will be modified. Use the 'gimp-curves-spline' function to modify intensity levels with Catmull Rom splines.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
channelGIMP_PDB_INT32The channel to modify {
HISTOGRAM-VALUE (0)
HISTOGRAM-RED (1)
HISTOGRAM-GREEN (2)
HISTOGRAM-BLUE (3)
HISTOGRAM-ALPHA (4)
HISTOGRAM-LUMINANCE (5)
HISTOGRAM-RGB (6)
}
num-valuesGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of values in the new curve (256 <= num-values <= 2096)
valuesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYThe explicit curve
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-context-set-distance-metric

NAME
gimp-context-set-distance-metric
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_distance_metric(metric)
BLURB
Set the distance metric used in some computations.
HELP
This procedure modifies the distance metric used in some computations, such as 'gimp-drawable-edit-gradient-fill'. In particular, it does not change the metric used in generic distance computation on canvas, as in the Measure tool. This setting affects the following procedures: 'gimp-drawable-edit-gradient-fill'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
metricGIMP_PDB_INT32The distance metric {
Euclidean (0)
Manhattan (1)
Chebyshev (2)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Jehan
(c)2018 Jehan

plug-in-mosaic

NAME
plug-in-mosaic
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_mosaic(run-mode, image, drawable, tile-size, tile-height, tile-spacing, tile-neatness, tile-allow-split, light-dir, color-variation, antialiasing, color-averaging, tile-type, tile-surface, grout-color)
BLURB
Convert the image into irregular tiles
HELP
Mosaic is a filter which transforms an image into what appears to be a mosaic, composed of small primitives, each of constant color and of an approximate size.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
tile-sizeGIMP_PDB_FLOATAverage diameter of each tile (in pixels) (1 <= tile-size <= 1000)
tile-heightGIMP_PDB_FLOATApparent height of each tile (in pixels) (1 <= tile-height <= 1000)
tile-spacingGIMP_PDB_FLOATInter_tile spacing (in pixels) (0.1 <= tile-spacing <= 1000)
tile-neatnessGIMP_PDB_FLOATDeviation from perfectly formed tiles (0 <= tile-neatness <= 1)
tile-allow-splitGIMP_PDB_INT32Allows splitting tiles at hard edges (0 <= tile-allow-split <= 1)
light-dirGIMP_PDB_FLOATDirection of light_source (in degrees) (0 <= light-dir <= 360)
color-variationGIMP_PDB_FLOATMagnitude of random color variations (0 <= color-variation <= 1)
antialiasingGIMP_PDB_INT32Enables smoother tile output at the cost of speed (0 <= antialiasing <= 1)
color-averagingGIMP_PDB_INT32Tile color based on average of subsumed pixels (0 <= color-averaging <= 1)
tile-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Tile geometry {
SQUARES (0)
HEXAGONS (1)
OCTAGONS (2)
TRIANGLES (3)
} (0 <= tile-type <= 3)
tile-surfaceGIMP_PDB_INT32Surface characteristics {
SMOOTH (0)
ROUGH (1)
} (0 <= tile-surface <= 1)
grout-colorGIMP_PDB_INT32Grout color (black/white or fore/background) {
BW (0)
FG-BG (1)
} (0 <= grout-color <= 1)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:mosaic' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:mosaic' for credits.

plug-in-spyrogimp

NAME
plug-in-spyrogimp
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_spyrogimp(run-mode, image, drawable, curve-type, shape, sides, morph, fixed-teeth, moving-teeth, hole-percent, margin, equal-w-h, pattern-rotation, shape-rotation, tool, long-gradient)
BLURB
Draw spyrographs using current tool settings and selection.
HELP
Uses current tool settings to draw Spyrograph patterns. The size and location of the pattern is based on the current selection.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
curve-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The curve type {
Spyrograph (0)
Epitrochoid (1)
Sine (2)
Lissajous(3)
}
shapeGIMP_PDB_INT32Shape of fixed gear
sidesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of sides of fixed gear (3 or greater). Only used by some shapes.
morphGIMP_PDB_FLOATMorph shape of fixed gear, between 0 and 1. Only used by some shapes.
fixed-teethGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of teeth for fixed gear
moving-teethGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of teeth for moving gear
hole-percentGIMP_PDB_FLOATLocation of hole in moving gear in percent, where 100 means that the hole is at the edge of the gear, and 0 means the hole is at the center
marginGIMP_PDB_INT32Margin from selection, in pixels
equal-w-hGIMP_PDB_INT32Make height and width equal (TRUE or FALSE)
pattern-rotationGIMP_PDB_FLOATPattern rotation, in degrees
shape-rotationGIMP_PDB_FLOATShape rotation of fixed gear, in degrees
toolGIMP_PDB_INT32Tool to use for drawing the pattern.
long-gradientGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to apply a long gradient to match the length of the pattern (TRUE or FALSE). Only applicable to some of the tools.
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Elad Shahar
(c)2018 Elad Shahar

gimp-drawable-color-balance

NAME
gimp-drawable-color-balance
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_color_balance(drawable, transfer-mode, preserve-lum, cyan-red, magenta-green, yellow-blue)
BLURB
Modify the color balance of the specified drawable.
HELP
Modify the color balance of the specified drawable. There are three axis which can be modified: cyan-red, magenta-green, and yellow-blue. Negative values increase the amount of the former, positive values increase the amount of the latter. Color balance can be controlled with the 'transfer_mode' setting, which allows shadows, mid-tones, and highlights in an image to be affected differently. The 'preserve-lum' parameter, if TRUE, ensures that the luminosity of each pixel remains fixed.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
transfer-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Transfer mode {
TRANSFER-SHADOWS (0)
TRANSFER-MIDTONES (1)
TRANSFER-HIGHLIGHTS (2)
}
preserve-lumGIMP_PDB_INT32Preserve luminosity values at each pixel (TRUE or FALSE)
cyan-redGIMP_PDB_FLOATCyan-Red color balance (-100 <= cyan-red <= 100)
magenta-greenGIMP_PDB_FLOATMagenta-Green color balance (-100 <= magenta-green <= 100)
yellow-blueGIMP_PDB_FLOATYellow-Blue color balance (-100 <= yellow-blue <= 100)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-screenshot

NAME
plug-in-screenshot
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.plug_in_screenshot(run-mode, shoot-type, window-id, x1, y1, x2, y2)
BLURB
Create an image from an area of the screen
HELP
The plug-in takes screenshots of an interactively selected window or of the desktop, either the whole desktop or an interactively selected region. When called non-interactively, it may grab the root window or use the window-id passed as a parameter. The last four parameters are optional and can be used to specify the corners of the region to be grabbed.On Mac OS X or on gnome-shell, when called non-interactively, the plug-inonly can take screenshots of the entire root window.Grabbing a window or a region is not supportednon-interactively. To grab a region or a particularwindow, you need to use the interactive mode.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
shoot-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The Shoot type {
SHOOT-WINDOW (0)
SHOOT-ROOT (1)
SHOOT-REGION (2)
}
window-idGIMP_PDB_INT32Window id for SHOOT-WINDOW
x1GIMP_PDB_INT32Region left x coord for SHOOT-REGION
y1GIMP_PDB_INT32Region top y coord for SHOOT-REGION
x2GIMP_PDB_INT32Region right x coord for SHOOT-REGION
y2GIMP_PDB_INT32Region bottom y coord for SHOOT-REGION
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput image
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann , Henrik Brix Andersen ,Simone Karin Lehmann
(c)v1.1 (2008/04) 1998 - 2008

gimp-xcf-save

NAME
gimp-xcf-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_xcf_save(dummy-param, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename)
BLURB
Saves file in the .xcf file format
HELP
The XCF file format has been designed specifically for loading and saving tiled and layered images in GIMP. This procedure will save the specified image in the xcf file format.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in, in URI format and UTF-8 encoding
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe basename of the file, in UTF-8
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

file-mng-save

NAME
file-mng-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_mng_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, interlace, compression, quality, smoothing, loop, default-delay, default-chunks, default-dispose, bkgd, gama, phys, time)
BLURB
Saves images in the MNG file format
HELP
This plug-in saves images in the Multiple-image Network Graphics (MNG) format which can be used as a replacement for animated GIFs, and more.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to save
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
interlaceGIMP_PDB_INT32Use interlacing
compressionGIMP_PDB_INT32PNG deflate compression level (0 - 9)
qualityGIMP_PDB_FLOATJPEG quality factor (0.00 - 1.00)
smoothingGIMP_PDB_FLOATJPEG smoothing factor (0.00 - 1.00)
loopGIMP_PDB_INT32(ANIMATED MNG) Loop infinitely
default-delayGIMP_PDB_INT32(ANIMATED MNG) Default delay between frames in milliseconds
default-chunksGIMP_PDB_INT32(ANIMATED MNG) Default chunks type (0 = PNG + Delta PNG; 1 = JNG + Delta PNG; 2 = All PNG; 3 = All JNG)
default-disposeGIMP_PDB_INT32(ANIMATED MNG) Default dispose type (0 = combine; 1 = replace)
bkgdGIMP_PDB_INT32Write bKGD (background color) chunk
gamaGIMP_PDB_INT32Write gAMA (gamma) chunk
physGIMP_PDB_INT32Write pHYs (image resolution) chunk
timeGIMP_PDB_INT32Write tIME (creation time) chunk
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Mukund Sivaraman
(c)November 19, 2002 Mukund Sivaraman

BLURB
Show a dialog while waiting for an operation to finish
HELP
Used by GIMP to display a dialog, containing a spinner and a custom message, while waiting for an ongoing operation to finish. Optionally, the dialog may provide a "Cancel" button, which can be used to cancel the operation.

gimp-register-file-handler-priority

NAME
gimp-register-file-handler-priority
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_register_file_handler_priority(procedure-name, priority)
BLURB
Sets the priority of a file handler procedure.
HELP
Sets the priority of a file handler procedure. When more than one procedure matches a given file, the procedure with the lowest priority is used; if more than one procedure has the lowest priority, it is unspecified which one of them is used. The default priority for file handler procedures is 0.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
procedure-nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the procedure to set the priority of.
priorityGIMP_PDB_INT32The procedure priority.
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Ell
(c)2018 Ell

gimp-gradients-get-list

NAME
gimp-gradients-get-list
SYNOPSIS
num-gradients, gradient-list = pdb.gimp_gradients_get_list(filter)
BLURB
Retrieve the list of loaded gradients.
HELP
This procedure returns a list of the gradients that are currently loaded. You can later use the 'gimp-context-set-gradient' function to set the active gradient.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
filterGIMP_PDB_STRINGAn optional regular expression used to filter the list
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
num-gradientsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of loaded gradients (num-gradients >= 0)
gradient-listGIMP_PDB_STRINGARRAYThe list of gradient names

gimp-drawable-transform-rotate

NAME
gimp-drawable-transform-rotate
SYNOPSIS
drawable = pdb.gimp_drawable_transform_rotate(drawable, angle, auto-center, center-x, center-y, transform-direction, interpolation, supersample, recursion-level, clip-result)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-rotate' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-rotate' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
angleGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe angle of rotation (radians)
auto-centerGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to automatically rotate around the selection center (TRUE or FALSE)
center-xGIMP_PDB_INT32The hor. coordinate of the center of rotation
center-yGIMP_PDB_INT32The vert. coordinate of the center of rotation
transform-directionGIMP_PDB_INT32Direction of transformation {
TRANSFORM-FORWARD (0)
TRANSFORM-BACKWARD (1)
}
interpolationGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of interpolation {
INTERPOLATION-NONE (0)
INTERPOLATION-LINEAR (1)
INTERPOLATION-CUBIC (2)
INTERPOLATION-NOHALO (3)
INTERPOLATION-LOHALO (4)
}
supersampleGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (TRUE or FALSE)
recursion-levelGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (recursion-level >= 1)
clip-resultGIMP_PDB_INT32How to clip results {
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-ADJUST (0)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CLIP (1)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP (2)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP-WITH-ASPECT (3)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe rotated drawable

BLURB
Free the specified drawable's shadow data (if it exists).
HELP
This procedure is intended as a memory saving device. If any shadow memory has been allocated, it will be freed automatically when the drawable is removed from the image, or when the plug-in procedure which allocated it returns.

gimp-drawable-offset

NAME
gimp-drawable-offset
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_offset(drawable, wrap-around, fill-type, offset-x, offset-y)
BLURB
Offset the drawable by the specified amounts in the X and Y directions
HELP
This procedure offsets the specified drawable by the amounts specified by 'offset_x' and 'offset_y'. If 'wrap_around' is set to TRUE, then portions of the drawable which are offset out of bounds are wrapped around. Alternatively, the undefined regions of the drawable can be filled with transparency or the background color, as specified by the 'fill-type' parameter.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable to offset
wrap-aroundGIMP_PDB_INT32wrap image around or fill vacated regions (TRUE or FALSE)
fill-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32fill vacated regions of drawable with background or transparent {
OFFSET-BACKGROUND (0)
OFFSET-TRANSPARENT (1)
OFFSET-WRAP-AROUND (2)
}
offset-xGIMP_PDB_INT32offset by this amount in X direction
offset-yGIMP_PDB_INT32offset by this amount in Y direction
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-floating-sel-to-layer

NAME
gimp-floating-sel-to-layer
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_floating_sel_to_layer(floating-sel)
BLURB
Transforms the specified floating selection into a layer.
HELP
This procedure transforms the specified floating selection into a layer with the same offsets and extents. The composited image will look precisely the same, but the floating selection layer will no longer be clipped to the extents of the drawable it was attached to. The floating selection will become the active layer. This procedure will not work if the floating selection has a different base type from the underlying image. This might be the case if the floating selection is above an auxiliary channel or a layer mask.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
floating-selGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe floating selection
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-invert

(c)

plug-in-sparkle

NAME
plug-in-sparkle
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_sparkle(run-mode, image, drawable, lum-threshold, flare-inten, spike-len, spike-pts, spike-angle, density, transparency, random-hue, random-saturation, preserve-luminosity, inverse, border, color-type)
BLURB
Turn bright spots into starry sparkles
HELP
Uses a percentage based luminoisty threhsold to find candidate pixels for adding some sparkles (spikes).
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
lum-thresholdGIMP_PDB_FLOATLuminosity threshold (0.0 - 1.0)
flare-intenGIMP_PDB_FLOATFlare intensity (0.0 - 1.0)
spike-lenGIMP_PDB_INT32Spike length (in pixels)
spike-ptsGIMP_PDB_INT32# of spike points
spike-angleGIMP_PDB_INT32Spike angle (0-360 degrees, -1: random)
densityGIMP_PDB_FLOATSpike density (0.0 - 1.0)
transparencyGIMP_PDB_FLOATTransparency (0.0 - 1.0)
random-hueGIMP_PDB_FLOATRandom hue (0.0 - 1.0)
random-saturationGIMP_PDB_FLOATRandom saturation (0.0 - 1.0)
preserve-luminosityGIMP_PDB_INT32Preserve luminosity (TRUE/FALSE)
inverseGIMP_PDB_INT32Inverse (TRUE/FALSE)
borderGIMP_PDB_INT32Add border (TRUE/FALSE)
color-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Color of sparkles: {
NATURAL (0)
FOREGROUND (1)
BACKGROUND (2)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
John Beale, & (ported to GIMP v0.54) Michael J. Hammel & ted to GIMP v1.0) & Seth Burgess & Spencer Kimball
(c)Version 1.27, September 2003 John Beale

gimp-image-set-component-visible

NAME
gimp-image-set-component-visible
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_set_component_visible(image, component, visible)
BLURB
Sets if the specified image's image component is visible.
HELP
This procedure sets if the specified image's image component (i.e. Red, Green, Blue intensity channels in an RGB image) is visible or invisible -- whether or not it can be seen. If the specified component is not valid for the image type, an error is returned.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
componentGIMP_PDB_INT32The image component {
CHANNEL-RED (0)
CHANNEL-GREEN (1)
CHANNEL-BLUE (2)
CHANNEL-GRAY (3)
CHANNEL-INDEXED (4)
CHANNEL-ALPHA (5)
}
visibleGIMP_PDB_INT32Component is visible (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

ROTATE-270 (2)

gimp-drawable-curves-spline

NAME
gimp-drawable-curves-spline
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_curves_spline(drawable, channel, num-points, points)
BLURB
Modifies the intensity curve(s) for specified drawable.
HELP
Modifies the intensity mapping for one channel in the specified drawable. The channel can be either an intensity component, or the value. The 'points' parameter is an array of doubles which define a set of control points which describe a Catmull Rom spline which yields the final intensity curve. Use the 'gimp-curves-explicit' function to explicitly modify intensity levels.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
channelGIMP_PDB_INT32The channel to modify {
HISTOGRAM-VALUE (0)
HISTOGRAM-RED (1)
HISTOGRAM-GREEN (2)
HISTOGRAM-BLUE (3)
HISTOGRAM-ALPHA (4)
HISTOGRAM-LUMINANCE (5)
HISTOGRAM-RGB (6)
}
num-pointsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of values in the control point array (4 <= num-points <= 2048)
pointsGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYThe spline control points: {
cp1.x
cp1.y
cp2.x
cp2.y
...
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-film

NAME
plug-in-film
SYNOPSIS
new-image = pdb.plug_in_film(run-mode, image, drawable, film-height, film-color, number-start, number-font, number-color, at-top, at-bottom, num-images, image-ids)
BLURB
Combine several images on a film strip
HELP
Compose several images to a roll film
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (only used as default image in interactive mode)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable (not used)
film-heightGIMP_PDB_INT32Height of film (0: fit to images)
film-colorGIMP_PDB_COLORColor of the film
number-startGIMP_PDB_INT32Start index for numbering
number-fontGIMP_PDB_STRINGFont for drawing numbers
number-colorGIMP_PDB_COLORColor for numbers
at-topGIMP_PDB_INT32Flag for drawing numbers at top of film
at-bottomGIMP_PDB_INT32Flag for drawing numbers at bottom of film
num-imagesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of images to be used for film
image-idsGIMP_PDB_INT32ARRAYnum-images image IDs to be used for film
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput image
AUTHOR
Peter Kirchgessner
(c)1997 Peter Kirchgessner (peter@@kirchgessner.net)

gimp-context-set-line-dash-offset

gimp-brush-get-shape

NAME
gimp-brush-get-shape
SYNOPSIS
shape = pdb.gimp_brush_get_shape(name)
BLURB
Gets the shape of a generated brush.
HELP
This procedure gets the shape value for a generated brush. If called for any other type of brush, it does not succeed. The current possibilities are Circle (GIMP_BRUSH_GENERATED_CIRCLE), Square (GIMP_BRUSH_GENERATED_SQUARE), and Diamond (GIMP_BRUSH_GENERATED_DIAMOND). Other shapes are likely to be added in the future.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe brush name
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
shapeGIMP_PDB_INT32The brush shape {
BRUSH-GENERATED-CIRCLE (0)
BRUSH-GENERATED-SQUARE (1)
BRUSH-GENERATED-DIAMOND (2)
}
AUTHOR
Bill Skaggs
(c)2004 Bill Skaggs

gimp-layer-add-alpha

NAME
gimp-layer-add-alpha
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_layer_add_alpha(layer)
BLURB
Add an alpha channel to the layer if it doesn't already have one.
HELP
This procedure adds an additional component to the specified layer if it does not already possess an alpha channel. An alpha channel makes it possible to clear and erase to transparency, instead of the background color. This transforms layers of type RGB to RGBA, GRAY to GRAYA, and INDEXED to INDEXEDA.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

RETURN VALUES
