gimp-gradient-segment-range-redistribute-handles

NAME
gimp-gradient-segment-range-redistribute-handles
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_gradient_segment_range_redistribute_handles(name, start-segment, end-segment)
BLURB
Uniformly redistribute the segment range's handles
HELP
This function redistributes the handles of the specified segment range of the specified gradient, so they'll be evenly spaced.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe gradient name
start-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the first segment to operate on (start-segment >= 0)
end-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the last segment to operate on. If negative, the selection will extend to the end of the string.
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Shlomi Fish
(c)2003 Shlomi Fish

plug-in-dog

NAME
plug-in-dog
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_dog(run-mode, image, drawable, inner, outer, normalize, invert)
BLURB
Edge detection with control of edge thickness
HELP
Applies two Gaussian blurs to the drawable, and subtracts the results. This is robust and widely used method for detecting edges.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
innerGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius of inner gaussian blur (in pixels, > 0.0)
outerGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius of outer gaussian blur (in pixels, > 0.0)
normalizeGIMP_PDB_INT32Normalize {
TRUE
FALSE
}
invertGIMP_PDB_INT32Invert {
TRUE
FALSE
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball, Peter Mattis, Sven Neumann, William Skaggs
(c)1995-2004 Spencer Kimball, Peter Mattis, Sven Neumann, William Skaggs

plug-in-sobel

NAME
plug-in-sobel
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_sobel(run-mode, image, drawable, horizontal, vertical, keep-sign)
BLURB
Specialized direction-dependent edge detection
HELP
This plug-in calculates the gradient with a sobel operator. The user can specify which direction to use. When both directions are used, the result is the RMS of the two gradients; if only one direction is used, the result either the absolute value of the gradient, or 127 + gradient (if the 'keep sign' switch is on). This way, information about the direction of the gradient is preserved. Resulting images are not autoscaled."
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
horizontalGIMP_PDB_INT32Sobel in horizontal direction (TRUE or FALSE)
verticalGIMP_PDB_INT32Sobel in vertical direction (TRUE or FALSE)
keep-signGIMP_PDB_INT32Keep sign of result (one direction only) (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:edge-sobel' for credits.
(c)2014 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:edge-sobel' for credits.

gimp-vectors-bezier-stroke-new-moveto

AUTHOR
Simon Budig
(c)2005 Simon Budig

gimp-drawable-transform-matrix

NAME
gimp-drawable-transform-matrix
SYNOPSIS
drawable = pdb.gimp_drawable_transform_matrix(drawable, coeff-0-0, coeff-0-1, coeff-0-2, coeff-1-0, coeff-1-1, coeff-1-2, coeff-2-0, coeff-2-1, coeff-2-2, transform-direction, interpolation, supersample, recursion-level, clip-result)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-matrix' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-matrix' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
coeff-0-0GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (0,0) of the transformation matrix
coeff-0-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (0,1) of the transformation matrix
coeff-0-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (0,2) of the transformation matrix
coeff-1-0GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (1,0) of the transformation matrix
coeff-1-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (1,1) of the transformation matrix
coeff-1-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (1,2) of the transformation matrix
coeff-2-0GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (2,0) of the transformation matrix
coeff-2-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (2,1) of the transformation matrix
coeff-2-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (2,2) of the transformation matrix
transform-directionGIMP_PDB_INT32Direction of transformation {
TRANSFORM-FORWARD (0)
TRANSFORM-BACKWARD (1)
}
interpolationGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of interpolation {
INTERPOLATION-NONE (0)
INTERPOLATION-LINEAR (1)
INTERPOLATION-CUBIC (2)
INTERPOLATION-NOHALO (3)
INTERPOLATION-LOHALO (4)
}
supersampleGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (TRUE or FALSE)
recursion-levelGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (recursion-level >= 1)
clip-resultGIMP_PDB_INT32How to clip results {
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-ADJUST (0)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CLIP (1)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP (2)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP-WITH-ASPECT (3)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe transformed drawable
AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno
(c)2004 João S. O. Bueno

plug-in-bump-map

NAME
plug-in-bump-map
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_bump_map(run-mode, image, drawable, bumpmap, azimuth, elevation, depth, xofs, yofs, waterlevel, ambient, compensate, invert, type)
BLURB
Create an embossing effect using a bump map
HELP
This plug-in uses the algorithm described by John Schlag, "Fast Embossing Effects on Raster Image Data" in Graphics GEMS IV (ISBN 0-12-336155-9). It takes a drawable to be applied as a bump map to another image and produces a nice embossing effect.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
bumpmapGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEBump map drawable
azimuthGIMP_PDB_FLOATAzimuth (0 <= azimuth <= 360)
elevationGIMP_PDB_FLOATElevation (0.5 <= elevation <= 90)
depthGIMP_PDB_INT32Depth (1 <= depth <= 65)
xofsGIMP_PDB_INT32X offset
yofsGIMP_PDB_INT32Y offset
waterlevelGIMP_PDB_FLOATLevel that full transparency should represent (0 <= waterlevel <= 1)
ambientGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmbient lighting factor (0 <= ambient <= 1)
compensateGIMP_PDB_INT32Compensate for darkening (TRUE or FALSE)
invertGIMP_PDB_INT32Invert bumpmap (TRUE or FALSE)
typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of map {
LINEAR (0)
SPHERICAL (1)
SINUSOIDAL (2)
} (0 <= type <= 3)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:bump-map' for credits.
(c)2015 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:bump-map' for credits.

gimp-context-get-distance-metric

NAME
gimp-context-get-distance-metric
SYNOPSIS
metric = pdb.gimp_context_get_distance_metric()
BLURB
Get the distance metric used in some computations.
HELP
This procedure returns the distance metric in the current context. See 'gimp-context-set-distance-metric' to know more about its usage.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
metricGIMP_PDB_INT32The distance metric {
Euclidean (0)
Manhattan (1)
Chebyshev (2)
}
AUTHOR
Jehan
(c)2018 Jehan

gimp-get-monitor-resolution

NAME
gimp-get-monitor-resolution
SYNOPSIS
xres, yres = pdb.gimp_get_monitor_resolution()
BLURB
Get the monitor resolution as specified in the Preferences.
HELP
Returns the resolution of the monitor in pixels/inch. This value is taken from the Preferences (or the windowing system if this is set in the Preferences) and there's no guarantee for the value to be reasonable.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
xresGIMP_PDB_FLOATX resolution
yresGIMP_PDB_FLOATY resolution
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-unit-set-deletion-flag

NAME
gimp-unit-set-deletion-flag
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_unit_set_deletion_flag(unit-id, deletion-flag)
BLURB
Sets the deletion flag of a unit.
HELP
This procedure sets the unit's deletion flag. If the deletion flag of a unit is TRUE on gimp exit, this unit's definition will not be saved in the user's unitrc.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
unit-idGIMP_PDB_INT32The unit's integer ID
deletion-flagGIMP_PDB_INT32The new deletion flag of the unit (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)1999 Michael Natterer

BLURB

HELP
Renders SVG files to raster graphics using librsvg.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}

raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to load
resolutionGIMP_PDB_FLOATResolution to use for rendering the SVG (defaults to 90 dpi)
widthGIMP_PDB_INT32Width (in pixels) to load the SVG in. (0 for original width, a negative width to specify a maximum width)
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32Height (in pixels) to load the SVG in. (0 for original height, a negative width to specify a maximum height)
pathsGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to not import paths (0), import paths individually (1) or merge all imported paths (2)
RETURN VALUES

plug-in-neon

NAME
plug-in-neon
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_neon(run-mode, image, drawable, radius, amount)
BLURB
Simulate the glowing boundary of a neon light
HELP
This filter works in a manner similar to the edge plug-in, but uses the first derivative of the gaussian operator to achieve resolution independence. The IIR method of calculating the effect is utilized to keep the processing time constant between large and small standard deviations.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius of neon effect (in pixels) (0 <= radius <= 1500)
amountGIMP_PDB_FLOATEffect enhancement variable (0 <= amount <= 100)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:edge-neon' for credits.
(c)2019 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:edge-neon' for credits.

file-pdf-save2

NAME
file-pdf-save2
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_pdf_save2(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, vectorize, ignore-hidden, apply-masks, layers-as-pages, reverse-order)
BLURB
Save files in PDF format
HELP
Saves files in Adobe's Portable Document Format. PDF is designed to be easily processed by a variety of different platforms, and is a distant cousin of PostScript. This procedure adds an extra parameter to file-pdf-save to save layers as pages.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Run mode
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
vectorizeGIMP_PDB_INT32Convert bitmaps to vector graphics where possible. TRUE or FALSE
ignore-hiddenGIMP_PDB_INT32Omit hidden layers and layers with zero opacity. TRUE or FALSE
apply-masksGIMP_PDB_INT32Apply layer masks before saving. TRUE or FALSE (Keeping them will not change the output)
layers-as-pagesGIMP_PDB_INT32Layers as pages (bottom layers first). TRUE or FALSE
reverse-orderGIMP_PDB_INT32Reverse the pages order (top layers first). TRUE or FALSE
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Barak Itkin, Lionel N., Jehan
(c)August 2009, 2017 Copyright Barak Itkin, Lionel N., Jehan

gimp-image-remove-layer

NAME
gimp-image-remove-layer
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_remove_layer(image, layer)
BLURB
Remove the specified layer from the image.
HELP
This procedure removes the specified layer from the image. If the layer doesn't exist, an error is returned. If there are no layers left in the image, this call will fail. If this layer is the last layer remaining, the image will become empty and have no active layer.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-vectors-stroke-flip-free

NAME
gimp-vectors-stroke-flip-free
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_vectors_stroke_flip_free(vectors, stroke-id, x1, y1, x2, y2)
BLURB
flips the given stroke about an arbitrary axis.
HELP
Flips the given stroke about an arbitrary axis. Axis is defined by two coordinates in the image (in pixels), through which the flipping axis passes.

y2GIMP_PDB_FLOATY coordinate of the second point of the flipping axis

gimp-drawable-type-with-alpha

NAME
gimp-drawable-type-with-alpha
SYNOPSIS
type-with-alpha = pdb.gimp_drawable_type_with_alpha(drawable)
BLURB
Returns the drawable's type with alpha.
HELP
This procedure returns the drawable's type as if had an alpha channel. If the type is currently Gray, for instance, the returned type would be GrayA. If the drawable already has an alpha channel, the drawable's type is simply returned.
MENUPATH

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

RGBA-IMAGE (1)
GRAYA-IMAGE (3)
INDEXEDA-IMAGE (5)
}
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-sel-gauss

NAME
plug-in-sel-gauss
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_sel_gauss(run-mode, image, drawable, radius, max-delta)
BLURB
Blur neighboring pixels, but only in low-contrast areas
HELP
This filter functions similar to the regular gaussian blur filter except that neighbouring pixels that differ more than the given maxdelta parameter will not be blended with. This way with the correct parameters, an image can be smoothed out without losing details. However, this filter can be rather slow.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius of gaussian blur (in pixels) (radius >= 0)
max-deltaGIMP_PDB_INT32Maximum delta (0 <= max-delta <= 255)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:gaussian-blur-selective' for credits.
(c)2099 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:gaussian-blur-selective' for credits.

file-pdf-load2

NAME
file-pdf-load2
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.file_pdf_load2(run-mode, filename, raw-filename, pdf-password, n-pages, pages)
BLURB
Load file in PDF format
HELP
Loads files in Adobe's Portable Document Format. PDF is designed to be easily processed by a variety of different platforms, and is a distant cousin of PostScript. This procedure adds extra parameters to file-pdf-load to open encrypted PDF and to allow multiple page loading.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to load
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name entered
pdf-passwordGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe password to decrypt the encrypted PDF file
n-pagesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of pages to load (0 for all)
pagesGIMP_PDB_INT32ARRAYThe pages to load in the expected order
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput image
AUTHOR
Nathan Summers, Lionel N.
(c)2005, 2017 Nathan Summers, Lionel N.

gimp-paintbrush-default

NAME
gimp-paintbrush-default
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_paintbrush_default(drawable, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Paint in the current brush. The fade out parameter and pull colors from a gradient parameter are set from the paintbrush options dialog. If this dialog has not been activated then the dialog defaults will be used.
HELP
This tool is similar to the standard paintbrush. It draws linearly interpolated lines through the specified stroke coordinates. It operates on the specified drawable in the foreground color with the active brush. The 'fade-out' parameter is measured in pixels and allows the brush stroke to linearly fall off (value obtained from the option dialog). The pressure is set to the maximum at the beginning of the stroke. As the distance of the stroke nears the fade-out value, the pressure will approach zero. The gradient-length (value obtained from the option dialog) is the distance to spread the gradient over. It is measured in pixels. If the gradient-length is 0, no gradient is used.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Andy Thomas
(c)1999 Andy Thomas

script-fu-waves-anim

NAME
script-fu-waves-anim
SYNOPSIS
pdb.script_fu_waves_anim(run-mode, image, drawable, value, value, value, toggle)
BLURB
Create a multi-layer image with an effect like a stone was thrown into the current image
HELP
MENUPATH
Temporary Procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEImage
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmplitude
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATWavelength
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATNumber of frames
toggleGIMP_PDB_INT32Invert direction
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)1997/13/12 Sven Neumann

gimp-drawable-transform-rotate-simple

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
rotate-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of rotation {
ROTATE-90 (0)
ROTATE-180 (1)
ROTATE-270 (2)
}
auto-centerGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to automatically rotate around the selection center (TRUE or FALSE)
center-xGIMP_PDB_INT32The hor. coordinate of the center of rotation
center-yGIMP_PDB_INT32The vert. coordinate of the center of rotation
clip-resultGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to clip results (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe rotated drawable
AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno
(c)2004 João S. O. Bueno

gimp-text-get-extents-fontname

NAME
gimp-text-get-extents-fontname
SYNOPSIS
width, height, ascent, descent = pdb.gimp_text_get_extents_fontname(text, size, size-type, fontname)
BLURB
Get extents of the bounding box for the specified text.
HELP
This tool returns the width and height of a bounding box for the specified text string with the specified font information. Ascent and descent for the specified font are returned as well. Parameter size-type is not used and is currently ignored. If you need to display a font in points, divide the size in points by 72.0 and multiply it by the vertical resolution of the image you are taking into account.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
textGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe text to generate (in UTF-8 encoding)
sizeGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe size of text in either pixels or points (size >= 0)
size-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The units of specified size {
PIXELS (0)
POINTS (1)
}
fontnameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the font
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
widthGIMP_PDB_INT32The width of the specified font
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32The height of the specified font
ascentGIMP_PDB_INT32The ascent of the specified font
descentGIMP_PDB_INT32The descent of the specified font
AUTHOR
Martin Edlman & Sven Neumann
(c)1998- 2001 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-photocopy

NAME
plug-in-photocopy
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_photocopy(run-mode, image, drawable, mask-radius, sharpness, pct-black, pct-white)
BLURB
Simulate color distortion produced by a copy machine
HELP
Propagates dark values in an image based on each pixel's relative darkness to a neighboring average. The idea behind this filter is to give the look of a photocopied version of the image, with toner transferred based on the relative darkness of a particular region. This is achieved by darkening areas of the image which are measured to be darker than a neighborhood average and setting other pixels to white. In this way, sufficiently large shifts in intensity are darkened to black. The rate at which they are darkened to black is determined by the second pct_black parameter. The mask_radius parameter controls the size of the pixel neighborhood over which the average intensity is computed and then compared to each pixel in the neighborhood to decide whether or not to darken it to black. Large values for mask_radius result in very thick black areas bordering the regions of white and much less detail for black areas everywhere including inside regions of color. Small values result in less toner overall and more detail everywhere. Small values for the pct_black make the blend from the white regions to the black border lines smoother and the toner regions themselves thinner and less noticeable; larger values achieve the opposite effect.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
mask-radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATPhotocopy mask radius (radius of pixel neighborhood)
sharpnessGIMP_PDB_FLOATSharpness (detail level) (0.0 - 1.0)
pct-blackGIMP_PDB_FLOATPercentage of darkened pixels to set to black (0.0 - 1.0)
pct-whiteGIMP_PDB_FLOATPercentage of non-darkened pixels left white (0.0 - 1.0)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball
(c)2001 Bit Specialists, Inc.

gimp-vectors-import-from-string

NAME
gimp-vectors-import-from-string
SYNOPSIS
num-vectors, vectors-ids = pdb.gimp_vectors_import_from_string(image, string, length, merge, scale)
BLURB
Import paths from an SVG string.
HELP
This procedure works like 'gimp-vectors-import-from-file' but takes a string rather than reading the SVG from a file. This allows you to write scripts that generate SVG and feed it to GIMP.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
stringGIMP_PDB_STRINGA string that must be a complete and valid SVG document.
lengthGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of bytes in string or -1 if the string is NULL terminated.
mergeGIMP_PDB_INT32Merge paths into a single vectors object. (TRUE or FALSE)
scaleGIMP_PDB_INT32Scale the SVG to image dimensions. (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
num-vectorsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of newly created vectors (num-vectors >= 0)
vectors-idsGIMP_PDB_INT32ARRAYThe list of newly created vectors
AUTHOR
Simon Budig
(c)2006 Simon Budig

SYNOPSIS
unit-id = pdb.gimp_unit_new(identifier, factor, digits, symbol, abbreviation, singular, plural)

HELP

plug-in-gradmap

NAME
plug-in-gradmap
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_gradmap(run-mode, image, drawable)
BLURB
Recolor the image using colors from the active gradient
HELP
This plug-in maps the contents of the specified drawable with active gradient. It calculates luminosity of each pixel and replaces the pixel by the sample of active gradient at the position proportional to that luminosity. Complete black pixel becomes the leftmost color of the gradient, and complete white becomes the rightmost. Works on both Grayscale and RGB image with/without alpha channel.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Eiichi Takamori
(c)1997 Eiichi Takamori

SYNOPSIS

BLURB
Sets a gimprc token to a value and saves it in the gimprc.
HELP
This procedure is used to add or change additional information in the gimprc file that is considered extraneous to the operation of GIMP. Plug-ins that need configuration information can use this function to store it, and 'gimp-gimprc-query' to retrieve it. This will accept _only_ string values in UTF-8 encoding.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

gimp-context-set-font

NAME
gimp-context-set-font
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_font(name)
BLURB
Set the specified font as the active font.
HELP
This procedure allows the active font to be set by specifying its name. The name is simply a string which corresponds to one of the names of the installed fonts. If no matching font is found, this procedure will return an error. Otherwise, the specified font becomes active and will be used in all subsequent font operations.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the font
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer & Sven Neumann
(c)2004 Michael Natterer & Sven Neumann

NAME

SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_set_resolution(image, xresolution, yresolution)
BLURB
Sets the specified image's resolution.
HELP
This procedure sets the specified image's resolution in dots per inch. This value is independent of any of the layers in this image. No scaling or resizing is performed.

Austin Donnelly
(c)1998 Austin Donnelly

file-gih-save

NAME
file-gih-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_gih_save(run-mode, image, drawable, uri, raw-uri, spacing, description, cell-width, cell-height, display-cols, display-rows, dimension, rank, dimension, sel)
BLURB
exports images in GIMP brush pipe format
HELP
This plug-in exports an image in the GIMP brush pipe format. For a colored brush pipe, RGBA layers are used, otherwise the layers should be grayscale masks. The image can be multi-layered, and additionally the layers can be divided into a rectangular array of brushes.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to export
uriGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe URI of the file to export the brush pipe in
raw-uriGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe URI of the file to export the brush pipe in
spacingGIMP_PDB_INT32Spacing of the brush
descriptionGIMP_PDB_STRINGShort description of the brush pipe
cell-widthGIMP_PDB_INT32Width of the brush cells
cell-heightGIMP_PDB_INT32Width of the brush cells
display-colsGIMP_PDB_INT8Display column number
display-rowsGIMP_PDB_INT8Display row number
dimensionGIMP_PDB_INT32Dimension of the brush pipe
rankGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYRanks of the dimensions
dimensionGIMP_PDB_INT32Dimension (again)
selGIMP_PDB_STRINGARRAYSelection modes
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Tor Lillqvist
(c)1999 Tor Lillqvist

plug-in-newsprint

NAME
plug-in-newsprint
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_newsprint(run-mode, image, drawable, cell-width, colorspace, k-pullout, gry-ang, gry-spotfn, red-ang, red-spotfn, grn-ang, grn-spotfn, blu-ang, blu-spotfn, oversample)
BLURB
Halftone the image to give newspaper-like effect
HELP
Halftone the image to give newspaper-like effect
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
cell-widthGIMP_PDB_INT32Screen cell width in pixels (0 <= cell-width <= 1500)
colorspaceGIMP_PDB_INT32Separate to {
GRAYSCALE (0)
RGB (1)
CMYK (2)
LUMINANCE (3)
} (0 <= colorspace <= 3)
k-pulloutGIMP_PDB_INT32Percentage of black to pullout (CMYK only) (0 <= k-pullout <= 100)
gry-angGIMP_PDB_FLOATGrey/black screen angle (degrees) (0 <= gry-ang <= 360)
gry-spotfnGIMP_PDB_INT32Grey/black spot function {
DOTS (0)
LINES (1)
DIAMONDS (2)
EUCLIDIAN-DOT (3)
PS-DIAMONDS (4)
} (0 <= gry-spotfn <= 4)
red-angGIMP_PDB_FLOATRed/cyan screen angle (degrees) (0 <= red-ang <= 360)
red-spotfnGIMP_PDB_INT32Red/cyan spot function {
DOTS (0)
LINES (1)
DIAMONDS (2)
EUCLIDIAN-DOT (3)
PS-DIAMONDS (4)
} (0 <= red-spotfn <= 4)
grn-angGIMP_PDB_FLOATGreen/magenta screen angle (degrees) (0 <= grn-ang <= 360)
grn-spotfnGIMP_PDB_INT32Green/magenta spot function {
DOTS (0)
LINES (1)
DIAMONDS (2)
EUCLIDIAN-DOT (3)
PS-DIAMONDS (4)
} (0 <= grn-spotfn <= 4)
blu-angGIMP_PDB_FLOATBlue/yellow screen angle (degrees) (0 <= blu-ang <= 360)
blu-spotfnGIMP_PDB_INT32Blue/yellow spot function {
DOTS (0)
LINES (1)
DIAMONDS (2)
EUCLIDIAN-DOT (3)
PS-DIAMONDS (4)
} (0 <= blu-spotfn <= 4)
oversampleGIMP_PDB_INT32how many times to oversample spot fn (0 <= oversample <= 128)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:newsprint' for credits.
(c)2019 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:newsprint' for credits.

gimp-context-set-sample-merged

NAME
gimp-context-set-sample-merged
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_sample_merged(sample-merged)
BLURB
Set the sample merged setting.
HELP
This procedure modifies the sample merged setting. If an operation depends on the colors of the pixels present in a drawable, like when doing a seed fill, this setting controls whether the pixel data from the specified drawable is used ('sample-merged' is FALSE), or the pixel data from the composite image ('sample-merged' is TRUE. This is equivalent to sampling for colors after merging all visible layers). This setting affects the following procedures: 'gimp-image-select-color', 'gimp-image-select-contiguous-color', 'gimp-drawable-edit-bucket-fill'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
sample-mergedGIMP_PDB_INT32The sample merged setting (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2011 Michael Natterer

Erik Nygren
(c)1996 Erik Nygren

gimp-item-transform-rotate

NAME
gimp-item-transform-rotate
SYNOPSIS
item = pdb.gimp_item_transform_rotate(item, angle, auto-center, center-x, center-y)
BLURB
Rotate the specified item about given coordinates through the specified angle.
HELP
This function rotates the specified item. If a selection exists and the item is a drawable, the portion of the drawable which lies under the selection is cut from the drawable and made into a floating selection which is then rotated by the specified amount. If auto_center is set to TRUE, the rotation is around the selection's center. Otherwise, the coordinate of the center point needs to be specified. The return value is the ID of the rotated floating selection. If there is no selection or the item is not a drawable, the entire item will be rotated around its center if auto_center is set to TRUE, otherwise the coordinate of the center point needs to be specified. Additionally, if the item has its linked flag set to TRUE, all additional items contained in the image which have the linked flag set to TRUE will also be rotated around the same center point. The return value will be equal to the item ID supplied as input. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-interpolation', 'gimp-context-set-transform-direction', 'gimp-context-set-transform-resize'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe affected item
angleGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe angle of rotation (radians)
auto-centerGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to automatically rotate around the selection center (TRUE or FALSE)
center-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe hor. coordinate of the center of rotation
center-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe vert. coordinate of the center of rotation
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe rotated item
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

gimp-selection-save

NAME
gimp-selection-save
SYNOPSIS
channel = pdb.gimp_selection_save(image)
BLURB
Copy the selection mask to a new channel.
HELP
This procedure copies the selection mask and stores the content in a new channel. The new channel is automatically inserted into the image's list of channels.
MENUPATH

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES

channelGIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe new channel
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-gimprc-query

NAME
gimp-gimprc-query
SYNOPSIS
value = pdb.gimp_gimprc_query(token)
BLURB
Queries the gimprc file parser for information on a specified token.
HELP
This procedure is used to locate additional information contained in the gimprc file considered extraneous to the operation of GIMP. Plug-ins that need configuration information can expect it will be stored in the user gimprc file and can use this procedure to retrieve it. This query procedure will return the value associated with the specified token. This corresponds _only_ to entries with the format: ( ). The value must be a string. Entries not corresponding to this format will cause warnings to be issued on gimprc parsing and will not be queryable.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
tokenGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe token to query for
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
valueGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe value associated with the queried token
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

0
1
}

plug-in-whirl-pinch

NAME
plug-in-whirl-pinch
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_whirl_pinch(run-mode, image, drawable, whirl, pinch, radius)
BLURB
Distort an image by whirling and pinching
HELP
Distorts the image by whirling and pinching, which are two common center-based, circular distortions. Whirling is like projecting the image onto the surface of water in a toilet and flushing. Pinching is similar to projecting the image onto an elastic surface and pressing or pulling on the center of the surface.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
whirlGIMP_PDB_FLOATWhirl angle (degrees) (-720 <= whirl <= 720)
pinchGIMP_PDB_FLOATPinch amount (-1 <= pinch <= 1)
radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius (1.0 is the largest circle that fits in the image, and 2.0 goes all the way to the corners) (0 <= radius <= 2)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:whirl-pinch' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:whirl-pinch' for credits.

Michael Natterer
(c)2015 Michael Natterer

gimp-brush-get-hardness

NAME
gimp-brush-get-hardness
SYNOPSIS
hardness = pdb.gimp_brush_get_hardness(name)
BLURB
Gets the hardness of a generated brush.
HELP
This procedure gets the hardness of a generated brush. The hardness of a brush is the amount its intensity fades at the outside edge, as a float between 0.0 and 1.0. If called for any other type of brush, the function does not succeed.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe brush name
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
hardnessGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe hardness of the brush.
AUTHOR
Bill Skaggs
(c)2004 Bill Skaggs

file-xpm-save

NAME
file-xpm-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_xpm_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, threshold)
BLURB
Export files in XPM (X11 Pixmap) format.
HELP
Export files in XPM (X11 Pixmap) format. XPM is a portable image format designed to be included in C source code. XLib provides utility functions to read this format. Newer code should however be using gdk-pixbuf-csource instead. XPM supports colored images, unlike the XBM format which XPM was designed to replace.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to export
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to export the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to export the image in
thresholdGIMP_PDB_INT32Alpha threshold (0-255)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis & Ray Lehtiniemi & Nathan Summers
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-layer-is-floating-sel

num-bytes, profile-data = pdb.gimp_image_get_effective_color_profile(image)
BLURB
Returns the color profile that is used for the image
HELP
This procedure returns the color profile that is actually used for this image, which is the profile returned by 'gimp-image-get-color-profile' if the image has a profile assigned, or a generated default RGB or grayscale profile, according to the image's type.
MENUPATH

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

RETURN VALUES

profile-dataGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYThe image's serialized color profile. The returned value must be freed with g_free()
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2015 Michael Natterer

gimp-brush-set-shape

NAME
gimp-brush-set-shape
SYNOPSIS
shape-out = pdb.gimp_brush_set_shape(name, shape-in)
BLURB
Sets the shape of a generated brush.
HELP
This procedure sets the shape value for a generated brush. If called for any other type of brush, it does not succeed. The current possibilities are Circle (GIMP_BRUSH_GENERATED_CIRCLE), Square (GIMP_BRUSH_GENERATED_SQUARE), and Diamond (GIMP_BRUSH_GENERATED_DIAMOND). Other shapes are likely to be added in the future.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe brush name
shape-inGIMP_PDB_INT32The brush shape {
BRUSH-GENERATED-CIRCLE (0)
BRUSH-GENERATED-SQUARE (1)
BRUSH-GENERATED-DIAMOND (2)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
shape-outGIMP_PDB_INT32The brush shape actually assigned {
BRUSH-GENERATED-CIRCLE (0)
BRUSH-GENERATED-SQUARE (1)
BRUSH-GENERATED-DIAMOND (2)
}
AUTHOR
Bill Skaggs
(c)2004 Bill Skaggs

y0GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of upper-left corner of original bounding box
x1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of upper-right corner of original bounding box
y1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of upper-right corner of original bounding box
x2GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of lower-left corner of original bounding box
y2GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of lower-left corner of original bounding box

gimp-image-merge-visible-layers

NAME
gimp-image-merge-visible-layers
SYNOPSIS
layer = pdb.gimp_image_merge_visible_layers(image, merge-type)
BLURB
Merge the visible image layers into one.
HELP
This procedure combines the visible layers into a single layer using the specified merge type. A merge type of EXPAND_AS_NECESSARY expands the final layer to encompass the areas of the visible layers. A merge type of CLIP_TO_IMAGE clips the final layer to the extents of the image. A merge type of CLIP_TO_BOTTOM_LAYER clips the final layer to the size of the bottommost layer.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
merge-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of merge {
EXPAND-AS-NECESSARY (0)
CLIP-TO-IMAGE (1)
CLIP-TO-BOTTOM-LAYER (2)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe resulting layer
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-item-set-lock-position

BLURB

This procedure sets the specified item's lock position state.

plug-in-vpropagate

NAME
plug-in-vpropagate
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_vpropagate(run-mode, image, drawable, propagate-mode, propagating-channel, propagating-rate, direction-mask, lower-limit, upper-limit)
BLURB
Propagate certain colors to neighboring pixels
HELP
Propagate values of the layer.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
propagate-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Propagate mode {
0:white
1:black
2:middle value 3:foreground to peak
4:foreground
5:background
6:opaque
7:transparent
} (0 <= propagate-mode <= 7)
propagating-channelGIMP_PDB_INT32Channels which values are propagated
propagating-rateGIMP_PDB_FLOATPropagating rate (0 <= propagating-rate <= 1)
direction-maskGIMP_PDB_INT32Direction mask (0 <= direction-mask <= 15)
lower-limitGIMP_PDB_INT32Lower limit (0 <= lower-limit <= 255)
upper-limitGIMP_PDB_INT32Upper limit (0 <= upper-limit <= 255)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:value-propagate' for credits.
(c)2015 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:value-propagate' for credits.

plug-in-randomize-slur

NAME
plug-in-randomize-slur
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_randomize_slur(run-mode, image, drawable, rndm-pct, rndm-rcount, randomize, seed)
BLURB
Randomly slide some pixels downward (similar to melting
HELP
This plug-in "slurs" (melts like a bunch of icicles) an image. You may select the percentage of pixels to modify and the number of times to repeat the process.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
rndm-pctGIMP_PDB_FLOATRandomization percentage (1 <= rndm-pct <= 100)
rndm-rcountGIMP_PDB_FLOATRepeat count (1 <= rndm-rcount <= 100)
randomizeGIMP_PDB_INT32Use random seed (TRUE or FALSE)
seedGIMP_PDB_INT32Seed value (used only if randomize is FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:noise-slur' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:noise-slur' for credits.

gimp-plugins-query

HELP

NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

num-pluginsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of plug-ins (num-plugins >= 0)
plugin-acceleratorGIMP_PDB_STRINGARRAYString representing keyboard accelerator (could be empty string)
num-pluginsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of plug-ins (num-plugins >= 0)
plugin-locationGIMP_PDB_STRINGARRAYLocation of the plug-in program
num-pluginsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of plug-ins (num-plugins >= 0)
plugin-image-typeGIMP_PDB_STRINGARRAYType of image that this plug-in will work on
num-pluginsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of plug-ins (num-plugins >= 0)
plugin-install-timeGIMP_PDB_INT32ARRAYTime that the plug-in was installed
num-pluginsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of plug-ins (num-plugins >= 0)
plugin-real-nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGARRAYThe internal name of the plug-in

plug-in-red-eye-removal

NAME
plug-in-red-eye-removal
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_red_eye_removal(run-mode, image, drawable, threshold)
BLURB
Remove the red eye effect caused by camera flashes
HELP
This procedure removes the red eye effect caused by camera flashes by using a percentage based red color threshold. Make a selection containing the eyes, and apply the filter while adjusting the threshold to accurately remove the red eyes.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
thresholdGIMP_PDB_INT32Red eye threshold in percent (0 <= threshold <= 100)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:red-eye-removal' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:red-eye-removal' for credits.

gimp-image-resize

NAME
gimp-image-resize
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_resize(image, new-width, new-height, offx, offy)
BLURB
Resize the image to the specified extents.
HELP
This procedure resizes the image so that it's new width and height are equal to the supplied parameters. Offsets are also provided which describe the position of the previous image's content. All channels within the image are resized according to the specified parameters; this includes the image selection mask. All layers within the image are repositioned according to the specified offsets.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
new-widthGIMP_PDB_INT32New image width (1 <= new-width <= 524288)
new-heightGIMP_PDB_INT32New image height (1 <= new-height <= 524288)
offxGIMP_PDB_INT32x offset between upper left corner of old and new images: (new - old)
offyGIMP_PDB_INT32y offset between upper left corner of old and new images: (new - old)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-decompose-registered

NAME
plug-in-decompose-registered
SYNOPSIS
new-image, new-image, new-image, new-image = pdb.plug_in_decompose_registered(run-mode, image, drawable, decompose-type, layers-mode)
BLURB
Decompose an image into separate colorspace components
HELP
This function creates new gray images with different channel information in each of them. Pixels in the foreground color will appear black in all output images. This can be used for things like crop marks that have to show up on all channels.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
decompose-typeGIMP_PDB_STRINGWhat to decompose: "RGB", "RGBA", "Red", "Green", "Blue", "Alpha", "HSV", "Hue", "Saturation", "Value", "HSL", "Hue (HSL)", "Saturation (HSL)", "Lightness", "CMYK", "Cyan", "Magenta", "Yellow", "Black", "LAB", "LCH", "YCbCr_ITU_R470", "YCbCr_ITU_R470_256", "YCbCr_ITU_R709", "YCbCr_ITU_R709_256"
layers-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Create channels as layers in a single image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput gray image
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput gray image (N/A for single channel extract)
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput gray image (N/A for single channel extract)
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput gray image (N/A for single channel extract)
AUTHOR
Peter Kirchgessner
(c)1997 Peter Kirchgessner, Clarence Risher

gimp-path-set-points

NAME
gimp-path-set-points
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_path_set_points(image, name, ptype, num-path-points, points-pairs)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-vectors-stroke-new-from-points' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-vectors-stroke-new-from-points' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image to set the paths in
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the path to create. If it exists then a unique name will be created - query the list of paths if you want to make sure that the name of the path you create is unique. This will be set as the current path.
ptypeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of the path. Currently only one type (1 = Bezier) is supported.
num-path-pointsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of elements in the array, i.e. the number of points in the path * 3. Each point is made up of (x, y, type) of floats. Currently only the creation of bezier curves is allowed. The type parameter must be set to (1) to indicate a BEZIER type curve. Note that for BEZIER curves, points must be given in the following order: ACCACCAC... If the path is not closed the last control point is missed off. Points consist of three control points (control/anchor/control) so for a curve that is not closed there must be at least two points passed (2 x,y pairs). If (num_path_points/3) % 3 = 0 then the path is assumed to be closed and the points are ACCACCACCACC. (num-path-points >= 0)
points-pairsGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYThe points in the path represented as 3 floats. The first is the x pos, next is the y pos, last is the type of the pnt. The type field is dependent on the path type. For beziers (type 1 paths) the type can either be (1.0 = BEZIER_ANCHOR, 2.0 = BEZIER_CONTROL, 3.0= BEZIER_MOVE). Note all points are returned in pixel resolution.
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR

(c)

gimp-text-fontname

NAME
gimp-text-fontname
SYNOPSIS
text-layer = pdb.gimp_text_fontname(image, drawable, x, y, text, border, antialias, size, size-type, fontname)
BLURB
Add text at the specified location as a floating selection or a new layer.
HELP
This tool requires a fontname matching an installed PangoFT2 font. You can specify the fontsize in units of pixels or points, and the appropriate metric is specified using the size_type argument. The x and y parameters together control the placement of the new text by specifying the upper left corner of the text bounding box. If the specified drawable parameter is valid, the text will be created as a floating selection attached to the drawable. If the drawable parameter is not valid (-1), the text will appear as a new layer. Finally, a border can be specified around the final rendered text. The border is measured in pixels. Parameter size-type is not used and is currently ignored. If you need to display a font in points, divide the size in points by 72.0 and multiply it by the image's vertical resolution.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable: (-1 for a new text layer)
xGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe x coordinate for the left of the text bounding box
yGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe y coordinate for the top of the text bounding box
textGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe text to generate (in UTF-8 encoding)
borderGIMP_PDB_INT32The size of the border (border >= -1)
antialiasGIMP_PDB_INT32Antialiasing (TRUE or FALSE)
sizeGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe size of text in either pixels or points (size >= 0)
size-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The units of specified size {
PIXELS (0)
POINTS (1)
}
fontnameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the font
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
text-layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe new text layer or -1 if no layer was created.
AUTHOR
Martin Edlman & Sven Neumann
(c)1998- 2001 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

HELP

gimp-color-balance

NAME
gimp-color-balance
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_color_balance(drawable, transfer-mode, preserve-lum, cyan-red, magenta-green, yellow-blue)
BLURB
Modify the color balance of the specified drawable.
HELP
Modify the color balance of the specified drawable. There are three axis which can be modified: cyan-red, magenta-green, and yellow-blue. Negative values increase the amount of the former, positive values increase the amount of the latter. Color balance can be controlled with the 'transfer_mode' setting, which allows shadows, mid-tones, and highlights in an image to be affected differently. The 'preserve-lum' parameter, if TRUE, ensures that the luminosity of each pixel remains fixed. Deprecated: Use 'gimp-drawable-color-color-balance' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
transfer-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Transfer mode {
TRANSFER-SHADOWS (0)
TRANSFER-MIDTONES (1)
TRANSFER-HIGHLIGHTS (2)
}
preserve-lumGIMP_PDB_INT32Preserve luminosity values at each pixel (TRUE or FALSE)
cyan-redGIMP_PDB_FLOATCyan-Red color balance (-100 <= cyan-red <= 100)
magenta-greenGIMP_PDB_FLOATMagenta-Green color balance (-100 <= magenta-green <= 100)
yellow-blueGIMP_PDB_FLOATYellow-Blue color balance (-100 <= yellow-blue <= 100)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-airbrush

NAME
gimp-airbrush
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_airbrush(drawable, pressure, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Paint in the current brush with varying pressure. Paint application is time-dependent.
HELP
This tool simulates the use of an airbrush. Paint pressure represents the relative intensity of the paint application. High pressure results in a thicker layer of paint while low pressure results in a thinner layer.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
pressureGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe pressure of the airbrush strokes (0 <= pressure <= 100)
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

file-pdf-save-multi

NAME
file-pdf-save-multi
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_pdf_save_multi(run-mode, count, images, vectorize, ignore-hidden, apply-masks, filename, raw-filename)
BLURB
Save files in PDF format
HELP
Saves files in Adobe's Portable Document Format. PDF is designed to be easily processed by a variety of different platforms, and is a distant cousin of PostScript.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Run mode
countGIMP_PDB_INT32The amount of images entered (This will be the amount of pages). 1 <= count <= MAX_PAGE_COUNT
imagesGIMP_PDB_INT32ARRAYInput image for each page (An image can appear more than once)
vectorizeGIMP_PDB_INT32Convert bitmaps to vector graphics where possible. TRUE or FALSE
ignore-hiddenGIMP_PDB_INT32Omit hidden layers and layers with zero opacity. TRUE or FALSE
apply-masksGIMP_PDB_INT32Apply layer masks before saving. TRUE or FALSE (Keeping them will not change the output)
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Barak Itkin
(c)August 2009 Copyright Barak Itkin

gimp-edit-clear

NAME
gimp-edit-clear
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_edit_clear(drawable)
BLURB
Clear selected area of drawable.
HELP
This procedure clears the specified drawable. If the drawable has an alpha channel, the cleared pixels will become transparent. If the drawable does not have an alpha channel, cleared pixels will be set to the background color. This procedure only affects regions within a selection if there is a selection active. Deprecated: Use 'gimp-drawable-edit-clear' instead.

plug-in-deinterlace

NAME
plug-in-deinterlace
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_deinterlace(run-mode, image, drawable, evenodd)
BLURB
Fix images where every other row is missing
HELP
Deinterlace is useful for processing images from video capture cards. When only the odd or even fields get captured, deinterlace can be used to interpolate between the existing fields to correct this.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)

}

drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
evenoddGIMP_PDB_INT32Which lines to keep {
KEEP-ODD (0)
KEEP-EVEN (1) (0 <= evenodd <= 1)
RETURN VALUES

gimp-selection-bounds

NAME
gimp-selection-bounds
SYNOPSIS
non-empty, x1, y1, x2, y2 = pdb.gimp_selection_bounds(image)
BLURB
Find the bounding box of the current selection.
HELP
This procedure returns whether there is a selection for the specified image. If there is one, the upper left and lower right corners of the bounding box are returned. These coordinates are relative to the image. Please note that the pixel specified by the lower right coordinate of the bounding box is not part of the selection. The selection ends at the upper left corner of this pixel. This means the width of the selection can be calculated as (x2 - x1), its height as (y2 - y1).
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
non-emptyGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if there is a selection (TRUE or FALSE)
x1GIMP_PDB_INT32x coordinate of upper left corner of selection bounds
y1GIMP_PDB_INT32y coordinate of upper left corner of selection bounds
x2GIMP_PDB_INT32x coordinate of lower right corner of selection bounds
y2GIMP_PDB_INT32y coordinate of lower right corner of selection bounds
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-softglow

NAME
plug-in-softglow
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_softglow(run-mode, image, drawable, glow-radius, brightness, sharpness)
BLURB
Simulate glow by making highlights intense and fuzzy
HELP
Gives an image a softglow effect by intensifying the highlights in the image. This is done by screening a modified version of the drawable with itself. The modified version is desaturated and then a sigmoidal transfer function is applied to force the distribution of intensities into very small and very large only. This desaturated version is then blurred to give it a fuzzy 'vaseline-on-the-lens' effect. The glow radius parameter controls the sharpness of the glow effect. The brightness parameter controls the degree of intensification applied to image highlights. The sharpness parameter controls how defined or alternatively, diffuse, the glow effect should be.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
glow-radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATGlow radius (radius in pixels)
brightnessGIMP_PDB_FLOATGlow brightness (0.0 - 1.0)
sharpnessGIMP_PDB_FLOATGlow sharpness (0.0 - 1.0)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball
(c)2001 Bit Specialists, Inc.

gimp-image-grid-get-background-color

bgcolor = pdb.gimp_image_grid_get_background_color(image)

(c)2005 Sylvain Foret

plug-in-retinex

NAME
plug-in-retinex
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_retinex(run-mode, image, drawable, scale, nscales, scales-mode, cvar)
BLURB
Enhance contrast using the Retinex method
HELP
The Retinex Image Enhancement Algorithm is an automatic image enhancement method that enhances a digital image in terms of dynamic range compression, color independence from the spectral distribution of the scene illuminant, and color/lightness rendition.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
scaleGIMP_PDB_INT32Biggest scale value
nscalesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of scales
scales-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Retinex distribution through scales
cvarGIMP_PDB_FLOATVariance value
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Fabien Pelisson
(c)2003 Fabien Pelisson

gimp-drawable-levels

NAME
gimp-drawable-levels
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_levels(drawable, channel, low-input, high-input, clamp-input, gamma, low-output, high-output, clamp-output)
BLURB
Modifies intensity levels in the specified drawable.
HELP
This tool allows intensity levels in the specified drawable to be remapped according to a set of parameters. The low/high input levels specify an initial mapping from the source intensities. The gamma value determines how intensities between the low and high input intensities are interpolated. A gamma value of 1.0 results in a linear interpolation. Higher gamma values result in more high-level intensities. Lower gamma values result in more low-level intensities. The low/high output levels constrain the final intensity mapping--that is, no final intensity will be lower than the low output level and no final intensity will be higher than the high output level. This tool is only valid on RGB color and grayscale images.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
channelGIMP_PDB_INT32The channel to modify {
HISTOGRAM-VALUE (0)
HISTOGRAM-RED (1)
HISTOGRAM-GREEN (2)
HISTOGRAM-BLUE (3)
HISTOGRAM-ALPHA (4)
HISTOGRAM-LUMINANCE (5)
HISTOGRAM-RGB (6)
}
low-inputGIMP_PDB_FLOATIntensity of lowest input (0 <= low-input <= 1)
high-inputGIMP_PDB_FLOATIntensity of highest input (0 <= high-input <= 1)
clamp-inputGIMP_PDB_INT32Clamp input values before applying output levels (TRUE or FALSE)
gammaGIMP_PDB_FLOATGamma adjustment factor (0.1 <= gamma <= 10)
low-outputGIMP_PDB_FLOATIntensity of lowest output (0 <= low-output <= 1)
high-outputGIMP_PDB_FLOATIntensity of highest output (0 <= high-output <= 1)
clamp-outputGIMP_PDB_INT32Clamp final output values (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

script-fu-selection-round

script-fu-selection-round

BLURB

}

drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATRelative radius
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)1998/02/06 Sven Neumann

gimp-eraser

NAME
gimp-eraser
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_eraser(drawable, num-strokes, strokes, hardness, method)
BLURB
Erase using the current brush.
HELP
This tool erases using the current brush mask. If the specified drawable contains an alpha channel, then the erased pixels will become transparent. Otherwise, the eraser tool replaces the contents of the drawable with the background color. Like paintbrush, this tool linearly interpolates between the specified stroke coordinates.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
hardnessGIMP_PDB_INT32How to apply the brush {
BRUSH-HARD (0)
BRUSH-SOFT (1)
}
methodGIMP_PDB_INT32The paint method to use {
PAINT-CONSTANT (0)
PAINT-INCREMENTAL (1)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-text-layer-get-kerning

Marcus Heese
(c)2008 Marcus Heese

python-fu-palette-sort

NAME
python-fu-palette-sort
SYNOPSIS
pdb.python_fu_palette_sort(run-mode, palette, selections, slice-expr, channel1, ascending1, channel2, ascending2, quantize, pchannel, pquantize)
BLURB
Sort the colors in a palette
HELP
palette_sort (palette, selection, slice_expr, channel, channel2, quantize, ascending, pchannel, pquantize) -> new_palette Sorts a palette, or part of a palette, using several options. One can select two color channels over which to sort, and several auxiliary parameters create a 2D sorted palette with sorted rows, among other things. One can optionally install colormath (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/colormath/1.0.8), to GIMP's Python to get even more channels to choose from.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
paletteGIMP_PDB_STRINGPalette
selectionsGIMP_PDB_INT32Selections
slice-exprGIMP_PDB_STRINGSlice expression
channel1GIMP_PDB_INT32Channel to sort
ascending1GIMP_PDB_INT32Ascending
channel2GIMP_PDB_INT32Secondary Channel to sort
ascending2GIMP_PDB_INT32Ascending
quantizeGIMP_PDB_FLOATQuantisation
pchannelGIMP_PDB_INT32Partitioning channel
pquantizeGIMP_PDB_FLOATPartition quantisation
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno, Carol Spears, David Gowers
(c)2006-2014 João S. O. Bueno, Carol Spears, David Gowers

gimp-paintbrush

NAME
gimp-paintbrush
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_paintbrush(drawable, fade-out, num-strokes, strokes, method, gradient-length)
BLURB
Paint in the current brush with optional fade out parameter and pull colors from a gradient.
HELP
This tool is the standard paintbrush. It draws linearly interpolated lines through the specified stroke coordinates. It operates on the specified drawable in the foreground color with the active brush. The 'fade-out' parameter is measured in pixels and allows the brush stroke to linearly fall off. The pressure is set to the maximum at the beginning of the stroke. As the distance of the stroke nears the fade-out value, the pressure will approach zero. The gradient-length is the distance to spread the gradient over. It is measured in pixels. If the gradient-length is 0, no gradient is used.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
fade-outGIMP_PDB_FLOATFade out parameter (fade-out >= 0)
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
methodGIMP_PDB_INT32The paint method to use {
PAINT-CONSTANT (0)
PAINT-INCREMENTAL (1)
}
gradient-lengthGIMP_PDB_FLOATLength of gradient to draw (gradient-length >= 0)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-displays-reconnect

NAME
gimp-displays-reconnect
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_displays_reconnect(old-image, new-image)
BLURB
Reconnect displays from one image to another image.
HELP
This procedure connects all displays of the old_image to the new_image. If the old_image has no display or new_image already has a display the reconnect is not performed and the procedure returns without success. You should rarely need to use this function.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
old-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe old image (must have at least one display)
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe new image (must not have a display)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-select-rectangle

NAME
gimp-image-select-rectangle
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_select_rectangle(image, operation, x, y, width, height)
BLURB
Create a rectangular selection over the specified image;
HELP
This tool creates a rectangular selection over the specified image. The rectangular region can be either added to, subtracted from, or replace the contents of the previous selection mask. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-feather', 'gimp-context-set-feather-radius'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
operationGIMP_PDB_INT32The selection operation {
CHANNEL-OP-ADD (0)
CHANNEL-OP-SUBTRACT (1)
CHANNEL-OP-REPLACE (2)
CHANNEL-OP-INTERSECT (3)
}
xGIMP_PDB_FLOATx coordinate of upper-left corner of rectangle
yGIMP_PDB_FLOATy coordinate of upper-left corner of rectangle
widthGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe width of the rectangle (width >= 0)
heightGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe height of the rectangle (height >= 0)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

gimp-gradient-segment-range-blend-colors

NAME
gimp-gradient-segment-range-blend-colors
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_gradient_segment_range_blend_colors(name, start-segment, end-segment)
BLURB
Blend the colors of the segment range.
HELP
This function blends the colors (but not the opacity) of the segments' range of the gradient. Using it, the colors' transition will be uniform across the range.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe gradient name
start-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the first segment to operate on (start-segment >= 0)
end-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the last segment to operate on. If negative, the selection will extend to the end of the string.
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Shlomi Fish
(c)2003 Shlomi Fish

gimp-image-select-polygon

NAME
gimp-image-select-polygon
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_select_polygon(image, operation, num-segs, segs)
BLURB
Create a polygonal selection over the specified image.
HELP
This tool creates a polygonal selection over the specified image. The polygonal region can be either added to, subtracted from, or replace the contents of the previous selection mask. The polygon is specified through an array of floating point numbers and its length. The length of array must be 2n, where n is the number of points. Each point is defined by 2 floating point values which correspond to the x and y coordinates. If the final point does not connect to the starting point, a connecting segment is automatically added. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-antialias', 'gimp-context-set-feather', 'gimp-context-set-feather-radius'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
operationGIMP_PDB_INT32The selection operation {
CHANNEL-OP-ADD (0)
CHANNEL-OP-SUBTRACT (1)
CHANNEL-OP-REPLACE (2)
CHANNEL-OP-INTERSECT (3)
}
num-segsGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of points (count 1 coordinate as two points) (num-segs >= 2)
segsGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of points: {
p1.x
p1.y
p2.x
p2.y
...
pn.x
pn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

plug-in-wind

NAME
plug-in-wind
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_wind(run-mode, image, drawable, threshold, direction, strength, algorithm, edge)
BLURB
Smear image to give windblown effect
HELP
Renders a wind effect.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
thresholdGIMP_PDB_INT32Controls where blending will be done (0 <= threshold <= 50)
directionGIMP_PDB_INT32Wind direction {
0:left
1:right
2:top
3:bottom
} (0 <= direction <= 3)
strengthGIMP_PDB_INT32Controls the extent of the blending (1 <= strength <= 100)
algorithmGIMP_PDB_INT32Algorithm {
WIND (0)
BLAST (1)
} (0 <= algorithm <= 1)
edgeGIMP_PDB_INT32Affected edge {
BOTH (0)
LEADING (1)
TRAILING (2)
} (0 <= edge <= 2)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:wind' for credits.
(c)2015 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:wind' for credits.

gimp-selection-sharpen

NAME
gimp-selection-sharpen
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_selection_sharpen(image)
BLURB
Sharpen the selection mask.
HELP
This procedure sharpens the selection mask. For every pixel in the selection channel, if the value is > 127, the new pixel is assigned a value of 255. This removes any "anti-aliasing" that might exist in the selection mask's boundary.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-brush-set-aspect-ratio

NAME
gimp-brush-set-aspect-ratio
SYNOPSIS
aspect-ratio-out = pdb.gimp_brush_set_aspect_ratio(name, aspect-ratio-in)
BLURB
Sets the aspect ratio of a generated brush.
HELP
This procedure sets the aspect ratio for a generated brush. If called for any other type of brush, it does not succeed. The value should be a float between 0.0 and 1000.0.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe brush name
aspect-ratio-inGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe desired brush aspect ratio
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
aspect-ratio-outGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe brush aspect ratio actually assigned
AUTHOR
Bill Skaggs
(c)2004 Bill Skaggs

plug-in-erode

NAME
plug-in-erode
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_erode(run-mode, image, drawable, propagate-mode, propagating-channel, propagating-rate, direction-mask, lower-limit, upper-limit)
BLURB
Shrink lighter areas of the image
HELP
Erode image.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
propagate-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Propagate mode {
0:white
1:black
2:middle value 3:foreground to peak
4:foreground
5:background
6:opaque
7:transparent
} (0 <= propagate-mode <= 7)
propagating-channelGIMP_PDB_INT32Channels which values are propagated
propagating-rateGIMP_PDB_FLOATPropagating rate (0 <= propagating-rate <= 1)
direction-maskGIMP_PDB_INT32Direction mask (0 <= direction-mask <= 15)
lower-limitGIMP_PDB_INT32Lower limit (0 <= lower-limit <= 255)
upper-limitGIMP_PDB_INT32Upper limit (0 <= upper-limit <= 255)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:value-propagate' for credits.
(c)2015 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:value-propagate' for credits.

gimp-progress-end

NAME
gimp-progress-end
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_progress_end()
BLURB
Ends the progress bar for the current plug-in.
HELP
Ends the progress display for the current plug-in. Most plug-ins don't need to call this, they just exit when the work is done. It is only valid to call this procedure from a plug-in.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS

plug-in-sinus

NAME
plug-in-sinus
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_sinus(run-mode, image, drawable, xscale, yscale, complex, seed, tiling, perturb, colors, col1, col2, alpha1, alpha2, blend, blend-power)
BLURB
Generate complex sinusoidal textures
HELP
FIXME: sinus help
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
xscaleGIMP_PDB_FLOATScale value for x axis (xscale >= 0)
yscaleGIMP_PDB_FLOATScale value for y axis (yscale >= 0)
complexGIMP_PDB_FLOATComplexity factor (complex >= 0)
seedGIMP_PDB_INT32Seed value for random number generator (seed >= 0)
tilingGIMP_PDB_INT32If set, the pattern generated will tile (TRUE or FALSE)
perturbGIMP_PDB_INT32If set, the pattern is a little more distorted... (TRUE or FALSE)
colorsGIMP_PDB_INT32where to take the colors (0=B&W, 1=fg/bg, 2=col1/col2) (0 <= colors <= 2)
col1GIMP_PDB_COLORfist color (sometimes unused)
col2GIMP_PDB_COLORsecond color (sometimes unused)
alpha1GIMP_PDB_FLOATalpha for the first color (used if the drawable has an alpha channel) (0 <= alpha1 <= 1)
alpha2GIMP_PDB_FLOATalpha for the second color (used if the drawable has an alpha channel) (0 <= alpha2 <= 1)
blendGIMP_PDB_INT320=linear, 1=bilinear, 2=sinusoidal (0 <= blend <= 2)
blend-powerGIMP_PDB_FLOATPower used to stretch the blend
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:sinus' for credits.
(c)2014 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:sinus' for credits.

gimp-image-convert-indexed

NAME
gimp-image-convert-indexed
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_convert_indexed(image, dither-type, palette-type, num-cols, alpha-dither, remove-unused, palette)
BLURB
Convert specified image to and Indexed image
HELP
This procedure converts the specified image to 'indexed' color. This process requires an image in RGB or Grayscale mode. The 'palette_type' specifies what kind of palette to use, A type of '0' means to use an optimal palette of 'num_cols' generated from the colors in the image. A type of '1' means to re-use the previous palette (not currently implemented). A type of '2' means to use the so-called WWW-optimized palette. Type '3' means to use only black and white colors. A type of '4' means to use a palette from the gimp palettes directories. The 'dither type' specifies what kind of dithering to use. '0' means no dithering, '1' means standard Floyd-Steinberg error diffusion, '2' means Floyd-Steinberg error diffusion with reduced bleeding, '3' means dithering based on pixel location ('Fixed' dithering).
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
dither-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The dither type to use {
CONVERT-DITHER-NONE (0)
CONVERT-DITHER-FS (1)
CONVERT-DITHER-FS-LOWBLEED (2)
CONVERT-DITHER-FIXED (3)
}
palette-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of palette to use {
CONVERT-PALETTE-GENERATE (0)
CONVERT-PALETTE-WEB (2)
CONVERT-PALETTE-MONO (3)
CONVERT-PALETTE-CUSTOM (4)
}
num-colsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of colors to quantize to, ignored unless (palette_type == GIMP_CONVERT_PALETTE_GENERATE)
alpha-ditherGIMP_PDB_INT32Dither transparency to fake partial opacity (TRUE or FALSE)
remove-unusedGIMP_PDB_INT32Remove unused or duplicate color entries from final palette, ignored if (palette_type == GIMP_CONVERT_PALETTE_GENERATE) (TRUE or FALSE)
paletteGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the custom palette to use, ignored unless (palette_type == GIMP_CONVERT_PALETTE_CUSTOM)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-context-set-brush-default-spacing

SYNOPSIS
uri = pdb.gimp_image_get_imported_uri(image)
BLURB
Returns the imported URI for the specified image.
HELP
This procedure returns the URI associated with the specified image if the image was imported from a non-native Gimp format. If the image was not imported, or has since been saved in the native Gimp format, this procedure returns %NULL.

NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

Eric Grivel
(c)2011 Eric Grivel

gimp-round-rect-select

BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-image-select-round-rectangle' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-image-select-round-rectangle' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
xGIMP_PDB_FLOATx coordinate of upper-left corner of rectangle
yGIMP_PDB_FLOATy coordinate of upper-left corner of rectangle
widthGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe width of the rectangle (width >= 0)
heightGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe height of the rectangle (height >= 0)
corner-radius-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe corner radius in X direction (0 <= corner-radius-x <= 524288)
corner-radius-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe corner radius in Y direction (0 <= corner-radius-y <= 524288)
operationGIMP_PDB_INT32The selection operation {
CHANNEL-OP-ADD (0)
CHANNEL-OP-SUBTRACT (1)
CHANNEL-OP-REPLACE (2)
CHANNEL-OP-INTERSECT (3)
}
antialiasGIMP_PDB_INT32Antialiasing (TRUE or FALSE)
featherGIMP_PDB_INT32Feather option for selections (TRUE or FALSE)
feather-radius-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius for feather operation in X direction (feather-radius-x >= 0)
feather-radius-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius for feather operation in Y direction (feather-radius-y >= 0)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Martin Nordholts
(c)2006 Martin Nordholts

gimp-image-freeze-layers

NAME
gimp-image-freeze-layers
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_freeze_layers(image)
BLURB
Freeze the image's layer list.
HELP
This procedure freezes the layer list of the image, suppressing any updates to the Layers dialog in response to changes to the image's layers. This can significantly improve performance while applying changes affecting the layer list. Each call to 'gimp-image-freeze-layers' should be matched by a corresponding call to 'gimp-image-thaw-layers', undoing its effects.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Ell
(c)2018 Ell

pdb.gimp_text_layer_set_hint_style(layer, style)
BLURB
Control how font outlines are hinted in a text layer.
HELP
This procedure sets the hint style for font outlines in a text layer. This controls whether to fit font outlines to the pixel grid, and if so, whether to optimize for fidelity or contrast.

TEXT-HINT-STYLE-FULL (3)
}

gimp-heal-default

NAME
gimp-heal-default
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_heal_default(drawable, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Heal from the source to the dest drawable using the current brush
HELP
This tool heals from the source drawable starting at the specified source coordinates to the dest drawable. This function performs exactly the same as the 'gimp-heal' function except that the tools arguments are obtained from the healing option dialog. It this dialog has not been activated then the dialogs default values will be used.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Kevin Sookocheff
(c)2006 Kevin Sookocheff
