file-jpeg-save

NAME
file-jpeg-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_jpeg_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, quality, smoothing, optimize, progressive, comment, subsmp, baseline, restart, dct)
BLURB
saves files in the JPEG file format
HELP
saves files in the lossy, widely supported JPEG format
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to save
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
qualityGIMP_PDB_FLOATQuality of saved image (0 <= quality <= 1)
smoothingGIMP_PDB_FLOATSmoothing factor for saved image (0 <= smoothing <= 1)
optimizeGIMP_PDB_INT32Use optimized tables during Huffman coding (0/1)
progressiveGIMP_PDB_INT32Create progressive JPEG images (0/1)
commentGIMP_PDB_STRINGImage comment
subsmpGIMP_PDB_INT32Sub-sampling type {
0
1
2
3
} 0 == 4:2:0 (chroma quartered)
1 == 4:2:2 Horizontal (chroma halved)
2 == 4:4:4 (best quality)
3 == 4:2:2 Vertical (chroma halved)
baselineGIMP_PDB_INT32Force creation of a baseline JPEG (non-baseline JPEGs can't be read by all decoders) (0/1)
restartGIMP_PDB_INT32Interval of restart markers (in MCU rows, 0 = no restart markers)
dctGIMP_PDB_INT32DCT method to use {
INTEGER (0)
FIXED (1)
FLOAT (2)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball, Peter Mattis & others
(c)1995-2007 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-animationoptimize-diff

NAME
plug-in-animationoptimize-diff
SYNOPSIS
result = pdb.plug_in_animationoptimize_diff(run-mode, image, drawable)
BLURB
Reduce file size where combining layers is possible
HELP
This procedure applies various optimizations to a GIMP layer-based animation in an attempt to reduce the final file size. If a frame of the animation can use the 'combine' mode, this procedure uses a simple difference between the frames.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable (unused)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
resultGIMP_PDB_IMAGEResulting image
AUTHOR
Adam D. Moss
(c)1997-2001 Adam D. Moss

plug-in-tile

NAME
plug-in-tile
SYNOPSIS
new-image, new-layer = pdb.plug_in_tile(run-mode, image, drawable, new-width, new-height, new-image)
BLURB
Create an array of copies of the image
HELP
This function creates a new image with a single layer sized to the specified 'new_width' and 'new_height' parameters. The specified drawable is tiled into this layer. The new layer will have the same type as the specified drawable and the new image will have a corresponding base type.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
new-widthGIMP_PDB_INT32New (tiled) image width
new-heightGIMP_PDB_INT32New (tiled) image height
new-imageGIMP_PDB_INT32Create a new image?
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput image (-1 if new-image == FALSE)
new-layerGIMP_PDB_LAYEROutput layer (-1 if new-image == FALSE)
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1996-1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-selection-all

NAME
gimp-selection-all
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_selection_all(image)
BLURB
Select all of the image.
HELP
This procedure sets the selection mask to completely encompass the image. Every pixel in the selection channel is set to 255.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-procedural-db-proc-info

NAME
gimp-procedural-db-proc-info
SYNOPSIS
blurb, help, author, copyright, date, proc-type, num-args, num-values = pdb.gimp_procedural_db_proc_info(procedure-name)
BLURB
Queries the procedural database for information on the specified procedure.
HELP
This procedure returns information on the specified procedure. A short blurb, detailed help, author(s), copyright information, procedure type, number of input, and number of return values are returned. For specific information on each input argument and return value, use the 'gimp-procedural-db-proc-arg' and 'gimp-procedural-db-proc-val' procedures.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
procedure-nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe procedure name
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
blurbGIMP_PDB_STRINGA short blurb
helpGIMP_PDB_STRINGDetailed procedure help
authorGIMP_PDB_STRINGAuthor(s) of the procedure
copyrightGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe copyright
dateGIMP_PDB_STRINGCopyright date
proc-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The procedure type {
INTERNAL (0)
PLUGIN (1)
EXTENSION (2)
TEMPORARY (3)
}
num-argsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of input arguments
num-valuesGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of return values
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-find-next-guide

NAME
gimp-image-find-next-guide
SYNOPSIS
next-guide = pdb.gimp_image_find_next_guide(image, guide)
BLURB
Find next guide on an image.
HELP
This procedure takes an image and a guide ID as input and finds the guide ID of the successor of the given guide ID in the image's guide list. If the supplied guide ID is 0, the procedure will return the first Guide. The procedure will return 0 if given the final guide ID as an argument or the image has no guides.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
guideGIMP_PDB_INT32The ID of the current guide (0 if first invocation)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
next-guideGIMP_PDB_INT32The next guide's ID
AUTHOR
Adam D. Moss
(c)1998 Adam D. Moss

plug-in-oilify-enhanced

NAME
plug-in-oilify-enhanced
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_oilify_enhanced(run-mode, image, drawable, mode, mask-size, mask-size-map, exponent, exponent-map)
BLURB
Smear colors to simulate an oil painting
HELP
This function performs the well-known oil-paint effect on the specified drawable.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Algorithm {
RGB (0)
INTENSITY (1)
} (0 <= mode <= 1)
mask-sizeGIMP_PDB_INT32Oil paint mask size (1 <= mask-size <= 200)
mask-size-mapGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEMask size control map
exponentGIMP_PDB_INT32Oil paint exponent (1 <= exponent <= 20)
exponent-mapGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEExponent control map
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:oilify' for credits.
(c)2019 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:oilify' for credits.

gimp-vectors-stroke-get-points

NAME
gimp-vectors-stroke-get-points
SYNOPSIS
type, num-points, controlpoints, closed = pdb.gimp_vectors_stroke_get_points(vectors, stroke-id)
BLURB
returns the control points of a stroke.
HELP
returns the control points of a stroke. The interpretation of the coordinates returned depends on the type of the stroke. For Gimp 2.4 this is always a bezier stroke, where the coordinates are the control points.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
vectorsGIMP_PDB_VECTORSThe vectors object
stroke-idGIMP_PDB_INT32The stroke ID
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
typeGIMP_PDB_INT32type of the stroke (always GIMP_VECTORS_STROKE_TYPE_BEZIER for now). {
VECTORS-STROKE-TYPE-BEZIER (0)
}
num-pointsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of floats returned. (num-points >= 0)
controlpointsGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYList of the control points for the stroke (x0, y0, x1, y1, ...).
closedGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether the stroke is closed or not. (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Simon Budig
(c)2006 Simon Budig

gimp-layer-group-new

NAME
gimp-layer-group-new
SYNOPSIS
layer-group = pdb.gimp_layer_group_new(image)
BLURB
Create a new layer group.
HELP
This procedure creates a new layer group. Attributes such as layer mode and opacity should be set with explicit procedure calls. Add the new layer group (which is a kind of layer) with the 'gimp-image-insert-layer' command. Other procedures useful with layer groups: 'gimp-image-reorder-item', 'gimp-item-get-parent', 'gimp-item-get-children', 'gimp-item-is-group'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image to which to add the layer group
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layer-groupGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe newly created layer group
AUTHOR
Barak Itkin
(c)2010 Barak Itkin

gimp-drawable-transform-2d

NAME
gimp-drawable-transform-2d
SYNOPSIS
drawable = pdb.gimp_drawable_transform_2d(drawable, source-x, source-y, scale-x, scale-y, angle, dest-x, dest-y, transform-direction, interpolation, supersample, recursion-level, clip-result)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-2d' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-2d' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
source-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATX coordinate of the transformation center
source-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATY coordinate of the transformation center
scale-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmount to scale in x direction
scale-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmount to scale in y direction
angleGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe angle of rotation (radians)
dest-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATX coordinate of where the center goes
dest-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATY coordinate of where the center goes
transform-directionGIMP_PDB_INT32Direction of transformation {
TRANSFORM-FORWARD (0)
TRANSFORM-BACKWARD (1)
}
interpolationGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of interpolation {
INTERPOLATION-NONE (0)
INTERPOLATION-LINEAR (1)
INTERPOLATION-CUBIC (2)
INTERPOLATION-NOHALO (3)
INTERPOLATION-LOHALO (4)
}
supersampleGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (TRUE or FALSE)
recursion-levelGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (recursion-level >= 1)
clip-resultGIMP_PDB_INT32How to clip results {
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-ADJUST (0)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CLIP (1)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP (2)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP-WITH-ASPECT (3)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe transformed drawable
AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno
(c)2004 João S. O. Bueno

gimp-edit-bucket-fill-full

NAME
gimp-edit-bucket-fill-full
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_edit_bucket_fill_full(drawable, fill-mode, paint-mode, opacity, threshold, sample-merged, fill-transparent, select-criterion, x, y)
BLURB
Fill the area specified either by the current selection if there is one, or by a seed fill starting at the specified coordinates.
HELP
This tool requires information on the paint application mode, and the fill mode, which can either be in the foreground color, or in the currently active pattern. If there is no selection, a seed fill is executed at the specified coordinates and extends outward in keeping with the threshold parameter. If there is a selection in the target image, the threshold, sample merged, x, and y arguments are unused. If the sample_merged parameter is TRUE, the data of the composite image will be used instead of that for the specified drawable. This is equivalent to sampling for colors after merging all visible layers. In the case of merged sampling, the x and y coordinates are relative to the image's origin; otherwise, they are relative to the drawable's origin. Deprecated: Use 'gimp-drawable-edit-bucket-fill' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
fill-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of fill {
BUCKET-FILL-FG (0)
BUCKET-FILL-BG (1)
BUCKET-FILL-PATTERN (2)
}
paint-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The paint application mode {
LAYER-MODE-NORMAL-LEGACY (0)
LAYER-MODE-DISSOLVE (1)
LAYER-MODE-BEHIND-LEGACY (2)
LAYER-MODE-MULTIPLY-LEGACY (3)
LAYER-MODE-SCREEN-LEGACY (4)
LAYER-MODE-OVERLAY-LEGACY (5)
LAYER-MODE-DIFFERENCE-LEGACY (6)
LAYER-MODE-ADDITION-LEGACY (7)
LAYER-MODE-SUBTRACT-LEGACY (8)
LAYER-MODE-DARKEN-ONLY-LEGACY (9)
LAYER-MODE-LIGHTEN-ONLY-LEGACY (10)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-HUE-LEGACY (11)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-SATURATION-LEGACY (12)
LAYER-MODE-HSL-COLOR-LEGACY (13)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-VALUE-LEGACY (14)
LAYER-MODE-DIVIDE-LEGACY (15)
LAYER-MODE-DODGE-LEGACY (16)
LAYER-MODE-BURN-LEGACY (17)
LAYER-MODE-HARDLIGHT-LEGACY (18)
LAYER-MODE-SOFTLIGHT-LEGACY (19)
LAYER-MODE-GRAIN-EXTRACT-LEGACY (20)
LAYER-MODE-GRAIN-MERGE-LEGACY (21)
LAYER-MODE-COLOR-ERASE-LEGACY (22)
LAYER-MODE-OVERLAY (23)
LAYER-MODE-LCH-HUE (24)
LAYER-MODE-LCH-CHROMA (25)
LAYER-MODE-LCH-COLOR (26)
LAYER-MODE-LCH-LIGHTNESS (27)
LAYER-MODE-NORMAL (28)
LAYER-MODE-BEHIND (29)
LAYER-MODE-MULTIPLY (30)
LAYER-MODE-SCREEN (31)
LAYER-MODE-DIFFERENCE (32)
LAYER-MODE-ADDITION (33)
LAYER-MODE-SUBTRACT (34)
LAYER-MODE-DARKEN-ONLY (35)
LAYER-MODE-LIGHTEN-ONLY (36)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-HUE (37)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-SATURATION (38)
LAYER-MODE-HSL-COLOR (39)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-VALUE (40)
LAYER-MODE-DIVIDE (41)
LAYER-MODE-DODGE (42)
LAYER-MODE-BURN (43)
LAYER-MODE-HARDLIGHT (44)
LAYER-MODE-SOFTLIGHT (45)
LAYER-MODE-GRAIN-EXTRACT (46)
LAYER-MODE-GRAIN-MERGE (47)
LAYER-MODE-VIVID-LIGHT (48)
LAYER-MODE-PIN-LIGHT (49)
LAYER-MODE-LINEAR-LIGHT (50)
LAYER-MODE-HARD-MIX (51)
LAYER-MODE-EXCLUSION (52)
LAYER-MODE-LINEAR-BURN (53)
LAYER-MODE-LUMA-DARKEN-ONLY (54)
LAYER-MODE-LUMA-LIGHTEN-ONLY (55)
LAYER-MODE-LUMINANCE (56)
LAYER-MODE-COLOR-ERASE (57)
LAYER-MODE-ERASE (58)
LAYER-MODE-MERGE (59)
LAYER-MODE-SPLIT (60)
LAYER-MODE-PASS-THROUGH (61)
LAYER-MODE-REPLACE (62)
LAYER-MODE-ANTI-ERASE (63)
}
opacityGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe opacity of the final bucket fill (0 <= opacity <= 100)
thresholdGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe threshold determines how extensive the seed fill will be. It's value is specified in terms of intensity levels. This parameter is only valid when there is no selection in the specified image. (0 <= threshold <= 255)
sample-mergedGIMP_PDB_INT32Use the composite image, not the drawable (TRUE or FALSE)
fill-transparentGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to consider transparent pixels for filling. If TRUE, transparency is considered as a unique fillable color. (TRUE or FALSE)
select-criterionGIMP_PDB_INT32The criterion used to determine color similarity. SELECT_CRITERION_COMPOSITE is the standard choice. {
SELECT-CRITERION-COMPOSITE (0)
SELECT-CRITERION-R (1)
SELECT-CRITERION-G (2)
SELECT-CRITERION-B (3)
SELECT-CRITERION-H (4)
SELECT-CRITERION-S (5)
SELECT-CRITERION-V (6)
SELECT-CRITERION-A (7)
SELECT-CRITERION-LCH-L (8)
SELECT-CRITERION-LCH-C (9)
SELECT-CRITERION-LCH-H (10)
}
xGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe x coordinate of this bucket fill's application. This parameter is only valid when there is no selection in the specified image.
yGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe y coordinate of this bucket fill's application. This parameter is only valid when there is no selection in the specified image.
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
David Gowers
(c)2006 David Gowers

file-psp-load

NAME
file-psp-load
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.file_psp_load(run-mode, filename, raw-filename)
BLURB
loads images from the Paint Shop Pro PSP file format
HELP
This plug-in loads and exports images in Paint Shop Pro's native PSP format. Vector layers aren't handled. Exporting isn't yet implemented.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to load
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to load
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput image
AUTHOR
Tor Lillqvist
(c)1999 Tor Lillqvist

plug-in-laplace

NAME
plug-in-laplace
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_laplace(run-mode, image, drawable)
BLURB
High-resolution edge detection
HELP
This plug-in creates one-pixel wide edges from the image, with the value proportional to the gradient. It uses the Laplace operator (a 3x3 kernel with -8 in the middle). The image has to be laplacered to get useful results, a gauss_iir with 1.5 - 5.0 depending on the noise in the image is best.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:edge-laplace' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:edge-laplace' for credits.

plug-in-palettemap

NAME
plug-in-palettemap
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_palettemap(run-mode, image, drawable)
BLURB
Recolor the image using colors from the active palette
HELP
This plug-in maps the contents of the specified drawable with the active palette. It calculates luminosity of each pixel and replaces the pixel by the palette sample at the corresponding index. A complete black pixel becomes the lowest palette entry, and complete white becomes the highest. Works on both Grayscale and RGB image with/without alpha channel.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Bill Skaggs
(c)2004 Bill Skaggs

gimp-palette-entry-set-name

NAME
gimp-palette-entry-set-name
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_palette_entry_set_name(name, entry-num, entry-name)
BLURB
Sets the specified palette entry in the specified palette.
HELP
This procedure sets the name of the zero-based entry specified for the specified palette. It returns an error if the entry does not exist.

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe palette name
entry-numGIMP_PDB_INT32The entry to retrieve
entry-nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe new name
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2004 Michael Natterer

gimp-image-width
SYNOPSIS

BLURB

HELP

}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
circleGIMP_PDB_FLOATCircle depth in % (0 <= circle <= 100)
angleGIMP_PDB_FLOATOffset angle (0 <= angle <= 360)
backwardsGIMP_PDB_INT32Map backwards (TRUE or FALSE)
inverseGIMP_PDB_INT32Map from top (TRUE or FALSE)
polrecGIMP_PDB_INT32Polar to rectangular (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES

Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-mblur-inward

NAME
plug-in-mblur-inward
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_mblur_inward(run-mode, image, drawable, type, length, angle, center-x, center-y)
BLURB
Simulate movement using directional blur
HELP
This procedure is equivalent to plug-in-mblur but performs the zoom blur inward instead of outward.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of motion blur {
LINEAR (0)
RADIAL (1)
ZOOM (2)
} (0 <= type <= 2)
lengthGIMP_PDB_FLOATLength
angleGIMP_PDB_FLOATAngle (0 <= angle <= 360)
center-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATCenter X
center-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATCenter Y
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:motion-blur-linear, -zoom, -cirular' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:motion-blur-linear, -zoom, -cirular' for credits.

RETURN VALUES

(c)2004 Bill Skaggs

gimp-image-insert-layer

NAME
gimp-image-insert-layer
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_insert_layer(image, layer, parent, position)
BLURB
Add the specified layer to the image.
HELP
This procedure adds the specified layer to the image at the given position. If the specified parent is a valid layer group (See 'gimp-item-is-group' and 'gimp-layer-group-new') then the layer is added inside the group. If the parent is 0, the layer is added inside the main stack, outside of any group. The position argument specifies the location of the layer inside the stack (or the group, if a valid parent was supplied), starting from the top (0) and increasing. If the position is specified as -1 and the parent is specified as 0, then the layer is inserted above the active layer, or inside the group if the active layer is a layer group. The layer type must be compatible with the image base type.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer
parentGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe parent layer
positionGIMP_PDB_INT32The layer position
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-text-layer-get-markup

NAME
gimp-text-layer-get-markup
SYNOPSIS
markup = pdb.gimp_text_layer_get_markup(layer)
BLURB
Get the markup from a text layer as string.
HELP
This procedure returns the markup of the styles from a text layer. The markup will be in the form of Pango's markup - See https://www.pango.org/ for more information about Pango and its markup. Note: Setting the markup of a text layer using Pango's markup is not supported for now.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe text layer
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
markupGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe markup which represents the style of the specified text layer.
AUTHOR
Barak Itkin
(c)2010 Barak Itkin

gimp-image-select-ellipse

NAME
gimp-image-select-ellipse
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_select_ellipse(image, operation, x, y, width, height)
BLURB
Create an elliptical selection over the specified image.
HELP
This tool creates an elliptical selection over the specified image. The elliptical region can be either added to, subtracted from, or replace the contents of the previous selection mask. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-antialias', 'gimp-context-set-feather', 'gimp-context-set-feather-radius'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
operationGIMP_PDB_INT32The selection operation {
CHANNEL-OP-ADD (0)
CHANNEL-OP-SUBTRACT (1)
CHANNEL-OP-REPLACE (2)
CHANNEL-OP-INTERSECT (3)
}
xGIMP_PDB_FLOATx coordinate of upper-left corner of ellipse bounding box
yGIMP_PDB_FLOATy coordinate of upper-left corner of ellipse bounding box
widthGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe width of the ellipse (width >= 0)
heightGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe height of the ellipse (height >= 0)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

gimp-drawable-sub-thumbnail

NAME
gimp-drawable-sub-thumbnail
SYNOPSIS
width, height, bpp, thumbnail-data-count, thumbnail-data = pdb.gimp_drawable_sub_thumbnail(drawable, src-x, src-y, src-width, src-height, dest-width, dest-height)
BLURB
Get a thumbnail of a sub-area of a drawable drawable.
HELP
This function gets data from which a thumbnail of a drawable preview can be created. Maximum x or y dimension is 1024 pixels. The pixels are returned in RGB[A] or GRAY[A] format. The bpp return value gives the number of bytes in the image.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
src-xGIMP_PDB_INT32The x coordinate of the area (src-x >= 0)
src-yGIMP_PDB_INT32The y coordinate of the area (src-y >= 0)
src-widthGIMP_PDB_INT32The width of the area (src-width >= 1)
src-heightGIMP_PDB_INT32The height of the area (src-height >= 1)
dest-widthGIMP_PDB_INT32The thumbnail width (1 <= dest-width <= 1024)
dest-heightGIMP_PDB_INT32The thumbnail height (1 <= dest-height <= 1024)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
widthGIMP_PDB_INT32The previews width
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32The previews height
bppGIMP_PDB_INT32The previews bpp
thumbnail-data-countGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of bytes in thumbnail data (thumbnail-data-count >= 0)
thumbnail-dataGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYThe thumbnail data
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2004 Michael Natterer

gimp-image-get-component-visible

NAME
gimp-image-get-component-visible
SYNOPSIS
visible = pdb.gimp_image_get_component_visible(image, component)
BLURB
Returns if the specified image's image component is visible.
HELP
This procedure returns if the specified image's image component (i.e. Red, Green, Blue intensity channels in an RGB image) is visible or invisible -- whether or not it can be seen. If the specified component is not valid for the image type, an error is returned.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
componentGIMP_PDB_INT32The image component {
CHANNEL-RED (0)
CHANNEL-GREEN (1)
CHANNEL-BLUE (2)
CHANNEL-GRAY (3)
CHANNEL-INDEXED (4)
CHANNEL-ALPHA (5)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
visibleGIMP_PDB_INT32Component is visible (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-quit

NAME
gimp-quit
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_quit(force)
BLURB
Causes GIMP to exit gracefully.
HELP
If there are unsaved images in an interactive GIMP session, the user will be asked for confirmation. If force is TRUE, the application is quit without querying the user to save any dirty images.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
forceGIMP_PDB_INT32Force GIMP to quit without asking (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

gimp-dodgeburn

NAME
gimp-dodgeburn
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_dodgeburn(drawable, exposure, dodgeburn-type, dodgeburn-mode, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Dodgeburn image with varying exposure.
HELP
Dodgeburn. More details here later.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
exposureGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe exposure of the strokes (0 <= exposure <= 100)
dodgeburn-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type either dodge or burn {
DODGE-BURN-TYPE-DODGE (0)
DODGE-BURN-TYPE-BURN (1)
}
dodgeburn-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The mode {
TRANSFER-SHADOWS (0)
TRANSFER-MIDTONES (1)
TRANSFER-HIGHLIGHTS (2)
}
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Andy Thomas
(c)1999 Andy Thomas

gimp-context-set-diagonal-neighbors

NAME
gimp-context-set-diagonal-neighbors
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_diagonal_neighbors(diagonal-neighbors)
BLURB
Set the diagonal neighbors setting.
HELP
This procedure modifies the diagonal neighbors setting. If the affected region of an operation is based on a seed point, like when doing a seed fill, then, when this setting is TRUE, all eight neighbors of each pixel are considered when calculating the affected region; in contrast, when this setting is FALSE, only the four orthogonal neighbors of each pixel are considered. This setting affects the following procedures: 'gimp-image-select-contiguous-color', 'gimp-drawable-edit-bucket-fill'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
diagonal-neighborsGIMP_PDB_INT32The diagonal neighbors setting (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Ell
(c)2016 Ell

file-tiff-save

NAME
file-tiff-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_tiff_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, compression)
BLURB
saves files in the tiff file format
HELP
Saves files in the Tagged Image File Format. The value for the saved comment is taken from the 'gimp-comment' parasite.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In

RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}

filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
compressionGIMP_PDB_INT32Compression type: {
NONE (0)
LZW (1)
PACKBITS (2)
DEFLATE (3)
JPEG (4)
CCITT G3 Fax (5)
CCITT G4 Fax (6)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996,2000-2003 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

} (0 <= orientation <= 1)

gimp-channel-combine-masks

NAME
gimp-channel-combine-masks
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_channel_combine_masks(channel1, channel2, operation, offx, offy)
BLURB
Combine two channel masks.
HELP
This procedure combines two channel masks. The result is stored in the first channel.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
channel1GIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe channel1
channel2GIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe channel2
operationGIMP_PDB_INT32The selection operation {
CHANNEL-OP-ADD (0)
CHANNEL-OP-SUBTRACT (1)
CHANNEL-OP-REPLACE (2)
CHANNEL-OP-INTERSECT (3)
}
offxGIMP_PDB_INT32x offset between upper left corner of channels: (second - first)
offyGIMP_PDB_INT32y offset between upper left corner of channels: (second - first)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-layer-set-show-mask

NAME
gimp-layer-set-show-mask
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_layer_set_show_mask(layer, show-mask)
BLURB
Set the show mask setting of the specified layer.
HELP
This procedure sets the specified layer's show mask setting. This controls whether the layer or its mask is visible. TRUE indicates that the mask should be visible. If there is no layer mask, this function will return an error.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer
show-maskGIMP_PDB_INT32The new layer's show mask setting (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-item-get-tattoo

NAME
gimp-item-get-tattoo
SYNOPSIS
tattoo = pdb.gimp_item_get_tattoo(item)
BLURB
Get the tattoo of the specified item.
HELP
This procedure returns the specified item's tattoo. A tattoo is a unique and permanent identifier attached to a item that can be used to uniquely identify a item within an image even between sessions.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe item
RETURN VALUES

(c)1998 Jay Cox

gimp-file-load-thumbnail

NAME
gimp-file-load-thumbnail
SYNOPSIS
width, height, thumb-data-count, thumb-data = pdb.gimp_file_load_thumbnail(filename)
BLURB
Loads the thumbnail for a file.
HELP
This procedure tries to load a thumbnail that belongs to the file with the given filename. This name is a full pathname. The returned data is an array of colordepth 3 (RGB), regardless of the image type. Width and height of the thumbnail are also returned. Don't use this function if you need a thumbnail of an already opened image, use 'gimp-image-thumbnail' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file that owns the thumbnail to load
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
widthGIMP_PDB_INT32The width of the thumbnail
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32The height of the thumbnail
thumb-data-countGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of bytes in thumbnail data (thumb-data-count >= 0)
thumb-dataGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYThe thumbnail data
AUTHOR
Adam D. Moss, Sven Neumann
(c)1999-2003 Adam D. Moss, Sven Neumann

gimp-layer-add-mask

NAME
gimp-layer-add-mask
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_layer_add_mask(layer, mask)
BLURB
Add a layer mask to the specified layer.
HELP
This procedure adds a layer mask to the specified layer. Layer masks serve as an additional alpha channel for a layer. This procedure will fail if a number of prerequisites aren't met. The layer cannot already have a layer mask. The specified mask must exist and have the same dimensions as the layer. The layer must have been created for use with the specified image and the mask must have been created with the procedure 'gimp-layer-create-mask'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer to receive the mask
maskGIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe mask to add to the layer
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-freeze-vectors

NAME
gimp-image-freeze-vectors
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_freeze_vectors(image)
BLURB
Freeze the image's vectors list.
HELP
This procedure freezes the vectors list of the image, suppressing any updates to the Paths dialog in response to changes to the image's vectors. This can significantly improve performance while applying changes affecting the vectors list. Each call to 'gimp-image-freeze-vectors' should be matched by a corresponding call to 'gimp-image-thaw-vectors', undoing its effects.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Ell
(c)2018 Ell

gimp-channel-set-show-masked
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_channel_set_show_masked(channel, show-masked)
BLURB
Set the composite method of the specified channel.
HELP
This procedure sets the specified channel's composite method. If it is TRUE, then the channel is composited with the image so that masked regions are shown. Otherwise, selected regions are shown.
MENUPATH

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
channelGIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe channel
show-maskedGIMP_PDB_INT32The new channel composite method (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES

Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-context-set-transform-resize

NAME
gimp-context-set-transform-resize
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_transform_resize(transform-resize)
BLURB
Set the transform resize type.
HELP
This procedure modifies the transform resize setting. When transforming pixels, if the result of a transform operation has a different size than the original area, this setting determines how the resulting area is sized. This setting affects affects the following procedures: 'gimp-item-transform-flip', 'gimp-item-transform-flip-simple', 'gimp-item-transform-perspective', 'gimp-item-transform-rotate', 'gimp-item-transform-rotate-simple', 'gimp-item-transform-scale', 'gimp-item-transform-shear', 'gimp-item-transform-2d', 'gimp-item-transform-matrix'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
transform-resizeGIMP_PDB_INT32The transform resize type {
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-ADJUST (0)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CLIP (1)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP (2)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP-WITH-ASPECT (3)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

plug-in-applylens

NAME
plug-in-applylens

pdb.plug_in_applylens(run-mode, image, drawable, refraction, keep-surroundings, set-background, set-transparent)
BLURB
Simulate an elliptical lens over the image
HELP
This plug-in uses Snell's law to draw an ellipsoid lens over the image.

}

drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
refractionGIMP_PDB_FLOATLens refraction index (1 <= refraction <= 100)
keep-surroundingsGIMP_PDB_INT32Keep lens surroundings (TRUE or FALSE)
set-backgroundGIMP_PDB_INT32Set lens surroundings to BG value (TRUE or FALSE)
set-transparentGIMP_PDB_INT32Set lens surroundings transparent (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR

file-hgt-load

NAME
file-hgt-load
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.file_hgt_load(run-mode, filename, raw-filename, samplespacing)
BLURB
Load HGT data as images
HELP
Load Digital Elevation Model data in HGT format from the Shuttle Radar Topography Mission as images. Though the output image will be RGB, all colors are grayscale by default and the contrast will be quite low on most earth relief. Therefore You will likely want to remap elevation to colors as a second step, for instance with the "Gradient Map" plug-in.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
}
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to load
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name entered
samplespacingGIMP_PDB_INT32The sample spacing of the data. Only supported values are 0, 1 and 3 (respectively auto-detect, SRTM-1 and SRTM-3 data)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput image
AUTHOR

(c)2017-12-09

file-xbm-load

NAME
file-xbm-load
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.file_xbm_load(run-mode, filename, raw-filename)
BLURB
Load a file in X10 or X11 bitmap (XBM) file format
HELP
Load a file in X10 or X11 bitmap (XBM) file format. XBM is a lossless format for flat black-and-white (two color indexed) images.

(c)1998 Gordon Matzigkeit

plug-in-gauss-iir

NAME
plug-in-gauss-iir
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_gauss_iir(run-mode, image, drawable, radius, horizontal, vertical)
BLURB
Apply a gaussian blur
HELP
Applies a gaussian blur to the drawable, with specified radius of affect. The standard deviation of the normal distribution used to modify pixel values is calculated based on the supplied radius. Horizontal and vertical blurring can be independently invoked by specifying only one to run.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius of gaussian blur (in pixels (0 <= radius <= 500)
horizontalGIMP_PDB_INT32Blur in horizontal direction (TRUE or FALSE)
verticalGIMP_PDB_INT32Blur in vertical direction (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:gaussian-blur' for credits.
(c)2014 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:gaussian-blur' for credits.

BLURB

HELP

}

drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable

hue-distanceGIMP_PDB_INT32Scattering of hue angle (0 <= hue-distance <= 180)
saturation-distanceGIMP_PDB_INT32Distribution distance on saturation axis (0 <= saturation-distance <= 255)
value-distanceGIMP_PDB_INT32Distribution distance on value axis (0 <= value-distance <= 255)

AUTHOR
Michael Sweet , Daniel Skarda <0rfelyus@@atrey.karlin.mff.cuni.cz>
(c)1.3.4 - 03 September 2002 Michael Sweet , Daniel Skarda <0rfelyus@@atrey.karlin.mff.cuni.cz>, Nick Lamb

gimp-progress-pulse

NAME
gimp-progress-pulse
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_progress_pulse()
BLURB
Pulses the progress bar for the current plug-in.
HELP
Updates the progress bar for the current plug-in. It is only valid to call this procedure from a plug-in. Use this function instead of 'gimp-progress-update' if you cannot tell how much progress has been made. This usually causes the the progress bar to enter "activity mode", where a block bounces back and forth.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2005 Sven Neumann

plug-in-despeckle

NAME
plug-in-despeckle
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_despeckle(run-mode, image, drawable, radius, type, black, white)
BLURB
Remove speckle noise from the image
HELP
This plug-in selectively performs a median or adaptive box filter on an image.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
radiusGIMP_PDB_INT32Filter box radius (default = 3)
typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Filter type {
MEDIAN (0)
ADAPTIVE (1)
RECURSIVE-MEDIAN (2)
RECURSIVE-ADAPTIVE (3)
}
blackGIMP_PDB_INT32Black level (-1 to 255)
whiteGIMP_PDB_INT32White level (0 to 256)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Sweet
(c)May 2010 Copyright 1997-1998 by Michael Sweet

gimp-vectors-import-from-file

NAME
gimp-vectors-import-from-file
SYNOPSIS
num-vectors, vectors-ids = pdb.gimp_vectors_import_from_file(image, filename, merge, scale)
BLURB
Import paths from an SVG file.
HELP
This procedure imports paths from an SVG file. SVG elements other than paths and basic shapes are ignored.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the SVG file to import.
mergeGIMP_PDB_INT32Merge paths into a single vectors object. (TRUE or FALSE)
scaleGIMP_PDB_INT32Scale the SVG to image dimensions. (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
num-vectorsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of newly created vectors (num-vectors >= 0)
vectors-idsGIMP_PDB_INT32ARRAYThe list of newly created vectors
AUTHOR
Simon Budig
(c)2006 Simon Budig

plug-in-depth-merge

NAME
plug-in-depth-merge
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_depth_merge(run-mode, image, result, source1, source2, depthMap1, depthMap2, overlap, offset, scale1, scale2)
BLURB
Combine two images using depth maps (z-buffers)
HELP
Taking as input two full-color, full-alpha images and two corresponding grayscale depth maps, this plug-in combines the images based on which is closer (has a lower depth map value) at each point.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
resultGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEResult
source1GIMP_PDB_DRAWABLESource 1
source2GIMP_PDB_DRAWABLESource 2
depthMap1GIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDepth map 1
depthMap2GIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDepth map 2
overlapGIMP_PDB_FLOATOverlap
offsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATDepth relative offset
scale1GIMP_PDB_FLOATDepth relative scale 1
scale2GIMP_PDB_FLOATDepth relative scale 2
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Sean Cier
(c)August 1998 Sean Cier

gimp-drawable-transform-perspective

NAME
gimp-drawable-transform-perspective
SYNOPSIS
drawable = pdb.gimp_drawable_transform_perspective(drawable, x0, y0, x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, transform-direction, interpolation, supersample, recursion-level, clip-result)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-perspective' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-perspective' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
x0GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of upper-left corner of original bounding box
y0GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of upper-left corner of original bounding box
x1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of upper-right corner of original bounding box
y1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of upper-right corner of original bounding box
x2GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of lower-left corner of original bounding box
y2GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of lower-left corner of original bounding box
x3GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of lower-right corner of original bounding box
y3GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of lower-right corner of original bounding box
transform-directionGIMP_PDB_INT32Direction of transformation {
TRANSFORM-FORWARD (0)
TRANSFORM-BACKWARD (1)
}
interpolationGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of interpolation {
INTERPOLATION-NONE (0)
INTERPOLATION-LINEAR (1)
INTERPOLATION-CUBIC (2)
INTERPOLATION-NOHALO (3)
INTERPOLATION-LOHALO (4)
}
supersampleGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (TRUE or FALSE)
recursion-levelGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (recursion-level >= 1)
clip-resultGIMP_PDB_INT32How to clip results {
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-ADJUST (0)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CLIP (1)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP (2)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP-WITH-ASPECT (3)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe newly mapped drawable
AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno
(c)2004 João S. O. Bueno

gimp-drawable-mask-intersect

NAME
gimp-drawable-mask-intersect
SYNOPSIS
non-empty, x, y, width, height = pdb.gimp_drawable_mask_intersect(drawable)
BLURB
Find the bounding box of the current selection in relation to the specified drawable.
HELP
This procedure returns whether there is an intersection between the drawable and the selection. Unlike 'gimp-drawable-mask-bounds', the intersection's bounds are returned as x, y, width, height. If there is no selection this function returns TRUE and the returned bounds are the extents of the whole drawable.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
non-emptyGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if the returned area is not empty (TRUE or FALSE)
xGIMP_PDB_INT32x coordinate of the upper left corner of the intersection
yGIMP_PDB_INT32y coordinate of the upper left corner of the intersection
widthGIMP_PDB_INT32width of the intersection
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32height of the intersection
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2004 Michael Natterer

gimp-gradient-get-custom-samples

NAME
gimp-gradient-get-custom-samples
SYNOPSIS
num-color-samples, color-samples = pdb.gimp_gradient_get_custom_samples(name, num-samples, positions, reverse)
BLURB
Sample the specified gradient in custom positions.
HELP
This procedure samples the active gradient in the specified number of points. The procedure will sample the gradient in the specified positions from the list. The left endpoint of the gradient corresponds to position 0.0, and the right endpoint corresponds to 1.0. The procedure returns a list of floating-point values which correspond to the RGBA values for each sample.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe gradient name
num-samplesGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of samples to take (num-samples >= 1)
positionsGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYThe list of positions to sample along the gradient
reverseGIMP_PDB_INT32Use the reverse gradient (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
num-color-samplesGIMP_PDB_INT32Length of the color_samples array (4 * num_samples) (num-color-samples >= 0)
color-samplesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYColor samples: {
R1
G1
B1
A1
...
Rn
Gn
Bn
An
}
AUTHOR
Federico Mena Quintero
(c)1997 Federico Mena Quintero

gimp-path-get-locked

(c)

gimp-edit-copy

NAME
gimp-edit-copy
SYNOPSIS
non-empty = pdb.gimp_edit_copy(drawable)
BLURB
Copy from the specified drawable.
HELP
If there is a selection in the image, then the area specified by the selection is copied from the specified drawable and placed in an internal GIMP edit buffer. It can subsequently be retrieved using the 'gimp-edit-paste' command. If there is no selection, then the specified drawable's contents will be stored in the internal GIMP edit buffer. This procedure will fail if the selected area lies completely outside the bounds of the current drawable and there is nothing to copy from.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable to copy from
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
non-emptyGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if the cut was successful, FALSE if there was nothing to copy from (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

file-dds-save

NAME
file-dds-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_dds_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, compression-format, mipmaps, savetype, format, transparent-index, mipmap-filter, mipmap-wrap, gamma-correct, srgb, gamma, perceptual-metric, preserve-alpha-coverage, alpha-test-threshold)
BLURB
Saves files in DDS image format
HELP
Saves files in DDS image format
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Interactive, non-interactive
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to save
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image as
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name entered
compression-formatGIMP_PDB_INT32Compression format (0 = None, 1 = BC1/DXT1, 2 = BC2/DXT3, 3 = BC3/DXT5, 4 = BC3n/DXT5nm, 5 = BC4/ATI1N, 6 = BC5/ATI2N, 7 = RXGB (DXT5), 8 = Alpha Exponent (DXT5), 9 = YCoCg (DXT5), 10 = YCoCg scaled (DXT5))
mipmapsGIMP_PDB_INT32How to handle mipmaps (0 = No mipmaps, 1 = Generate mipmaps, 2 = Use existing mipmaps (layers)
savetypeGIMP_PDB_INT32How to save the image (0 = selected layer, 1 = cube map, 2 = volume map, 3 = texture array
formatGIMP_PDB_INT32Custom pixel format (0 = default, 1 = R5G6B5, 2 = RGBA4, 3 = RGB5A1, 4 = RGB10A2)
transparent-indexGIMP_PDB_INT32Index of transparent color or -1 to disable (for indexed images only).
mipmap-filterGIMP_PDB_INT32Filtering to use when generating mipmaps (0 = default, 1 = nearest, 2 = box, 3 = triangle, 4 = quadratic, 5 = bspline, 6 = mitchell, 7 = lanczos, 8 = kaiser)
mipmap-wrapGIMP_PDB_INT32Wrap mode to use when generating mipmaps (0 = default, 1 = mirror, 2 = repeat, 3 = clamp)
gamma-correctGIMP_PDB_INT32Use gamma correct mipmap filtering
srgbGIMP_PDB_INT32Use sRGB colorspace for gamma correction
gammaGIMP_PDB_FLOATGamma value to use for gamma correction (i.e. 2.2)
perceptual-metricGIMP_PDB_INT32Use a perceptual error metric during compression
preserve-alpha-coverageGIMP_PDB_INT32Preserve alpha test converage for alpha channel maps
alpha-test-thresholdGIMP_PDB_FLOATAlpha test threshold value for which alpha test converage should be preserved
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Shawn Kirst
(c)2008 Shawn Kirst

python-fu-histogram-export

NAME
python-fu-histogram-export
SYNOPSIS
pdb.python_fu_histogram_export(run-mode, img, drw, filename, bucket-size, sample-average, output-format)
BLURB
Exports the image histogram to a text file (CSV)
HELP
Exports the image histogram to a text file, so that it can be used by other programs and loaded into spreadsheets. The resulting file is a CSV file (Comma Separated Values), which can be imported directly in most spreadsheet programs. The first two collums are the bucket boundaries, followed by the selected columns. The histogram refers to the selected image area, and can use either Sample Average data or data from the current drawable only.; The output is in "weighted pixels" - meaning all fully transparent pixels are not counted. Check the gimp-histogram call
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imgGIMP_PDB_IMAGEImage
drwGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGHistogram File
bucket-sizeGIMP_PDB_FLOATBucket Size
sample-averageGIMP_PDB_INT32Sample Average
output-formatGIMP_PDB_STRINGOutput format
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno
(c)2014 João S. O. Bueno, 2014

gimp-selection-grow

NAME
gimp-selection-grow
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_selection_grow(image, steps)
BLURB
Grow the image's selection
HELP
This procedure grows the selection. Growing involves expanding the boundary in all directions by the specified pixel amount.

NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

plug-in-filter-pack

NAME

gimp-layer-get-show-mask

NAME
gimp-layer-get-show-mask
SYNOPSIS
show-mask = pdb.gimp_layer_get_show_mask(layer)
BLURB
Get the show mask setting of the specified layer.
HELP
This procedure returns the specified layer's show mask setting. This controls whether the layer or its mask is visible. TRUE indicates that the mask should be visible. If the layer has no mask, then this function returns an error.

plug-in-fractalexplorer

NAME
plug-in-fractalexplorer
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_fractalexplorer(run-mode, image, drawable, fractaltype, xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, iter, cx, cy, colormode, redstretch, greenstretch, bluestretch, redmode, greenmode, bluemode, redinvert, greeninvert, blueinvert, ncolors)
BLURB
Render fractal art
HELP
No help yet.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
fractaltypeGIMP_PDB_INT80: Mandelbrot; 1: Julia; 2: Barnsley 1; 3: Barnsley 2; 4: Barnsley 3; 5: Spider; 6: ManOWar; 7: Lambda; 8: Sierpinski
xminGIMP_PDB_FLOATxmin fractal image delimiter
xmaxGIMP_PDB_FLOATxmax fractal image delimiter
yminGIMP_PDB_FLOATymin fractal image delimiter
ymaxGIMP_PDB_FLOATymax fractal image delimiter
iterGIMP_PDB_FLOATIteration value
cxGIMP_PDB_FLOATcx value ( only Julia)
cyGIMP_PDB_FLOATcy value ( only Julia)
colormodeGIMP_PDB_INT80: Apply colormap as specified by the parameters below; 1: Apply active gradient to final image
redstretchGIMP_PDB_FLOATRed stretching factor
greenstretchGIMP_PDB_FLOATGreen stretching factor
bluestretchGIMP_PDB_FLOATBlue stretching factor
redmodeGIMP_PDB_INT8Red application mode (0:SIN;1:COS;2:NONE)
greenmodeGIMP_PDB_INT8Green application mode (0:SIN;1:COS;2:NONE)
bluemodeGIMP_PDB_INT8Blue application mode (0:SIN;1:COS;2:NONE)
redinvertGIMP_PDB_INT8Red inversion mode (1: enabled; 0: disabled)
greeninvertGIMP_PDB_INT8Green inversion mode (1: enabled; 0: disabled)
blueinvertGIMP_PDB_INT8Green inversion mode (1: enabled; 0: disabled)
ncolorsGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of Colors for mapping (2<=ncolors<=8192)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Daniel Cotting (cotting@@multimania.com, www.multimania.com/cotting)
(c)December, 1998 Daniel Cotting (cotting@@multimania.com, www.multimania.com/cotting)

gimp-layer-resize

NAME
gimp-layer-resize
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_layer_resize(layer, new-width, new-height, offx, offy)
BLURB
Resize the layer to the specified extents.
HELP
This procedure resizes the layer so that its new width and height are equal to the supplied parameters. Offsets are also provided which describe the position of the previous layer's content. This operation only works if the layer has been added to an image.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer
new-widthGIMP_PDB_INT32New layer width (1 <= new-width <= 524288)
new-heightGIMP_PDB_INT32New layer height (1 <= new-height <= 524288)
offxGIMP_PDB_INT32x offset between upper left corner of old and new layers: (old - new)
offyGIMP_PDB_INT32y offset between upper left corner of old and new layers: (old - new)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-plugin-domain-register

NAME
gimp-plugin-domain-register
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_plugin_domain_register(domain-name, domain-path)
BLURB
Registers a textdomain for localisation.
HELP
This procedure adds a textdomain to the list of domains Gimp searches for strings when translating its menu entries. There is no need to call this function for plug-ins that have their strings included in the 'gimp-std-plugins' domain as that is used by default. If the compiled message catalog is not in the standard location, you may specify an absolute path to another location. This procedure can only be called in the query function of a plug-in and it has to be called before any procedure is installed.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
domain-nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the textdomain (must be unique)
domain-pathGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe absolute path to the compiled message catalog (may be NULL)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2000 Sven Neumann

gimp-item-transform-flip

NAME
gimp-item-transform-flip
SYNOPSIS
item = pdb.gimp_item_transform_flip(item, x0, y0, x1, y1)
BLURB
Flip the specified item around a given line.
HELP
This procedure flips the specified item. If a selection exists and the item is a drawable, the portion of the drawable which lies under the selection is cut from the drawable and made into a floating selection which is then flipped. The axis to flip around is specified by specifying two points from that line. The return value is the ID of the flipped floating selection. If there is no selection or the item is not a drawable, the entire item will be flipped around the specified axis. Additionally, if the item has its linked flag set to TRUE, all additional items contained in the image which have the linked flag set to TRUE will also be flipped around the same axis. The return value will be equal to the item ID supplied as input. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-interpolation', 'gimp-context-set-transform-direction', 'gimp-context-set-transform-resize'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe affected item
x0GIMP_PDB_FLOAThorz. coord. of one end of axis
y0GIMP_PDB_FLOATvert. coord. of one end of axis
x1GIMP_PDB_FLOAThorz. coord. of other end of axis
y1GIMP_PDB_FLOATvert. coord. of other end of axis
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe flipped item
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

gimp-brush-is-generated

NAME
gimp-brush-is-generated
SYNOPSIS
generated = pdb.gimp_brush_is_generated(name)
BLURB
Tests if brush is generated.
HELP
Returns TRUE if this brush is parametric, FALSE for other types.
MENUPATH

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
generatedGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if the brush is generated (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Bill Skaggs
(c)2004 Bill Skaggs

gimp-drawable-foreground-extract

NAME
gimp-drawable-foreground-extract
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_foreground_extract(drawable, mode, mask)
BLURB
Extract the foreground of a drawable using a given trimap.
HELP
Image Segmentation by Uniform Color Clustering, see https://www.inf.fu-berlin.de/inst/pubs/tr-b-05-07.pdf
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The algorithm to use {
FOREGROUND-EXTRACT-SIOX (0)
FOREGROUND-EXTRACT-MATTING (1)
}
maskGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLETri-Map
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Gerald Friedland , Kristian Jantz , Sven Neumann
(c)2005 Gerald Friedland

file-ps-save

NAME
file-ps-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_ps_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, width, height, x-offset, y-offset, unit, keep-ratio, rotation, eps-flag, preview, level)
BLURB
export image as PostScript document
HELP
PostScript exporting handles all image types except those with alpha channels.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to export
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to export the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to export the image in
widthGIMP_PDB_FLOATWidth of the image in PostScript file (0: use input image size)
heightGIMP_PDB_FLOATHeight of image in PostScript file (0: use input image size)
x-offsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATX-offset to image from lower left corner
y-offsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATY-offset to image from lower left corner
unitGIMP_PDB_INT32Unit for width/height/offset. 0: inches, 1: millimeters
keep-ratioGIMP_PDB_INT320: use width/height, 1: keep aspect ratio
rotationGIMP_PDB_INT320, 90, 180, 270
eps-flagGIMP_PDB_INT320: PostScript, 1: Encapsulated PostScript
previewGIMP_PDB_INT320: no preview, >0: max. size of preview
levelGIMP_PDB_INT321: PostScript Level 1, 2: PostScript Level 2
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Peter Kirchgessner
(c)v1.17 19-Sep-2004 Peter Kirchgessner

plug-in-spread

NAME
plug-in-spread
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_spread(run-mode, image, drawable, spread-amount-x, spread-amount-y)
BLURB
Move pixels around randomly
HELP
Spreads the pixels of the specified drawable. Pixels are randomly moved to another location whose distance varies from the original by the horizontal and vertical spread amounts.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
spread-amount-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATHorizontal spread amount (0 <= spread-amount-x <= 200)
spread-amount-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATVertical spread amount (0 <= spread-amount-y <= 200)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR

SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_vectors_bezier_stroke_conicto(vectors, stroke-id, x0, y0, x1, y1)
BLURB
Extends a bezier stroke with a conic bezier spline.
HELP
Extends a bezier stroke with a conic bezier spline. Actually a cubic bezier spline gets added that realizes the shape of a conic bezier spline.

plug-in-rgb-noise

NAME
plug-in-rgb-noise
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_rgb_noise(run-mode, image, drawable, independent, correlated, noise-1, noise-2, noise-3, noise-4)
BLURB
Distort colors by random amounts
HELP
Add normally distributed (zero mean) random values to image channels. Noise may be additive (uncorrelated) or multiplicative (correlated - also known as speckle noise). For color images color channels may be treated together or independently.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
independentGIMP_PDB_INT32Noise in channels independent (TRUE or FALSE)
correlatedGIMP_PDB_INT32Noise correlated (i.e. multiplicative not additive) (TRUE or FALSE)
noise-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATNoise in the first channel (red, gray) (0 <= noise-1 <= 1)
noise-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATNoise in the second channel (green, gray_alpha) (0 <= noise-2 <= 1)
noise-3GIMP_PDB_FLOATNoise in the third channel (blue) (0 <= noise-3 <= 1)
noise-4GIMP_PDB_FLOATNoise in the fourth channel (alpha) (0 <= noise-4 <= 1)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:noise-rgb' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:noise-rgb' for credits.

gimp-context-set-line-dash-pattern

NAME
gimp-context-set-line-dash-pattern
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_line_dash_pattern(num-dashes, dashes)
BLURB
Set the line dash pattern setting.
HELP
This procedure modifies the line dash pattern setting for stroking lines. The unit of the dash pattern segments is the actual line width used for the stroke operation, in other words a segment length of 1.0 results in a square segment shape (or gap shape). This setting affects the following procedures: 'gimp-drawable-edit-stroke-selection-', 'gimp-drawable-edit-stroke-item'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
num-dashesGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of dashes in the dash_pattern array (num-dashes >= 0)
dashesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYThe line dash pattern setting
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2015 Michael Natterer

gimp-channel-new

NAME
gimp-channel-new
SYNOPSIS
channel = pdb.gimp_channel_new(image, width, height, name, opacity, color)
BLURB
Create a new channel.
HELP
This procedure creates a new channel with the specified width, height, name, opacity and color. The new channel still needs to be added to the image, as this is not automatic. Add the new channel with 'gimp-image-insert-channel'. Other attributes, such as channel visibility, should be set with explicit procedure calls. The channel's contents are undefined initially.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image to which to add the channel
widthGIMP_PDB_INT32The channel width (1 <= width <= 524288)
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32The channel height (1 <= height <= 524288)
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe channel name
opacityGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe channel opacity (0 <= opacity <= 100)
colorGIMP_PDB_COLORThe channel compositing color
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
channelGIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe newly created channel
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-colors-channel-mixer

plug-in-bump-map-tiled

NAME
plug-in-bump-map-tiled
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_bump_map_tiled(run-mode, image, drawable, bumpmap, azimuth, elevation, depth, xofs, yofs, waterlevel, ambient, compensate, invert, type)
BLURB
Create an embossing effect using a tiled image as a bump map
HELP
This plug-in uses the algorithm described by John Schlag, "Fast Embossing Effects on Raster Image Data" in Graphics GEMS IV (ISBN 0-12-336155-9). It takes a drawable to be tiled and applied as a bump map to another image and produces a nice embossing effect.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
bumpmapGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEBump map drawable
azimuthGIMP_PDB_FLOATAzimuth (0 <= azimuth <= 360)
elevationGIMP_PDB_FLOATElevation (0.5 <= elevation <= 90)
depthGIMP_PDB_INT32Depth (1 <= depth <= 65)
xofsGIMP_PDB_INT32X offset
yofsGIMP_PDB_INT32Y offset
waterlevelGIMP_PDB_FLOATLevel that full transparency should represent (0 <= waterlevel <= 1)
ambientGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmbient lighting factor (0 <= ambient <= 1)
compensateGIMP_PDB_INT32Compensate for darkening (TRUE or FALSE)
invertGIMP_PDB_INT32Invert bumpmap (TRUE or FALSE)
typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of map {
LINEAR (0)
SPHERICAL (1)
SINUSOIDAL (2)
} (0 <= type <= 3)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:bump-map' for credits.
(c)2015 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:bump-map' for credits.

gimp-text-layer-new

NAME
gimp-text-layer-new
SYNOPSIS
layer = pdb.gimp_text_layer_new(image, text, fontname, size, unit)
BLURB
Creates a new text layer.
HELP
This procedure creates a new text layer. The arguments are kept as simple as necessary for the normal case. All text attributes, however, can be modified with the appropriate gimp_text_layer_set_*() procedures. The new layer still needs to be added to the image, as this is not automatic. Add the new layer using 'gimp-image-insert-layer'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
textGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe text to generate (in UTF-8 encoding)
fontnameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the font
sizeGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe size of text in either pixels or points (0 <= size <= 8192)
unitGIMP_PDB_INT32The units of specified size
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe new text layer.
AUTHOR
Marcus Heese
(c)2008 Marcus Heese

gimp-drawable-mask-bounds

NAME
gimp-drawable-mask-bounds
SYNOPSIS
non-empty, x1, y1, x2, y2 = pdb.gimp_drawable_mask_bounds(drawable)
BLURB
Find the bounding box of the current selection in relation to the specified drawable.
HELP
This procedure returns whether there is a selection. If there is one, the upper left and lower right-hand corners of its bounding box are returned. These coordinates are specified relative to the drawable's origin, and bounded by the drawable's extents. Please note that the pixel specified by the lower right-hand coordinate of the bounding box is not part of the selection. The selection ends at the upper left corner of this pixel. This means the width of the selection can be calculated as (x2 - x1), its height as (y2 - y1). Note that the returned boolean does NOT correspond with the returned region being empty or not, it always returns whether the selection is non_empty. See 'gimp-drawable-mask-intersect' for a boolean return value which is more useful in most cases.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
non-emptyGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if there is a selection (TRUE or FALSE)
x1GIMP_PDB_INT32x coordinate of the upper left corner of selection bounds
y1GIMP_PDB_INT32y coordinate of the upper left corner of selection bounds
x2GIMP_PDB_INT32x coordinate of the lower right corner of selection bounds
y2GIMP_PDB_INT32y coordinate of the lower right corner of selection bounds
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-file-load

NAME
gimp-file-load
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.gimp_file_load(run-mode, filename, raw-filename)
BLURB
Loads an image file by invoking the right load handler.
HELP
This procedure invokes the correct file load handler using magic if possible, and falling back on the file's extension and/or prefix if not. The name of the file to load is typically a full pathname, and the name entered is what the user actually typed before prepending a directory path. The reason for this is that if the user types https://www.gimp.org/foo.png he wants to fetch a URL, and the full pathname will not look like a URL.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to load
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name as entered by the user
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe output image
AUTHOR
Josh MacDonald
(c)1997 Josh MacDonald

gimp-get-module-load-inhibit

NAME
gimp-get-module-load-inhibit

HELP

Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-set-color-profile-from-file

NAME
gimp-image-set-color-profile-from-file
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_set_color_profile_from_file(image, uri)
BLURB
Sets the image's color profile from an ICC file
HELP
This procedure sets the image's color profile from a file containing an ICC profile, or unsets it if NULL is passed as 'uri'. This procedure does no color conversion.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
uriGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe URI of the file containing the new color profile
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2015 Michael Natterer

gimp-pencil

NAME
gimp-pencil
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_pencil(drawable, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Paint in the current brush without sub-pixel sampling.
HELP
This tool is the standard pencil. It draws linearly interpolated lines through the specified stroke coordinates. It operates on the specified drawable in the foreground color with the active brush. The brush mask is treated as though it contains only black and white values. Any value below half is treated as black; any above half, as white.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-text-layer-get-hint-style

NAME
gimp-text-layer-get-hint-style
SYNOPSIS
style = pdb.gimp_text_layer_get_hint_style(layer)
BLURB
Get information about hinting in the specified text layer.
HELP
This procedure provides information about the hinting that is being used in a text layer. Hinting can be optimized for fidelity or contrast or it can be turned entirely off.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe text layer
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
styleGIMP_PDB_INT32The hint style used for font outlines {
TEXT-HINT-STYLE-NONE (0)
TEXT-HINT-STYLE-SLIGHT (1)
TEXT-HINT-STYLE-MEDIUM (2)
TEXT-HINT-STYLE-FULL (3)
}
AUTHOR
Marcus Heese
(c)2008 Marcus Heese

gimp-drawable-edit-stroke-selection

NAME
gimp-drawable-edit-stroke-selection
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_edit_stroke_selection(drawable)
BLURB
Stroke the current selection
HELP
This procedure strokes the current selection, painting along the selection boundary with the active paint method and brush, or using a plain line with configurable properties. The paint is applied to the specified drawable regardless of the active selection. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-opacity', 'gimp-context-set-paint-mode', 'gimp-context-set-paint-method', 'gimp-context-set-stroke-method', 'gimp-context-set-foreground', 'gimp-context-set-brush' and all brush property settings, 'gimp-context-set-gradient' and all gradient property settings, 'gimp-context-set-line-width' and all line property settings, 'gimp-context-set-antialias'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable to stroke to
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-get-filename

NAME
gimp-image-get-filename
SYNOPSIS
filename = pdb.gimp_image_get_filename(image)
BLURB
Returns the specified image's filename.
HELP
This procedure returns the specified image's filename in the filesystem encoding. The image has a filename only if it was loaded or imported from a file or has since been saved or exported. Otherwise, this function returns %NULL. See also 'gimp-image-get-uri'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe filename. The returned value must be freed with g_free()
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

BLURB

The XCF file format has been designed specifically for loading and saving tiled and layered images in GIMP. This procedure will load the specified file.

gimp-image-get-colormap

NAME
gimp-image-get-colormap
SYNOPSIS
num-bytes, colormap = pdb.gimp_image_get_colormap(image)
BLURB
Returns the image's colormap
HELP
This procedure returns an actual pointer to the image's colormap, as well as the number of bytes contained in the colormap. The actual number of colors in the transmitted colormap will be 'num-bytes' / 3. If the image is not in Indexed color mode, no colormap is returned.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
num-bytesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of bytes in the colormap array (num-bytes >= 0)
colormapGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYThe image's colormap. The returned value must be freed with g_free()
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-displace-polar

NAME
plug-in-displace-polar
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_displace_polar(run-mode, image, drawable, amount-x, amount-y, do-x, do-y, displace-map-x, displace-map-y, displace-type)
BLURB
Displace pixels as indicated by displacement maps
HELP
Just like plug-in-displace but working in polar coordinates. The drawable is whirled and pinched according to the map.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
amount-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATDisplace multiplier for radial direction (-500 <= amount-x <= 500)
amount-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATDisplace multiplier for tangent direction (-500 <= amount-y <= 500)
do-xGIMP_PDB_INT32Displace in radial direction ? (TRUE or FALSE)
do-yGIMP_PDB_INT32Displace in tangent direction ? (TRUE or FALSE)
displace-map-xGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDisplacement map for radial direction
displace-map-yGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDisplacement map for tangent direction
displace-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Edge behavior {
WRAP (1)
SMEAR (2)
BLACK (3)
} (1 <= displace-type <= 3)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:displace' for credits.
(c)2015 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:displace' for credits.

plug-in-cartoon

NAME
plug-in-cartoon
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_cartoon(run-mode, image, drawable, mask-radius, pct-black)
BLURB
Simulate a cartoon by enhancing edges
HELP
Propagates dark values in an image based on each pixel's relative darkness to a neighboring average. The idea behind this filter is to give the look of a black felt pen drawing subsequently shaded with color. This is achieved by darkening areas of the image which are measured to be darker than a neighborhood average. In this way, sufficiently large shifts in intensity are darkened to black. The rate at which they are darkened to black is determined by the second pct_black parameter. The mask_radius parameter controls the size of the pixel neighborhood over which the average intensity is computed and then compared to each pixel in the neighborhood to decide whether or not to darken it to black. Large values for mask_radius result in very thick black areas bordering the shaded regions of color and much less detail for black areas everywhere including inside regions of color. Small values result in more subtle pen strokes and detail everywhere. Small values for the pct_black make the blend from the color regions to the black border lines smoother and the lines themselves thinner and less noticeable; larger values achieve the opposite effect.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
mask-radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATCartoon mask radius (radius of pixel neighborhood)
pct-blackGIMP_PDB_FLOATPercentage of darkened pixels to set to black (0.0 - 1.0)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball
(c)2001 Bit Specialists, Inc.

plug-in-icc-profile-file-info

AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2015 Sven Neumann

gimp-image-delete

NAME
gimp-image-delete
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_delete(image)
BLURB
Delete the specified image.
HELP
If there are no displays associated with this image it will be deleted. This means that you can not delete an image through the PDB that was created by the user. If the associated display was however created through the PDB and you know the display ID, you may delete the display. Removal of the last associated display will then delete the image.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-insert-channel

NAME
gimp-image-insert-channel
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_insert_channel(image, channel, parent, position)
BLURB
Add the specified channel to the image.
HELP
This procedure adds the specified channel to the image at the given position. Since channel groups are not currently supported, the parent argument must always be 0. The position argument specifies the location of the channel inside the stack, starting from the top (0) and increasing. If the position is specified as -1, then the channel is inserted above the active channel.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
channelGIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe channel
parentGIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe parent channel
positionGIMP_PDB_INT32The channel position
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

HELP

plug-in-decompose

NAME
plug-in-decompose
SYNOPSIS
new-image, new-image, new-image, new-image = pdb.plug_in_decompose(run-mode, image, drawable, decompose-type, layers-mode)
BLURB
Decompose an image into separate colorspace components
HELP
This function creates new gray images with different channel information in each of them
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}

drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
decompose-typeGIMP_PDB_STRINGWhat to decompose: "RGB", "RGBA", "Red", "Green", "Blue", "Alpha", "HSV", "Hue", "Saturation", "Value", "HSL", "Hue (HSL)", "Saturation (HSL)", "Lightness", "CMYK", "Cyan", "Magenta", "Yellow", "Black", "LAB", "LCH", "YCbCr_ITU_R470", "YCbCr_ITU_R470_256", "YCbCr_ITU_R709", "YCbCr_ITU_R709_256"
layers-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Create channels as layers in a single image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput gray image
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput gray image (N/A for single channel extract)
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput gray image (N/A for single channel extract)
new-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput gray image (N/A for single channel extract)
AUTHOR
Peter Kirchgessner
(c)1997 Peter Kirchgessner

gimp-drawable-transform-flip-default

file-raw-placeholder-srw-load

NAME
file-raw-placeholder-srw-load
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.file_raw_placeholder_srw_load(run-mode, filename, raw-filename)
BLURB
Load files in the SRW raw format via raw-placeholder
HELP
This plug-in loads files in Samsung's raw SRW format by calling raw-placeholder.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}

raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name entered
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

AUTHOR
Tobias Ellinghaus
(c)2016 Tobias Ellinghaus
