gimp-image-get-component-active

NAME
gimp-image-get-component-active
SYNOPSIS
active = pdb.gimp_image_get_component_active(image, component)
BLURB
Returns if the specified image's image component is active.
HELP
This procedure returns if the specified image's image component (i.e. Red, Green, Blue intensity channels in an RGB image) is active or inactive -- whether or not it can be modified. If the specified component is not valid for the image type, an error is returned.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
componentGIMP_PDB_INT32The image component {
CHANNEL-RED (0)
CHANNEL-GREEN (1)
CHANNEL-BLUE (2)
CHANNEL-GRAY (3)
CHANNEL-INDEXED (4)
CHANNEL-ALPHA (5)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
activeGIMP_PDB_INT32Component is active (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-item-transform-2d

NAME
gimp-item-transform-2d
SYNOPSIS
item = pdb.gimp_item_transform_2d(item, source-x, source-y, scale-x, scale-y, angle, dest-x, dest-y)
BLURB
Transform the specified item in 2d.
HELP
This procedure transforms the specified item. The transformation is done by scaling by the x and y scale factors about the point (source_x, source_y), then rotating around the same point, then translating that point to the new position (dest_x, dest_y). If a selection exists and the item is a drawable, the portion of the drawable which lies under the selection is cut from the drawable and made into a floating selection which is then transformed as specified. The return value is the ID of the transformed floating selection. If there is no selection or the item is not a drawable, the entire item will be transformed according to the specified parameters. Additionally, if the item has its linked flag set to TRUE, all additional items contained in the image which have the linked flag set to TRUE will also be transformed the same way. The return value will be equal to the item ID supplied as input. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-interpolation', 'gimp-context-set-transform-direction', 'gimp-context-set-transform-resize'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe affected item
source-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATX coordinate of the transformation center
source-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATY coordinate of the transformation center
scale-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmount to scale in x direction
scale-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmount to scale in y direction
angleGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe angle of rotation (radians)
dest-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATX coordinate of where the center goes
dest-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATY coordinate of where the center goes
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe transformed item
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

gimp-image-get-active-layer

NAME
gimp-image-get-active-layer
SYNOPSIS
active-layer = pdb.gimp_image_get_active_layer(image)
BLURB
Returns the specified image's active layer.
HELP
If there is an active layer, its ID will be returned, otherwise, -1. If a channel is currently active, then no layer will be. If a layer mask is active, then this will return the associated layer.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
active-layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe active layer
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-drawable-levels-stretch

NAME
gimp-drawable-levels-stretch
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_levels_stretch(drawable)
BLURB
Automatically modifies intensity levels in the specified drawable.
HELP
This procedure allows intensity levels in the specified drawable to be remapped according to a set of guessed parameters. It is equivalent to clicking the "Auto" button in the Levels tool.

Joao S.O. Bueno, Shawn Willden

gimp-item-transform-matrix

NAME
gimp-item-transform-matrix
SYNOPSIS
item = pdb.gimp_item_transform_matrix(item, coeff-0-0, coeff-0-1, coeff-0-2, coeff-1-0, coeff-1-1, coeff-1-2, coeff-2-0, coeff-2-1, coeff-2-2)
BLURB
Transform the specified item in 2d.
HELP
This procedure transforms the specified item. The transformation is done by assembling a 3x3 matrix from the coefficients passed. If a selection exists and the item is a drawable, the portion of the drawable which lies under the selection is cut from the drawable and made into a floating selection which is then transformed as specified. The return value is the ID of the transformed floating selection. If there is no selection or the item is not a drawable, the entire item will be transformed according to the specified matrix. Additionally, if the item has its linked flag set to TRUE, all additional items contained in the image which have the linked flag set to TRUE will also be transformed the same way. The return value will be equal to the item ID supplied as input. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-interpolation', 'gimp-context-set-transform-direction', 'gimp-context-set-transform-resize'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe affected item
coeff-0-0GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (0,0) of the transformation matrix
coeff-0-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (0,1) of the transformation matrix
coeff-0-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (0,2) of the transformation matrix
coeff-1-0GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (1,0) of the transformation matrix
coeff-1-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (1,1) of the transformation matrix
coeff-1-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (1,2) of the transformation matrix
coeff-2-0GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (2,0) of the transformation matrix
coeff-2-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (2,1) of the transformation matrix
coeff-2-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (2,2) of the transformation matrix
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe transformed item
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

gimp-plugin-set-pdb-error-handler

NAME
gimp-plugin-set-pdb-error-handler
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_plugin_set_pdb_error_handler(handler)
BLURB
Sets an error handler for procedure calls.
HELP
This procedure changes the way that errors in procedure calls are handled. By default GIMP will raise an error dialog if a procedure call made by a plug-in fails. Using this procedure the plug-in can change this behavior. If the error handler is set to %GIMP_PDB_ERROR_HANDLER_PLUGIN, then the plug-in is responsible for calling 'gimp-get-pdb-error' and handling the error whenever one if its procedure calls fails. It can do this by displaying the error message or by forwarding it in its own return values.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
handlerGIMP_PDB_INT32Who is responsible for handling procedure call errors {
PDB-ERROR-HANDLER-INTERNAL (0)
PDB-ERROR-HANDLER-PLUGIN (1)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2008 Sven Neumann

gimp-drawable-set-pixel

NAME
gimp-drawable-set-pixel
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_set_pixel(drawable, x-coord, y-coord, num-channels, pixel)
BLURB
Sets the value of the pixel at the specified coordinates.
HELP
This procedure sets the pixel value at the specified coordinates. The 'num_channels' argument must always be equal to the bytes-per-pixel value for the specified drawable. Note that this function is not undoable, you should use it only on drawables you just created yourself.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
x-coordGIMP_PDB_INT32The x coordinate (x-coord >= 0)
y-coordGIMP_PDB_INT32The y coordinate (y-coord >= 0)
num-channelsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of channels for the pixel (num-channels >= 0)
pixelGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYThe pixel value
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-icc-profile-set-rgb

NAME
plug-in-icc-profile-set-rgb
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_icc_profile_set_rgb(run-mode, image)
BLURB
Set the default RGB color profile on the image
HELP
This procedure sets the user-configured RGB profile on an image using the 'icc-profile' parasite. If no RGB profile is configured, sRGB is assumed and the parasite is unset. This procedure does not do any color conversion.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2015 Sven Neumann

gimp-image-add-hguide

NAME
gimp-image-add-hguide
SYNOPSIS

BLURB
Add a horizontal guide to an image.
HELP
This procedure adds a horizontal guide to an image. It takes the input image and the y-position of the new guide as parameters. It returns the guide ID of the new guide.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
ypositionGIMP_PDB_INT32The guide's y-offset from top of image (yposition >= 0)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
guideGIMP_PDB_INT32The new guide
AUTHOR
Adam D. Moss
(c)1998 Adam D. Moss

gimp-image-convert-rgb

NAME
gimp-image-convert-rgb
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_convert_rgb(image)
BLURB
Convert specified image to RGB color
HELP
This procedure converts the specified image to RGB color. This process requires an image in Grayscale or Indexed color mode. No image content is lost in this process aside from the colormap for an indexed image.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

HELP

x1GIMP_PDB_FLOAThorz. coord. of other end of axis
y1GIMP_PDB_FLOATvert. coord. of other end of axis

TRANSFORM-FORWARD (0)
TRANSFORM-BACKWARD (1)
}
interpolationGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of interpolation {
INTERPOLATION-NONE (0)
INTERPOLATION-LINEAR (1)
INTERPOLATION-CUBIC (2)
INTERPOLATION-NOHALO (3)
INTERPOLATION-LOHALO (4)
}
supersampleGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (TRUE or FALSE)
recursion-levelGIMP_PDB_INT32This parameter is ignored (recursion-level >= 1)
clip-resultGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to clip results (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES

NONE (0)

NAME
gimp-image-unset-active-channel
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_unset_active_channel(image)
BLURB
Unsets the active channel in the specified image.
HELP
If an active channel exists, it is unset. There then exists no active channel, and if desired, one can be set through a call to 'Set Active Channel'. No error is returned in the case of no existing active channel.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

scale-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATAmount to scale in y direction

gimp-smudge

NAME
gimp-smudge
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_smudge(drawable, pressure, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Smudge image with varying pressure.
HELP
This tool simulates a smudge using the current brush. High pressure results in a greater smudge of paint while low pressure results in a lesser smudge.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
pressureGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe pressure of the smudge strokes (0 <= pressure <= 100)
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

file-pdf-save

NAME
file-pdf-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_pdf_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, vectorize, ignore-hidden, apply-masks)
BLURB
Save files in PDF format
HELP
Saves files in Adobe's Portable Document Format. PDF is designed to be easily processed by a variety of different platforms, and is a distant cousin of PostScript.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Run mode
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image in
vectorizeGIMP_PDB_INT32Convert bitmaps to vector graphics where possible. TRUE or FALSE
ignore-hiddenGIMP_PDB_INT32Omit hidden layers and layers with zero opacity. TRUE or FALSE
apply-masksGIMP_PDB_INT32Apply layer masks before saving. TRUE or FALSE (Keeping them will not change the output)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Barak Itkin
(c)August 2009 Copyright Barak Itkin

plug-in-mblur

NAME
plug-in-mblur
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_mblur(run-mode, image, drawable, type, length, angle, center-x, center-y)
BLURB
Simulate movement using directional blur
HELP
This plug-in simulates the effect seen when photographing a moving object at a slow shutter speed. Done by adding multiple displaced copies.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Type of motion blur {
LINEAR (0)
RADIAL (1)
ZOOM (2)
} (0 <= type <= 2)
lengthGIMP_PDB_FLOATLength
angleGIMP_PDB_FLOATAngle (0 <= angle <= 360)
center-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATCenter X
center-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATCenter Y
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:motion-blur-linear, -zoom, -cirular' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:motion-blur-linear, -zoom, -cirular' for credits.

(c)2009 Jon Nordby

gimp-image-undo-freeze

NAME
gimp-image-undo-freeze
SYNOPSIS
frozen = pdb.gimp_image_undo_freeze(image)
BLURB
Freeze the image's undo stack.
HELP
This procedure freezes the image's undo stack, allowing subsequent operations to ignore their undo steps. This is generally called in conjunction with 'gimp-image-undo-thaw' to temporarily disable an image undo stack. This is advantageous because saving undo steps can be time and memory intensive. 'gimp-image-undo-freeze' / 'gimp-image-undo-thaw' and 'gimp-image-undo-disable' / 'gimp-image-undo-enable' differ in that the former does not free up all undo steps when undo is thawed, so is more suited to interactive in-situ previews. It is important in this case that the image is back to the same state it was frozen in before thawing, else 'undo' behaviour is undefined.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
frozenGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if the image undo has been frozen (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Adam D. Moss
(c)1999 Adam D. Moss

script-fu-perspective-shadow

NAME
script-fu-perspective-shadow
SYNOPSIS
pdb.script_fu_perspective_shadow(run-mode, image, drawable, value, value, value, value, color, value, enum, toggle)
BLURB
Add a perspective shadow to the selected region (or alpha)
HELP
MENUPATH
Temporary Procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEImage
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATAngle
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATRelative distance of horizon
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATRelative length of shadow
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATBlur radius
colorGIMP_PDB_COLORColor
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATOpacity
enumGIMP_PDB_INT32Interpolation
toggleGIMP_PDB_INT32Allow resizing
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2000/11/08 Sven Neumann

plug-in-diffraction

NAME
plug-in-diffraction
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_diffraction(run-mode, image, drawable, lam-r, lam-g, lam-b, contour-r, contour-g, contour-b, edges-r, edges-g, edges-b, brightness, scattering, polarization)
BLURB
Generate diffraction patterns
HELP
Help? What help?
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
lam-rGIMP_PDB_FLOATLight frequency (red) (0 <= lam-r <= 20)
lam-gGIMP_PDB_FLOATLight frequency (green) (0 <= lam-g <= 20)
lam-bGIMP_PDB_FLOATLight frequency (blue) (0 <= lam-b <= 20)
contour-rGIMP_PDB_FLOATNumber of contours (red) (0 <= contour-r <= 10)
contour-gGIMP_PDB_FLOATNumber of contours (green) (0 <= contour-g <= 10)
contour-bGIMP_PDB_FLOATNumber of contours (blue) (0 <= contour-b <= 10)
edges-rGIMP_PDB_FLOATNumber of sharp edges (red) (0 <= edges-r <= 1)
edges-gGIMP_PDB_FLOATNumber of sharp edges (green) (0 <= edges-g <= 1)
edges-bGIMP_PDB_FLOATNumber of sharp edges (blue) (0 <= edges-b <= 1)
brightnessGIMP_PDB_FLOATBrightness and shifting/fattening of contours (0 <= brightness <= 1)
scatteringGIMP_PDB_FLOATScattering (Speed vs. quality) (0 <= scattering <= 100)
polarizationGIMP_PDB_FLOATPolarization (-1 <= polarization <= 1)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:diffraction-patterns' for credits.
(c)2015 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:diffraction-patterns' for credits.

gimp-context-push

NAME
gimp-context-push
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_push()
BLURB
Pushes a context to the top of the plug-in's context stack.
HELP
This procedure creates a new context by copying the current context. This copy becomes the new current context for the calling plug-in until it is popped again using 'gimp-context-pop'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR

gimp-layer-set-apply-mask

NAME
gimp-layer-set-apply-mask
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_layer_set_apply_mask(layer, apply-mask)
BLURB
Set the apply mask setting of the specified layer.
HELP
This procedure sets the specified layer's apply mask setting. This controls whether the layer's mask is currently affecting the alpha channel. If there is no layer mask, this function will return an error.
MENUPATH

INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer
apply-maskGIMP_PDB_INT32The new layer's apply mask setting (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES

Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-convolve-default

NAME
gimp-convolve-default
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_convolve_default(drawable, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Convolve (Blur, Sharpen) using the current brush.
HELP
This tool convolves the specified drawable with either a sharpening or blurring kernel. This function performs exactly the same as the 'gimp-convolve' function except that the tools arguments are obtained from the convolve option dialog. It this dialog has not been activated then the dialogs default values will be used.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Andy Thomas
(c)1999 Andy Thomas

gimp-context-set-gradient

NAME
gimp-context-set-gradient
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_gradient(name)
BLURB
Sets the specified gradient as the active gradient.
HELP
This procedure lets you set the specified gradient as the active or "current" one. The name is simply a string which corresponds to one of the loaded gradients. If no matching gradient is found, this procedure will return an error. Otherwise, the specified gradient will become active and will be used for subsequent custom gradient operations.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the gradient
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer & Sven Neumann
(c)2004 Michael Natterer & Sven Neumann

gimp-drawable-invert

NAME
gimp-drawable-invert
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_invert(drawable, linear)
BLURB
Invert the contents of the specified drawable.
HELP
This procedure inverts the contents of the specified drawable. Each intensity channel is inverted independently. The inverted intensity is given as inten' = (255 - inten). If 'linear' is TRUE, the drawable is inverted in linear space.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
linearGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to invert in linear space (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-display-get-window-handle

NAME
gimp-display-get-window-handle
SYNOPSIS
window = pdb.gimp_display_get_window_handle(display)
BLURB
Get a handle to the native window for an image display.
HELP
This procedure returns a handle to the native window for a given image display. For example in the X backend of GDK, a native window handle is an Xlib XID. A value of 0 is returned for an invalid display or if this function is unimplemented for the windowing system that is being used.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
displayGIMP_PDB_DISPLAYThe display to get the window handle from
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
windowGIMP_PDB_INT32The native window handle or 0
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2005 Sven Neumann

(c)

gimp-image-freeze-channels

NAME
gimp-image-freeze-channels
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_freeze_channels(image)
BLURB
Freeze the image's channel list.
HELP
This procedure freezes the channel list of the image, suppressing any updates to the Channels dialog in response to changes to the image's channels. This can significantly improve performance while applying changes affecting the channel list. Each call to 'gimp-image-freeze-channels' should be matched by a corresponding call to 'gimp-image-thaw-channels', undoing its effects.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Ell
(c)2018 Ell

BLURB

HELP
This procedure adds a sample point to an image. It takes the input image and the position of the new sample points as parameters. It returns the sample point ID of the new sample point.

gimp-gradient-segment-range-set-blending-function

NAME
gimp-gradient-segment-range-set-blending-function
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_gradient_segment_range_set_blending_function(name, start-segment, end-segment, blending-function)
BLURB
Change the blending function of a segments range
HELP
This function changes the blending function of a segment range to the specified blending function.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe gradient name
start-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the first segment to operate on (start-segment >= 0)
end-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the last segment to operate on. If negative, the selection will extend to the end of the string.
blending-functionGIMP_PDB_INT32The blending function {
GRADIENT-SEGMENT-LINEAR (0)
GRADIENT-SEGMENT-CURVED (1)
GRADIENT-SEGMENT-SINE (2)
GRADIENT-SEGMENT-SPHERE-INCREASING (3)
GRADIENT-SEGMENT-SPHERE-DECREASING (4)
GRADIENT-SEGMENT-STEP (5)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Shlomi Fish
(c)2003 Shlomi Fish

script-fu-tile-blur

NAME
script-fu-tile-blur
SYNOPSIS
pdb.script_fu_tile_blur(run-mode, image, drawable, value, toggle, toggle, option)
BLURB
Blur the edges of an image so the result tiles seamlessly
HELP
MENUPATH
Temporary Procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe Image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe Layer
valueGIMP_PDB_FLOATRadius
toggleGIMP_PDB_INT32Blur vertically
toggleGIMP_PDB_INT32Blur horizontally
optionGIMP_PDB_INT32Blur type
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Chris Gutteridge
(c)25th April 1998 1998, Chris Gutteridge / ECS dept, University of Southampton, England.

gimp-image-height

NAME
gimp-image-height
SYNOPSIS
height = pdb.gimp_image_height(image)
BLURB
Return the height of the image
HELP
This procedure returns the image's height. This value is independent of any of the layers in this image. This is the "canvas" height.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32The image's height
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-selection-float

NAME
gimp-selection-float
SYNOPSIS
layer = pdb.gimp_selection_float(drawable, offx, offy)
BLURB
Float the selection from the specified drawable with initial offsets as specified.
HELP
This procedure determines the region of the specified drawable that lies beneath the current selection. The region is then cut from the drawable and the resulting data is made into a new layer which is instantiated as a floating selection. The offsets allow initial positioning of the new floating selection.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable from which to float selection
offxGIMP_PDB_INT32x offset for translation
offyGIMP_PDB_INT32y offset for translation
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe floated layer
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

file-xpm-load

NAME
file-xpm-load
SYNOPSIS
image = pdb.file_xpm_load(run-mode, filename, raw-filename)
BLURB
Load files in XPM (X11 Pixmap) format.
HELP
Load files in XPM (X11 Pixmap) format. XPM is a portable image format designed to be included in C source code. XLib provides utility functions to read this format. Newer code should however be using gdk-pixbuf-csource instead. XPM supports colored images, unlike the XBM format which XPM was designed to replace.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to load
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name entered
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEOutput image
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis & Ray Lehtiniemi
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-drawable-transform-matrix-default

NAME
gimp-drawable-transform-matrix-default
SYNOPSIS
drawable = pdb.gimp_drawable_transform_matrix_default(drawable, coeff-0-0, coeff-0-1, coeff-0-2, coeff-1-0, coeff-1-1, coeff-1-2, coeff-2-0, coeff-2-1, coeff-2-2, interpolate, clip-result)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-matrix' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-item-transform-matrix' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
coeff-0-0GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (0,0) of the transformation matrix
coeff-0-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (0,1) of the transformation matrix
coeff-0-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (0,2) of the transformation matrix
coeff-1-0GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (1,0) of the transformation matrix
coeff-1-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (1,1) of the transformation matrix
coeff-1-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (1,2) of the transformation matrix
coeff-2-0GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (2,0) of the transformation matrix
coeff-2-1GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (2,1) of the transformation matrix
coeff-2-2GIMP_PDB_FLOATcoefficient (2,2) of the transformation matrix
interpolateGIMP_PDB_INT32Whether to use interpolation and supersampling (TRUE or FALSE)
clip-resultGIMP_PDB_INT32How to clip results {
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-ADJUST (0)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CLIP (1)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP (2)
TRANSFORM-RESIZE-CROP-WITH-ASPECT (3)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe transformed drawable
AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno
(c)2004 João S. O. Bueno

gimp-drawable-threshold

NAME
gimp-drawable-threshold
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_threshold(drawable, channel, low-threshold, high-threshold)
BLURB
Threshold the specified drawable.
HELP
This procedures generates a threshold map of the specified drawable. All pixels between the values of 'low_threshold' and 'high_threshold', on the scale of 'channel' are replaced with white, and all other pixels with black.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
channelGIMP_PDB_INT32The channel to base the threshold on {
HISTOGRAM-VALUE (0)
HISTOGRAM-RED (1)
HISTOGRAM-GREEN (2)
HISTOGRAM-BLUE (3)
HISTOGRAM-ALPHA (4)
HISTOGRAM-LUMINANCE (5)
HISTOGRAM-RGB (6)
}
low-thresholdGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe low threshold value (0 <= low-threshold <= 1)
high-thresholdGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe high threshold value (0 <= high-threshold <= 1)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-item-transform-translate

NAME
gimp-item-transform-translate
SYNOPSIS
item = pdb.gimp_item_transform_translate(item, off-x, off-y)
BLURB
Translate the item by the specified offsets.
HELP
This procedure translates the item by the amounts specified in the off_x and off_y arguments. These can be negative, and are considered offsets from the current position. The offsets will be rounded to the nearest pixel unless the item is a path. If the item is attached to an image and has its linked flag set to TRUE, all additional items contained in the image which have the linked flag set to TRUE will also be translated by the specified offsets.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe item
off-xGIMP_PDB_FLOATOffset in x direction
off-yGIMP_PDB_FLOATOffset in y direction
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe translated item
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2018 Michael Natterer

gimp-image-get-unit

NAME
gimp-image-get-unit
SYNOPSIS
unit = pdb.gimp_image_get_unit(image)
BLURB
Returns the specified image's unit.
HELP
This procedure returns the specified image's unit. This value is independent of any of the layers in this image. See the gimp_unit_*() procedure definitions for the valid range of unit IDs and a description of the unit system.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
unitGIMP_PDB_INT32The unit
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)1998 Michael Natterer

gimp-image-get-active-drawable

NAME
gimp-image-get-active-drawable
SYNOPSIS
drawable = pdb.gimp_image_get_active_drawable(image)
BLURB
Get the image's active drawable
HELP
This procedure returns the ID of the image's active drawable. This can be either a layer, a channel, or a layer mask. The active drawable is specified by the active image channel. If that is -1, then by the active image layer. If the active image layer has a layer mask and the layer mask is in edit mode, then the layer mask is the active drawable.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe active drawable
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-autocrop-layer

NAME
plug-in-autocrop-layer
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_autocrop_layer(run-mode, image, drawable)
BLURB
Crop the active layer based on empty borders of the input drawable
HELP
Crop the active layer of the input "image" based on empty borders of the input "drawable". The input drawable serves as a base for detecting cropping extents (transparency or background color), and is not necessarily the cropped layer (the current active layer).
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1997 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-set-tattoo-state

NAME
gimp-image-set-tattoo-state
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_image_set_tattoo_state(image, tattoo-state)
BLURB
Set the tattoo state associated with the image.
HELP
This procedure sets the tattoo state of the image. Use only by save/load plug-ins that wish to preserve an images tattoo state. Using this function at other times will produce unexpected results. A full check of uniqueness of states in layers, channels and paths will be performed by this procedure and a execution failure will be returned if this fails. A failure will also be returned if the new tattoo state value is less than the maximum tattoo value from all of the tattoos from the paths, layers and channels. After the image data has been loaded and all the tattoos have been set then this is the last procedure that should be called. If effectively does a status check on the tattoo values that have been set to make sure that all is OK.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
tattoo-stateGIMP_PDB_INT32The new image tattoo state
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Andy Thomas
(c)2000 Andy Thomas

NAME
file-svg-load-thumb

AUTHOR
Dom Lachowicz, Sven Neumann
(c)2.5.0 Dom Lachowicz

gimp-display-delete

NAME
gimp-display-delete
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_display_delete(display)
BLURB
Delete the specified display.
HELP
This procedure removes the specified display. If this is the last remaining display for the underlying image, then the image is deleted also. Note that the display is closed no matter if the image is dirty or not. Better save the image before calling this procedure.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
displayGIMP_PDB_DISPLAYThe display to delete
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

Rotates a layer or the whole image by 90, 180 or 270 degrees
HELP
This plug-in does rotate the active layer or the whole image clockwise by multiples of 90 degrees. When the whole image is chosen, the image is resized if necessary.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
angleGIMP_PDB_INT32Angle {
90 (1)
180 (2)
270 (3)
} degrees (1 <= angle <= 3)
everythingGIMP_PDB_INT32Rotate the whole image (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2014 Sven Neumann

gimp-vectors-stroke-flip

NAME
gimp-vectors-stroke-flip
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_vectors_stroke_flip(vectors, stroke-id, flip-type, axis)
BLURB
flips the given stroke.
HELP
Rotates the given stroke around given center by angle (in degrees).
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
vectorsGIMP_PDB_VECTORSThe vectors object
stroke-idGIMP_PDB_INT32The stroke ID
flip-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Flip orientation
either vertical or horizontal {
ORIENTATION-HORIZONTAL (0)
ORIENTATION-VERTICAL (1)
}
axisGIMP_PDB_FLOATaxis coordinate about which to flip, in pixels
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
João S. O. Bueno
(c)2006 João S. O. Bueno

gimp-context-set-palette

NAME
gimp-context-set-palette
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_palette(name)
BLURB
Set the specified palette as the active palette.
HELP
This procedure allows the active palette to be set by specifying its name. The name is simply a string which corresponds to one of the names of the installed palettes. If no matching palette is found, this procedure will return an error. Otherwise, the specified palette becomes active and will be used in all subsequent palette operations.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the palette
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer & Sven Neumann
(c)2004 Michael Natterer & Sven Neumann

HELP

plug-in-nlfilt

NAME
plug-in-nlfilt
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_nlfilt(run-mode, img, drw, alpha, radius, filter)
BLURB
Nonlinear swiss army knife filter
HELP
This is the pnmnlfilt, in gimp's clothing. See the pnmnlfilt manpage for details.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imgGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe Image to Filter
drwGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe Drawable
alphaGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe amount of the filter to apply
radiusGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe filter radius
filterGIMP_PDB_INT32The Filter to Run, 0 - alpha trimmed mean; 1 - optimal estimation (alpha controls noise variance); 2 - edge enhancement
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

gimp-convolve

NAME
gimp-convolve
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_convolve(drawable, pressure, convolve-type, num-strokes, strokes)
BLURB
Convolve (Blur, Sharpen) using the current brush.
HELP
This tool convolves the specified drawable with either a sharpening or blurring kernel. The pressure parameter controls the magnitude of the operation. Like the paintbrush, this tool linearly interpolates between the specified stroke coordinates.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
pressureGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe pressure (0 <= pressure <= 100)
convolve-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32Convolve type {
CONVOLVE-BLUR (0)
CONVOLVE-SHARPEN (1)
}
num-strokesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of stroke control points (count each coordinate as 2 points) (num-strokes >= 2)
strokesGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYArray of stroke coordinates: {
s1.x
s1.y
s2.x
s2.y
...
sn.x
sn.y
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-gradient-segment-set-middle-pos

NAME
gimp-gradient-segment-set-middle-pos
SYNOPSIS
final-pos = pdb.gimp_gradient_segment_set_middle_pos(name, segment, pos)
BLURB
Sets the middle point position of the specified segment
HELP
This procedure sets the middle point position of the specified segment of the specified gradient. The final position will be between the two endpoints of the segment. This procedure returns the final position.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe gradient name
segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the segment within the gradient (segment >= 0)
posGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe position to set the guidepoint to (0 <= pos <= 1)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
final-posGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe return position
AUTHOR
Shlomi Fish
(c)2003 Shlomi Fish

file-webp-save

NAME
file-webp-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_webp_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename, preset, lossless, quality, alpha-quality, animation, anim-loop, minimize-size, kf-distance, exif, iptc, xmp, delay, force-delay)
BLURB
Saves files in the WebP image format
HELP
Saves files in the WebP image format
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Interactive, non-interactive
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to save
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save the image to
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name entered
presetGIMP_PDB_INT32preset (Default=0, Picture=1, Photo=2, Drawing=3, Icon=4, Text=5)
losslessGIMP_PDB_INT32Use lossless encoding (0/1)
qualityGIMP_PDB_FLOATQuality of the image (0 <= quality <= 100)
alpha-qualityGIMP_PDB_FLOATQuality of the image's alpha channel (0 <= alpha-quality <= 100)
animationGIMP_PDB_INT32Use layers for animation (0/1)
anim-loopGIMP_PDB_INT32Loop animation infinitely (0/1)
minimize-sizeGIMP_PDB_INT32Minimize animation size (0/1)
kf-distanceGIMP_PDB_INT32Maximum distance between key-frames (>=0)
exifGIMP_PDB_INT32Toggle saving exif data (0/1)
iptcGIMP_PDB_INT32Toggle saving iptc data (0/1)
xmpGIMP_PDB_INT32Toggle saving xmp data (0/1)
delayGIMP_PDB_INT32Delay to use when timestamps are not available or forced
force-delayGIMP_PDB_INT32Force delay on all frames
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Nathan Osman, Ben Touchette
(c)2015,2016 (C) 2015-2016 Nathan Osman, (C) 2016 Ben Touchette

file-dicom-save

NAME
file-dicom-save
SYNOPSIS
pdb.file_dicom_save(run-mode, image, drawable, filename, raw-filename)
BLURB
Save file in the DICOM file format
HELP
Save an image in the medical standard DICOM image formats. The standard is defined at http://medical.nema.org/. The file format is defined in section 10 of the standard. The files are saved uncompressed and the compulsory DICOM tags are filled with default dummy values.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEDrawable to save
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save
raw-filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to save
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Dov Grobgeld
(c)2003 Dov Grobgeld

gimp-procedural-db-query

NAME
gimp-procedural-db-query
SYNOPSIS
num-matches, procedure-names = pdb.gimp_procedural_db_query(name, blurb, help, author, copyright, date, proc-type)
BLURB
Queries the procedural database for its contents using regular expression matching.
HELP
This procedure queries the contents of the procedural database. It is supplied with seven arguments matching procedures on @{ name, blurb, help, author, copyright, date, procedure type@}. This is accomplished using regular expression matching. For instance, to find all procedures with "jpeg" listed in the blurb, all seven arguments can be supplied as ".*", except for the second, which can be supplied as ".*jpeg.*". There are two return arguments for this procedure. The first is the number of procedures matching the query. The second is a concatenated list of procedure names corresponding to those matching the query. If no matching entries are found, then the returned string is NULL and the number of entries is 0.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe regex for procedure name
blurbGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe regex for procedure blurb
helpGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe regex for procedure help
authorGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe regex for procedure author
copyrightGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe regex for procedure copyright
dateGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe regex for procedure date
proc-typeGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe regex for procedure type: {
'Internal GIMP procedure'
'GIMP Plug-in'
'GIMP Extension'
'Temporary Procedure'
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
num-matchesGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of matching procedures (num-matches >= 0)
procedure-namesGIMP_PDB_STRINGARRAYThe list of procedure names
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-histogram

NAME
gimp-histogram
SYNOPSIS
mean, std-dev, median, pixels, count, percentile = pdb.gimp_histogram(drawable, channel, start-range, end-range)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-drawable-histogram' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-drawable-histogram' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
channelGIMP_PDB_INT32The channel to modify {
HISTOGRAM-VALUE (0)
HISTOGRAM-RED (1)
HISTOGRAM-GREEN (2)
HISTOGRAM-BLUE (3)
HISTOGRAM-ALPHA (4)
HISTOGRAM-LUMINANCE (5)
HISTOGRAM-RGB (6)
}
start-rangeGIMP_PDB_INT32Start of the intensity measurement range (0 <= start-range <= 255)
end-rangeGIMP_PDB_INT32End of the intensity measurement range (0 <= end-range <= 255)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
meanGIMP_PDB_FLOATMean intensity value
std-devGIMP_PDB_FLOATStandard deviation of intensity values
medianGIMP_PDB_FLOATMedian intensity value
pixelsGIMP_PDB_FLOATAlpha-weighted pixel count for entire image
countGIMP_PDB_FLOATAlpha-weighted pixel count for range
percentileGIMP_PDB_FLOATPercentile that range falls under
AUTHOR

(c)

gimp-gradient-segment-range-replicate

NAME
gimp-gradient-segment-range-replicate
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_gradient_segment_range_replicate(name, start-segment, end-segment, replicate-times)
BLURB
Replicate the segment range
HELP
This function replicates a segment range a given number of times. Instead of the original segment range, several smaller scaled copies of it will appear in equal widths.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe gradient name
start-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the first segment to operate on (start-segment >= 0)
end-segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the last segment to operate on. If negative, the selection will extend to the end of the string.
replicate-timesGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of times to replicate (2 <= replicate-times <= 20)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Shlomi Fish
(c)2003 Shlomi Fish

gimp-drawable-update

NAME
gimp-drawable-update
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_update(drawable, x, y, width, height)
BLURB
Update the specified region of the drawable.
HELP
This procedure updates the specified region of the drawable. The (x, y) coordinate pair is relative to the drawable's origin, not to the image origin. Therefore, the entire drawable can be updated using (0, 0, width, height).
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
xGIMP_PDB_INT32x coordinate of upper left corner of update region
yGIMP_PDB_INT32y coordinate of upper left corner of update region
widthGIMP_PDB_INT32Width of update region
heightGIMP_PDB_INT32Height of update region
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-autostretch-hsv

NAME
plug-in-autostretch-hsv
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_autostretch_hsv(run-mode, image, drawable)
BLURB
Stretch contrast to cover the maximum possible range
HELP
This simple plug-in does an automatic contrast stretch. For each channel in the image, it finds the minimum and maximum values... it uses those values to stretch the individual histograms to the full contrast range. For some images it may do just what you want; for others it may be total crap :). This version differs from Contrast Autostretch in that it works in HSV space, and preserves hue.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:stretch-contrast-hsv' for credits.
(c)2013 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:stretch-contrast-hsv' for credits.

gimp-file-load-layer

NAME
gimp-file-load-layer
SYNOPSIS
layer = pdb.gimp_file_load_layer(run-mode, image, filename)
BLURB
Loads an image file as a layer for an existing image.
HELP
This procedure behaves like the file-load procedure but opens the specified image as a layer for an existing image. The returned layer needs to be added to the existing image with 'gimp-image-insert-layer'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEDestination image
filenameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the file to load
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe layer created when loading the image file
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2005 Sven Neumann

gimp-vectors-stroke-get-point-at-dist

NAME
gimp-vectors-stroke-get-point-at-dist
SYNOPSIS
x-point, y-point, slope, valid = pdb.gimp_vectors_stroke_get_point_at_dist(vectors, stroke-id, dist, precision)
BLURB
Get point at a specified distance along the stroke.
HELP
This will return the x,y position of a point at a given distance along the stroke. The distance will be obtained by first digitizing the curve internally and then walking along the curve. For a closed stroke the start of the path is the first point on the path that was created. This might not be obvious. If the stroke is not long enough, a "valid" flag will be FALSE.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
vectorsGIMP_PDB_VECTORSThe vectors object
stroke-idGIMP_PDB_INT32The stroke ID
distGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe given distance.
precisionGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe precision used for the approximation
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
x-pointGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe x position of the point.
y-pointGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe y position of the point.
slopeGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe slope (dy / dx) at the specified point.
validGIMP_PDB_INT32Indicator for the validity of the returned data. (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Simon Budig
(c)2005 Simon Budig

gimp-drawable-desaturate

NAME
gimp-drawable-desaturate
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_desaturate(drawable, desaturate-mode)
BLURB
Desaturate the contents of the specified drawable, with the specified formula.
HELP
This procedure desaturates the contents of the specified drawable, with the specified formula. This procedure only works on drawables of type RGB color.

NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

desaturate-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The formula to use to desaturate {

DESATURATE-LUMA (1)
DESATURATE-AVERAGE (2)
DESATURATE-LUMINANCE (3)
DESATURATE-VALUE (4)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Karine Delvare
(c)2005 Karine Delvare

gimp-text

NAME
gimp-text
SYNOPSIS
text-layer = pdb.gimp_text(image, drawable, x, y, text, border, antialias, size, size-type, foundry, family, weight, slant, set-width, spacing, registry, encoding)
BLURB

HELP

xGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe x coordinate for the left of the text bounding box
yGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe y coordinate for the top of the text bounding box
textGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe text to generate (in UTF-8 encoding)
borderGIMP_PDB_INT32The size of the border (border >= -1)
antialiasGIMP_PDB_INT32Antialiasing (TRUE or FALSE)
sizeGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe size of text in either pixels or points (size >= 0)
size-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The units of specified size {
PIXELS (0)
POINTS (1)
}
foundryGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe font foundry
familyGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe font family
weightGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe font weight
slantGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe font slant
set-widthGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe font set-width
spacingGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe font spacing
registryGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe font registry
encodingGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe font encoding
RETURN VALUES

text-layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe new text layer or -1 if no layer was created.

(c)

plug-in-ripple

NAME
plug-in-ripple
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_ripple(run-mode, image, drawable, period, amplitude, orientation, edges, waveform, antialias, tile)
BLURB
Displace pixels in a ripple pattern
HELP
Ripples the pixels of the specified drawable. Each row or column will be displaced a certain number of pixels coinciding with the given wave form.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
periodGIMP_PDB_INT32Period: number of pixels for one wave to complete
amplitudeGIMP_PDB_INT32Amplitude: maximum displacement of wave
orientationGIMP_PDB_INT32Orientation {
ORIENTATION-HORIZONTAL (0)
ORIENTATION-VERTICAL (1)
} (0 <= orientation <= 1)
edgesGIMP_PDB_INT32Edges {
SMEAR (0)
WRAP (1)
BLANK (2)
} (0 <= edges <= 2)
waveformGIMP_PDB_INT32Waveform {
SAWTOOTH (0)
SINE (1)
} (0 <= waveform <= 1)
antialiasGIMP_PDB_INT32Antialias {
TRUE
FALSE
} (TRUE or FALSE)
tileGIMP_PDB_INT32Tileable {
TRUE
FALSE
} (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:ripple' for credits.
(c)2018 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:ripple' for credits.

gimp-drawable-edit-bucket-fill

NAME
gimp-drawable-edit-bucket-fill
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_edit_bucket_fill(drawable, fill-type, x, y)
BLURB
Fill the area by a seed fill starting at the specified coordinates.
HELP
This procedure does a seed fill at the specified coordinates, using various parameters from the current context. In the case of merged sampling, the x and y coordinates are relative to the image's origin; otherwise, they are relative to the drawable's origin. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-opacity', 'gimp-context-set-paint-mode', 'gimp-context-set-foreground', 'gimp-context-set-background', 'gimp-context-set-pattern', 'gimp-context-set-sample-threshold', 'gimp-context-set-sample-merged', 'gimp-context-set-sample-criterion', 'gimp-context-set-diagonal-neighbors', 'gimp-context-set-antialias'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
fill-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of fill {
FILL-FOREGROUND (0)
FILL-BACKGROUND (1)
FILL-WHITE (2)
FILL-TRANSPARENT (3)
FILL-PATTERN (4)
}
xGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe x coordinate of this bucket fill's application.
yGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe y coordinate of this bucket fill's application.
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2018 Michael Natterer

gimp-layer-new-from-visible

NAME
gimp-layer-new-from-visible
SYNOPSIS
layer = pdb.gimp_layer_new_from_visible(image, dest-image, name)
BLURB
Create a new layer from what is visible in an image.
HELP
This procedure creates a new layer from what is visible in the given image. The new layer still needs to be added to the destination image, as this is not automatic. Add the new layer with the 'gimp-image-insert-layer' command. Other attributes such as layer mask modes, and offsets should be set with explicit procedure calls.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe source image from where the content is copied
dest-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe destination image to which to add the layer
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe layer name
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layerGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe newly created layer
AUTHOR
Sven Neumann
(c)2008 Sven Neumann

gimp-edit-blend

NAME
gimp-edit-blend
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_edit_blend(drawable, blend-mode, paint-mode, gradient-type, opacity, offset, repeat, reverse, supersample, max-depth, threshold, dither, x1, y1, x2, y2)
BLURB
Blend between the starting and ending coordinates with the specified blend mode and gradient type.
HELP
This tool requires information on the paint application mode, the blend mode, and the gradient type. It creates the specified variety of blend using the starting and ending coordinates as defined for each gradient type. For shapeburst gradient types, the context's distance metric is also relevant and can be updated with 'gimp-context-set-distance-metric'. Deprecated: Use 'gimp-drawable-edit-gradient-fill' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe affected drawable
blend-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of blend {
BLEND-FG-BG-RGB (0)
BLEND-FG-BG-HSV (1)
BLEND-FG-TRANSPARENT (2)
BLEND-CUSTOM (3)
}
paint-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The paint application mode {
LAYER-MODE-NORMAL-LEGACY (0)
LAYER-MODE-DISSOLVE (1)
LAYER-MODE-BEHIND-LEGACY (2)
LAYER-MODE-MULTIPLY-LEGACY (3)
LAYER-MODE-SCREEN-LEGACY (4)
LAYER-MODE-OVERLAY-LEGACY (5)
LAYER-MODE-DIFFERENCE-LEGACY (6)
LAYER-MODE-ADDITION-LEGACY (7)
LAYER-MODE-SUBTRACT-LEGACY (8)
LAYER-MODE-DARKEN-ONLY-LEGACY (9)
LAYER-MODE-LIGHTEN-ONLY-LEGACY (10)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-HUE-LEGACY (11)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-SATURATION-LEGACY (12)
LAYER-MODE-HSL-COLOR-LEGACY (13)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-VALUE-LEGACY (14)
LAYER-MODE-DIVIDE-LEGACY (15)
LAYER-MODE-DODGE-LEGACY (16)
LAYER-MODE-BURN-LEGACY (17)
LAYER-MODE-HARDLIGHT-LEGACY (18)
LAYER-MODE-SOFTLIGHT-LEGACY (19)
LAYER-MODE-GRAIN-EXTRACT-LEGACY (20)
LAYER-MODE-GRAIN-MERGE-LEGACY (21)
LAYER-MODE-COLOR-ERASE-LEGACY (22)
LAYER-MODE-OVERLAY (23)
LAYER-MODE-LCH-HUE (24)
LAYER-MODE-LCH-CHROMA (25)
LAYER-MODE-LCH-COLOR (26)
LAYER-MODE-LCH-LIGHTNESS (27)
LAYER-MODE-NORMAL (28)
LAYER-MODE-BEHIND (29)
LAYER-MODE-MULTIPLY (30)
LAYER-MODE-SCREEN (31)
LAYER-MODE-DIFFERENCE (32)
LAYER-MODE-ADDITION (33)
LAYER-MODE-SUBTRACT (34)
LAYER-MODE-DARKEN-ONLY (35)
LAYER-MODE-LIGHTEN-ONLY (36)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-HUE (37)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-SATURATION (38)
LAYER-MODE-HSL-COLOR (39)
LAYER-MODE-HSV-VALUE (40)
LAYER-MODE-DIVIDE (41)
LAYER-MODE-DODGE (42)
LAYER-MODE-BURN (43)
LAYER-MODE-HARDLIGHT (44)
LAYER-MODE-SOFTLIGHT (45)
LAYER-MODE-GRAIN-EXTRACT (46)
LAYER-MODE-GRAIN-MERGE (47)
LAYER-MODE-VIVID-LIGHT (48)
LAYER-MODE-PIN-LIGHT (49)
LAYER-MODE-LINEAR-LIGHT (50)
LAYER-MODE-HARD-MIX (51)
LAYER-MODE-EXCLUSION (52)
LAYER-MODE-LINEAR-BURN (53)
LAYER-MODE-LUMA-DARKEN-ONLY (54)
LAYER-MODE-LUMA-LIGHTEN-ONLY (55)
LAYER-MODE-LUMINANCE (56)
LAYER-MODE-COLOR-ERASE (57)
LAYER-MODE-ERASE (58)
LAYER-MODE-MERGE (59)
LAYER-MODE-SPLIT (60)
LAYER-MODE-PASS-THROUGH (61)
LAYER-MODE-REPLACE (62)
LAYER-MODE-ANTI-ERASE (63)
}
gradient-typeGIMP_PDB_INT32The type of gradient {
GRADIENT-LINEAR (0)
GRADIENT-BILINEAR (1)
GRADIENT-RADIAL (2)
GRADIENT-SQUARE (3)
GRADIENT-CONICAL-SYMMETRIC (4)
GRADIENT-CONICAL-ASYMMETRIC (5)
GRADIENT-SHAPEBURST-ANGULAR (6)
GRADIENT-SHAPEBURST-SPHERICAL (7)
GRADIENT-SHAPEBURST-DIMPLED (8)
GRADIENT-SPIRAL-CLOCKWISE (9)
GRADIENT-SPIRAL-ANTICLOCKWISE (10)
}
opacityGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe opacity of the final blend (0 <= opacity <= 100)
offsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATOffset relates to the starting and ending coordinates specified for the blend. This parameter is mode dependent. (offset >= 0)
repeatGIMP_PDB_INT32Repeat mode {
REPEAT-NONE (0)
REPEAT-SAWTOOTH (1)
REPEAT-TRIANGULAR (2)
REPEAT-TRUNCATE (3)
}
reverseGIMP_PDB_INT32Use the reverse gradient (TRUE or FALSE)
supersampleGIMP_PDB_INT32Do adaptive supersampling (TRUE or FALSE)
max-depthGIMP_PDB_INT32Maximum recursion levels for supersampling (1 <= max-depth <= 9)
thresholdGIMP_PDB_FLOATSupersampling threshold (0 <= threshold <= 4)
ditherGIMP_PDB_INT32Use dithering to reduce banding (TRUE or FALSE)
x1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe x coordinate of this blend's starting point
y1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe y coordinate of this blend's starting point
x2GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe x coordinate of this blend's ending point
y2GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe y coordinate of this blend's ending point
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-get-color-profile

NAME
gimp-image-get-color-profile
SYNOPSIS
num-bytes, profile-data = pdb.gimp_image_get_color_profile(image)
BLURB
Returns the image's color profile
HELP
This procedure returns the image's color profile, or NULL if the image has no color profile assigned.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
num-bytesGIMP_PDB_INT32Number of bytes in the color_profile array (num-bytes >= 0)
profile-dataGIMP_PDB_INT8ARRAYThe image's serialized color profile. The returned value must be freed with g_free()
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2015 Michael Natterer

plug-in-convmatrix

NAME
plug-in-convmatrix
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_convmatrix(run-mode, image, drawable, argc-matrix, matrix, alpha-alg, divisor, offset, argc-channels, channels, bmode)
BLURB
Apply a generic 5x5 convolution matrix
HELP
Apply a generic 5x5 convolution matrix.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
argc-matrixGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of elements in the following array, must always be 25 (argc-matrix >= 0)
matrixGIMP_PDB_FLOATARRAYThe 5x5 convolution matrix
alpha-algGIMP_PDB_INT32Enable weighting by alpha channel (TRUE or FALSE)
divisorGIMP_PDB_FLOATDivisor
offsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATOffset
argc-channelsGIMP_PDB_INT32The number of elements in following array, must always be 5 (argc-channels >= 0)
channelsGIMP_PDB_INT32ARRAYMask of the channels to be filtered
bmodeGIMP_PDB_INT32Mode for treating image borders {
EXTEND (0)
WRAP (1)
CLEAR (2)
} (0 <= bmode <= 2)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:convolution-matrix' for credits.
(c)2014 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:convolution-matrix' for credits.

gimp-register-save-handler

NAME
gimp-register-save-handler
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_register_save_handler(procedure-name, extensions, prefixes)
BLURB
Registers a file save handler procedure.
HELP
Registers a procedural database procedure to be called to save files in a particular file format.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
procedure-nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the procedure to be used for saving
extensionsGIMP_PDB_STRINGcomma separated list of extensions this handler can save (i.e. "jpg,jpeg")
prefixesGIMP_PDB_STRINGcomma separated list of prefixes this handler can save (i.e. "http:,ftp:")
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-selection-combine

NAME
gimp-selection-combine
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_selection_combine(channel, operation)
BLURB
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-image-select-item' instead.
HELP
Deprecated: Use 'gimp-image-select-item' instead.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
channelGIMP_PDB_CHANNELThe channel
operationGIMP_PDB_INT32The selection operation {
CHANNEL-OP-ADD (0)
CHANNEL-OP-SUBTRACT (1)
CHANNEL-OP-REPLACE (2)
CHANNEL-OP-INTERSECT (3)
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR

(c)

gimp-gradient-segment-set-left-pos

NAME
gimp-gradient-segment-set-left-pos
SYNOPSIS
final-pos = pdb.gimp_gradient_segment_set_left_pos(name, segment, pos)
BLURB
Sets the left endpoint position of the specified segment
HELP
This procedure sets the left endpoint position of the specified segment of the specified gradient. The final position will be between the position of the middle point to the left to the middle point of the current segment. This procedure returns the final position.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe gradient name
segmentGIMP_PDB_INT32The index of the segment within the gradient (segment >= 0)
posGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe position to set the guidepoint to (0 <= pos <= 1)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
final-posGIMP_PDB_FLOATThe return position
AUTHOR
Shlomi Fish
(c)2003 Shlomi Fish

gimp-item-transform-perspective

NAME
gimp-item-transform-perspective
SYNOPSIS
item = pdb.gimp_item_transform_perspective(item, x0, y0, x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3)
BLURB
Perform a possibly non-affine transformation on the specified item.
HELP
This procedure performs a possibly non-affine transformation on the specified item by allowing the corners of the original bounding box to be arbitrarily remapped to any values. The 4 coordinates specify the new locations of each corner of the original bounding box. By specifying these values, any affine transformation (rotation, scaling, translation) can be affected. Additionally, these values can be specified such that the resulting transformed item will appear to have been projected via a perspective transform. If a selection exists and the item is a drawable, the portion of the drawable which lies under the selection is cut from the drawable and made into a floating selection which is then transformed as specified. The return value is the ID of the transformed floating selection. If there is no selection or the item is not a drawable, the entire item will be transformed according to the specified mapping. Additionally, if the item has its linked flag set to TRUE, all additional items contained in the image which have the linked flag set to TRUE will also be transformed the same way. The return value will be equal to the item ID supplied as input. This procedure is affected by the following context setters: 'gimp-context-set-interpolation', 'gimp-context-set-transform-direction', 'gimp-context-set-transform-resize'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe affected item
x0GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of upper-left corner of original bounding box
y0GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of upper-left corner of original bounding box
x1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of upper-right corner of original bounding box
y1GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of upper-right corner of original bounding box
x2GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of lower-left corner of original bounding box
y2GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of lower-left corner of original bounding box
x3GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new x coordinate of lower-right corner of original bounding box
y3GIMP_PDB_FLOATThe new y coordinate of lower-right corner of original bounding box
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe transformed item
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

gimp-item-get-expanded

NAME
plug-in-maze
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_maze(run-mode, image, drawable, width, height, tileable, algorithm, seed, multiple, offset)
BLURB
Draw a labyrinth
HELP
Generates a maze using either the depth-first search method or Prim's algorithm. Can make tileable mazes too.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
RUN-WITH-LAST-VALS (2)
}

drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEInput drawable
widthGIMP_PDB_INT16Width of the passages
heightGIMP_PDB_INT16Height of the passages
tileableGIMP_PDB_INT8Tileable maze? (TRUE or FALSE)
algorithmGIMP_PDB_INT8Generation algorithm (0 = DEPTH FIRST, 1 = PRIM'S ALGORITHM)
seedGIMP_PDB_INT32Random Seed
multipleGIMP_PDB_INT16Multiple (use 57)
offsetGIMP_PDB_INT16Offset (use 1)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:maze' for credits.
(c)2015 Compatibility procedure. Please see 'gegl:maze' for credits.

gimp-context-set-antialias

NAME
gimp-context-set-antialias
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_antialias(antialias)
BLURB
Set the antialias setting.
HELP
This procedure modifies the antialias setting. If antialiasing is turned on, the edges of selected region will contain intermediate values which give the appearance of a sharper, less pixelized edge. This should be set as TRUE most of the time unless a binary-only selection is wanted. This setting affects the following procedures: 'gimp-image-select-color', 'gimp-image-select-contiguous-color', 'gimp-image-select-round-rectangle', 'gimp-image-select-ellipse', 'gimp-image-select-polygon', 'gimp-image-select-item', 'gimp-drawable-edit-bucket-fill', 'gimp-drawable-edit-stroke-item', 'gimp-drawable-edit-stroke-selection'.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
antialiasGIMP_PDB_INT32The antialias setting (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2010 Michael Natterer

plug-in-sample-colorize

NAME
plug-in-sample-colorize
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_sample_colorize(run-mode, image, dst-drawable, sample-drawable, hold-inten, orig-inten, rnd-subcolors, guess-missing, in-low, in-high, gamma, out-low, out-high)
BLURB
Colorize image using a sample image as a guide
HELP
This plug-in colorizes the contents of the specified (gray) layer with the help of a sample (color) layer. It analyzes all colors in the sample layer. The sample colors are sorted by brightness (== intentisty) and amount and stored in a sample colortable (where brightness is the index) The pixels of the destination layer are remapped with the help of the sample colortable. If use_subcolors is TRUE, the remapping process uses all sample colors of the corresponding brightness-intensity and distributes the subcolors according to their amount in the sample (If the sample has 5 green, 3 yellow, and 1 red pixel of the intensity value 105, the destination pixels at intensity value 105 are randomly painted in green, yellow and red in a relation of 5:3:1 If use_subcolors is FALSE only one sample color per intensity is used. (green will be used in this example) The brightness intensity value is transformed at the remapping process according to the levels: out_lo, out_hi, in_lo, in_high and gamma The in_low / in_high levels specify an initial mapping of the intensity. The gamma value determines how intensities are interpolated between the in_lo and in_high levels. A gamma value of 1.0 results in linear interpolation. Higher gamma values results in more high-level intensities Lower gamma values results in more low-level intensities The out_low/out_high levels constrain the resulting intensity index The intensity index is used to pick the corresponding color in the sample colortable. If hold_inten is FALSE the picked color is used 1:1 as resulting remap_color. If hold_inten is TRUE The brightness of the picked color is adjusted back to the origial intensity value (only hue and saturation are taken from the picked sample color) (or to the input level, if orig_inten is set FALSE) Works on both Grayscale and RGB image with/without alpha channel. (the image with the dst_drawable is converted to RGB if necessary) The sample_drawable should be of type RGB or RGBA
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEInput image (unused)
dst-drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable to be colorized (Type GRAY* or RGB*)
sample-drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLESample drawable (should be of Type RGB or RGBA)
hold-intenGIMP_PDB_INT32hold brightness intensity levels (TRUE, FALSE)
orig-intenGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE: hold brightness of original intensity levels. FALSE: Hold Intensity of input levels
rnd-subcolorsGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE: Use all subcolors of same intensity, FALSE: use only one color per intensity
guess-missingGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE: guess samplecolors for the missing intensity values FALSE: use only colors found in the sample
in-lowGIMP_PDB_INT32intensity of lowest input (0 <= in_low <= 254)
in-highGIMP_PDB_INT32intensity of highest input (1 <= in_high <= 255)
gammaGIMP_PDB_FLOATgamma adjustment factor (0.1 <= gamma <= 10) where 1.0 is linear
out-lowGIMP_PDB_INT32lowest sample color intensity (0 <= out_low <= 254)
out-highGIMP_PDB_INT32highest sample color intensity (1 <= out_high <= 255)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Wolfgang Hofer
(c)02/2000 hof@@hotbot.com

gimp-gradient-segment-get-left-pos

NAME

gimp-display-new

NAME
gimp-display-new
SYNOPSIS
display = pdb.gimp_display_new(image)
BLURB
Create a new display for the specified image.
HELP
Creates a new display for the specified image. If the image already has a display, another is added. Multiple displays are handled transparently by GIMP. The newly created display is returned and can be subsequently destroyed with a call to 'gimp-display-delete'. This procedure only makes sense for use with the GIMP UI, and will result in an execution error if called when GIMP has no UI.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe image
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
displayGIMP_PDB_DISPLAYThe new display
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-image-undo-disable

NAME
gimp-image-undo-disable
SYNOPSIS
disabled = pdb.gimp_image_undo_disable(image)
BLURB
Disable the image's undo stack.
HELP
This procedure disables the image's undo stack, allowing subsequent operations to ignore their undo steps. This is generally called in conjunction with 'gimp-image-undo-enable' to temporarily disable an image undo stack. This is advantageous because saving undo steps can be time and memory intensive.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION

RETURN VALUES

(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-unit-get-digits

NAME
gimp-unit-get-digits
SYNOPSIS
digits = pdb.gimp_unit_get_digits(unit-id)
BLURB
Returns the number of digits of the unit.
HELP
This procedure returns the number of digits you should provide in input or output functions to get approximately the same accuracy as with two digits and inches. Note that asking for the digits of "pixels" will produce an error.

(c)1999 Michael Natterer

gimp-drawable-histogram

NAME
gimp-drawable-histogram
SYNOPSIS
mean, std-dev, median, pixels, count, percentile = pdb.gimp_drawable_histogram(drawable, channel, start-range, end-range)
BLURB
Returns information on the intensity histogram for the specified drawable.
HELP
This tool makes it possible to gather information about the intensity histogram of a drawable. A channel to examine is first specified. This can be either value, red, green, or blue, depending on whether the drawable is of type color or grayscale. Second, a range of intensities are specified. The 'gimp-drawable-histogram' function returns statistics based on the pixels in the drawable that fall under this range of values. Mean, standard deviation, median, number of pixels, and percentile are all returned. Additionally, the total count of pixels in the image is returned. Counts of pixels are weighted by any associated alpha values and by the current selection mask. That is, pixels that lie outside an active selection mask will not be counted. Similarly, pixels with transparent alpha values will not be counted. The returned mean, std_dev and median are in the range (0..255) for 8-bit images or if the plug-in is not precision-aware, and in the range (0.0..1.0) otherwise.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
channelGIMP_PDB_INT32The channel to query {
HISTOGRAM-VALUE (0)
HISTOGRAM-RED (1)
HISTOGRAM-GREEN (2)
HISTOGRAM-BLUE (3)
HISTOGRAM-ALPHA (4)
HISTOGRAM-LUMINANCE (5)
HISTOGRAM-RGB (6)
}
start-rangeGIMP_PDB_FLOATStart of the intensity measurement range (0 <= start-range <= 1)
end-rangeGIMP_PDB_FLOATEnd of the intensity measurement range (0 <= end-range <= 1)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
meanGIMP_PDB_FLOATMean intensity value
std-devGIMP_PDB_FLOATStandard deviation of intensity values
medianGIMP_PDB_FLOATMedian intensity value
pixelsGIMP_PDB_FLOATAlpha-weighted pixel count for entire image
countGIMP_PDB_FLOATAlpha-weighted pixel count for range
percentileGIMP_PDB_FLOATPercentile that range falls under
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-drawable-hue-saturation

NAME
gimp-drawable-hue-saturation
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_drawable_hue_saturation(drawable, hue-range, hue-offset, lightness, saturation, overlap)
BLURB
Modify hue, lightness, and saturation in the specified drawable.
HELP
This procedure allows the hue, lightness, and saturation in the specified drawable to be modified. The 'hue-range' parameter provides the capability to limit range of affected hues. The 'overlap' parameter provides blending into neighboring hue channels when rendering.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable
hue-rangeGIMP_PDB_INT32Range of affected hues {
HUE-RANGE-ALL (0)
HUE-RANGE-RED (1)
HUE-RANGE-YELLOW (2)
HUE-RANGE-GREEN (3)
HUE-RANGE-CYAN (4)
HUE-RANGE-BLUE (5)
HUE-RANGE-MAGENTA (6)
}
hue-offsetGIMP_PDB_FLOATHue offset in degrees (-180 <= hue-offset <= 180)
lightnessGIMP_PDB_FLOATLightness modification (-100 <= lightness <= 100)
saturationGIMP_PDB_FLOATSaturation modification (-100 <= saturation <= 100)
overlapGIMP_PDB_FLOATOverlap other hue channels (0 <= overlap <= 100)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

plug-in-hot

NAME
plug-in-hot
SYNOPSIS
pdb.plug_in_hot(run-mode, image, drawable, mode, action, new-layer)
BLURB
Find and fix pixels that may be unsafely bright
HELP
hot scans an image for pixels that will give unsave values of chrominance or composite signale amplitude when encoded into an NTSC or PAL signal. Three actions can be performed on these ``hot'' pixels. (0) reduce luminance, (1) reduce saturation, or (2) Blacken.
MENUPATH
GIMP Plug-In
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
run-modeGIMP_PDB_INT32The run mode {
RUN-INTERACTIVE (0)
RUN-NONINTERACTIVE (1)
}
imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe Image
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe Drawable
modeGIMP_PDB_INT32Mode {
NTSC (0)
PAL (1)
}
actionGIMP_PDB_INT32The action to perform
new-layerGIMP_PDB_INT32Create a new layer {
TRUE
FALSE
}
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Eric L. Hernes, Alan Wm Paeth
(c)1997 Eric L. Hernes

gimp-layer-new-from-drawable

NAME
gimp-layer-new-from-drawable
SYNOPSIS
layer-copy = pdb.gimp_layer_new_from_drawable(drawable, dest-image)
BLURB
Create a new layer by copying an existing drawable.
HELP
This procedure creates a new layer as a copy of the specified drawable. The new layer still needs to be added to the image, as this is not automatic. Add the new layer with the 'gimp-image-insert-layer' command. Other attributes such as layer mask modes, and offsets should be set with explicit procedure calls.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe source drawable from where the new layer is copied
dest-imageGIMP_PDB_IMAGEThe destination image to which to add the layer
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
layer-copyGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe newly copied layer
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-edit-paste

NAME
gimp-edit-paste
SYNOPSIS
floating-sel = pdb.gimp_edit_paste(drawable, paste-into)
BLURB
Paste buffer to the specified drawable.
HELP
This procedure pastes a copy of the internal GIMP edit buffer to the specified drawable. The GIMP edit buffer will be empty unless a call was previously made to either 'gimp-edit-cut' or 'gimp-edit-copy'. The "paste_into" option specifies whether to clear the current image selection, or to paste the buffer "behind" the selection. This allows the selection to act as a mask for the pasted buffer. Anywhere that the selection mask is non-zero, the pasted buffer will show through. The pasted buffer will be a new layer in the image which is designated as the image floating selection. If the image has a floating selection at the time of pasting, the old floating selection will be anchored to its drawable before the new floating selection is added. This procedure returns the new floating layer. The resulting floating selection will already be attached to the specified drawable, and a subsequent call to floating_sel_attach is not needed.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
drawableGIMP_PDB_DRAWABLEThe drawable to paste to
paste-intoGIMP_PDB_INT32Clear selection, or paste behind it? (TRUE or FALSE)
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
floating-selGIMP_PDB_LAYERThe new floating selection
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

gimp-item-is-selection

NAME
gimp-item-is-selection
SYNOPSIS
selection = pdb.gimp_item_is_selection(item)
BLURB
Returns whether the item is a selection.
HELP
This procedure returns TRUE if the specified item is a selection.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
itemGIMP_PDB_ITEMThe item
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
selectionGIMP_PDB_INT32TRUE if the item is a selection, FALSE otherwise (TRUE or FALSE)
AUTHOR
Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis
(c)1995-1996 Spencer Kimball & Peter Mattis

color = pdb.gimp_palette_entry_get_color(name, entry-num)
BLURB

HELP

(c)2004 Michael Natterer

gimp-context-set-dynamics

NAME
gimp-context-set-dynamics
SYNOPSIS
pdb.gimp_context_set_dynamics(name)
BLURB
Set the specified paint dynamics as the active paint dynamics.
HELP
This procedure allows the active paint dynamics to be set by specifying its name. The name is simply a string which corresponds to one of the names of the installed paint dynamics. If there is no matching paint dynamics found, this procedure will return an error. Otherwise, the specified paint dynamics becomes active and will be used in all subsequent paint operations.
MENUPATH
Internal GIMP procedure
INPUT ARGUMENTS
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
nameGIMP_PDB_STRINGThe name of the paint dynamics
RETURN VALUES
NAMETYPEDESCRIPTION
AUTHOR
Michael Natterer
(c)2011 Michael Natterer

CHANNEL-OP-SUBTRACT (1)
CHANNEL-OP-REPLACE (2)
CHANNEL-OP-INTERSECT (3)
}
